comentarios: Excellent characters, excellent music and astoudingly good art. One of the most high-quality, high-effort Visual Novels I've played in some time.   I'd really advise against getting the +18 patch though. A lot of people could argue that the whole "heat" arc was essential to the plot, but I think these were made just for the sake of fanservice and do not actually contribute anything meaningful to the story or overall game. They're just SO stretched out, awkward and plain unpleasant. One of the few ocassions where I would intentionally turn down and skip hentai scenes in a VN, or any game for that matter.  Aside from that though, it's a solid 8/10. Definitely worth the purchase

comentarios: Let me spin you a tale of my life. Back when I was a lad somewhere in my first or second year of highschool a friend said, "hey, do you want Nekopara?" and I, being the innocent pure lad I was, said "sure" because I thought, "man this'll be funny to have." So I had it, and I sat on it, then sometime later I say "haha you know what would be really funny? If I got all the achievements" so I booted up Nekopara and spammed my way through the game, ultimately taking up three hours of my life. All achievements unlocked and three hours on my account. It was at that point that I realized something. How can people tell I was joking? I tell friends this story but part of me worries "what if they don't believe me? what if people start thinking that I actually wanted a visual novel about catgirls? What do I do now?" To tell you the truth I still have no answer to that question, but, it was free, and it led to a friend gifting me "Slender: Hentai Edition" several years later. So, in the end I may forever be tainted in the eyes of others, but I got free stuff, and for me, the greedy rat bastard I am, that's a good deal. But to be completely honest, do I recommend this? Eh, it's not really my thing, but if you're reading reviews with the hope of finding out if it's actually good or not I just gotta say: come on man. You know what you're getting, descend into degeneracy or rise above us plebians who forever have our libraries stained by the Japanese catgirls.

comentarios: This game saved my life.  I am 31.  My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.  When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.  After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.  Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay. After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.  Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.  I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.  Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.  Thank you

comentarios: So, in short this is a high quality 4-6 hour erotic Visual Novel for cat lovers. If you have a cat, you'll like this game.  [Noteworthy Stuff]:  -You need to buy an 18+ patch to scene any lewd content.  -There's a total of 3 s*x scenes that play out towards the later hours, all of which you can revisit in a CG Gallery, Scene Gallery, and Video Gallery at the title screen. They're mostly pictures but a few parts in the scenes have *thrusting*. All 3 are fairly long with quite a bit of text and dialogue to go with it.  -Fully voiced (in Japanese) for all characters except you (i read my parts out loud for deeper immersion) [but i read them in english so idk if my catgirls understood me...]  -At the title screen, in 'Extras', there's a CG Gallery, Scene Gallery, Music Gallery, And Video Gallery. They all unlock as you progress.  -There's a slider where you can adjust how bouncy the breasts are. Also, press P at any given time to make them bounce at will. With great power, comes great responsibility... (!!!)  -It's a straight VN, so there's no interaction or dialogue options. It's pretty text heavy and you gotta play a while before you hit the lewd scenes. Think of it like a manga but with jiggle physics ^.^  -There's a Log where you can backtrack to re-read stuff but no 'back' button to rewind scenes like in other VN's. There's also an auto-forward mode with it's own settings (for hands-free play) and a Skip button that only works after you've passed a scene once.  Lastly, I'd strongly recommend getting this on sale because of the length and price. Especially because you're gonna want that 18+ patch that you have to buy on top of buying the game. Then you're gonna wanna buy Vol. 2, which also requires you to buy another 18+ patch. Then Vol. 3 and you get where this is going. So ya.   Meow on, cat daddies (and mommies) ^.^

comentarios: Was on call with a friend. Can confirmed he skipped through Nekopara without reading it. Based. You cannot even begin to comprehend the hours wasted of your life in order to read a casual visual novel, but here he is skipping a 4/5 hour visual novel. Compare that shit to Fate/Stay Night, Steins Gate, and god forbid, Clannad. 80 fucking hours for one route out of multiples you gotta unlock and he merely skipped one the size of a 2 bit bite sized lunchable snack. Whats worse is that he didnt have the NSFW content so he didnt get the full experience. My disappointment is immeasurable and every time i read a visual novel i will forever be reminded there is scum like him who speed run the entire fucking thing.  My day is ruined.   I have a dream. That one day every person in this nation will read visual novels without skipping them. A nation of the truly enlightened, dammit. A nation of BIG BRAIN, not MONKE, ruled by the pen, not the sword! Where the person changes to suit the visual novel, not the other way around. Where time and commitment are back where they belong: in the hands of the visual novels! Where every visual novel is free to read - to be read - without being skipped! Fuck all these limp-dick hentai enthusiast and chickenshit trophy hunters. Fuck this 24-hour Internet spew of cheat guides and hacking bullshit! FUCK ALL OF IT! Modern Visual Novels are diseased. Rotten to the core. There's no saving them - we need to drag them out by the coding. Wipe the slate clean. BURN IT DOWN! And from the ashes, a new era of visual novels will be born. Evolved, but untamed! The bite-sized visual novels will be purged and the longest bible-sized will thrive - free to make as much revenue as they see fit, they'll make visual novels great again!... In my new visual novel market, people will read and enjoy visual novels for what they BELIEVE! Not for hentai. Not for achievements! Not for what they're told to read. Every man will be free to read of his own choice!  This is the only thing i know for real and is that it has to be this way!  (For all intensive purposes this is a meme, not an attempt to overthrow the economy or start a riot. If it does, i am not to blame. Do recommend the game. Its a classic VN)

comentarios: After seeing all the accolades, I decided to take a chance when this title went on sale....and I now regret it.  First, if you are interested in this title for its erotic content, know ahead of time that this content was completely removed by Steam.  If you desire that content, you need to go to the developer's website and pay $10 for a patch to restore the content.  Second, if you are interested in this title for its storyline, I personally found it dull and tiresome.  Seiously, the story basically goes like this:  Vanilla:  Master, can we have shampoo for our hair? Chocola: You are mean!  We want shampoo for our hair! Narrator:  We did not come to the market to buy shampoo. Vanilla: (whines) But we want shampoo! Chocola:  The shampoo makes our hair nice. Both: PLEASE! Narrator: No, we are here to buy grocieries.  and on.....and on...and on....  This isn't quite verbatim, but it's an accurate reflection.  Third, if you're interested in the anime graphics, they are fine, but I've seen both far better and far worse.  Admittedly, I could invest more hours of my life into this "game" and hope it gets better, but since the beginning failed to grab my attention (the first rule of writing a good book is to seize the reader's attention--because this is really a book, not a game), it doesn't bode well.  I do not recommend it.  EDIT:   I forced myself to finish Nekopara 1.  It does eventually get better, and there are some erotic scenes, but you have to grind through a lot of annoying dialogue to get there.  I'm currently playing Nekopara 2 which gets to the action more quickly.  There's enough dialogue to develop the characters without it getting annoying.  I think that the developers learned from the first one and made the second one better.

comentarios: [h1]Introduction[/h1] [b]Nekopara[/b] is a kinetic visual novel developed by [b]NEKO WORKs[/b] and published by [b]Sekai Project[/b]. There has been a lot of hype about this series since its release in 2014 and I have finally decided to give it a chance to see how it lives up to all the praise. There are a total of four volumes and a prequel in this series so I have chosen to start with the first game that was released, volume 1.  [h1]Story[/h1] [b]Kashou Minazuki[/b] is the son of a long line of Japanese confection makers. One day, he decides to move out and start his own bakery called [b]La Soleil[/b]. When he arrives at his new location, two large boxes appear and upon opening them, he found two catgirls named [b]Chocola[/b] and [b]Vanilla[/b] packed inside. Originally, they were at [b]Kashou’s[/b] old home and owned by his younger sister [b]Shigure Minaduki[/b]. The two catgirls feel that [b]Kashou[/b] is their true owner and followed him to his new location. https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2549208026  [b]Kashou[/b] tried to send them back but they begged and pleaded until he eventually gave in to their pleas. The two catgirls at hand, who really love their master, will try their best to help run the bakery and will do their very best with varying results.  [h1]Pros and Cons[/h1] [b]Pros[/b] [list] [*]A cute kinetic VN with cute catgirls [*]Interesting characters that show development throughout the story [*]Beautiful art style that is very pleasing to look at [/list]  [b]Cons[/b] [list] [*]The story is very bland and lacks excitement [*]I do have some issues with the characters [*]Some people may be turned off by some of the sexual storyline aspects [/list]  [h1]Characters[/h1] Every catgirl you meet is cute and has a different personality. They learn and grow in the world around them. [b]Chocola[/b] and [b]Vanilla[/b] particularly are new to the outside world so their interactions tend to be very childlike at first. There are a group of characters that you will meet but this volume focuses on [b]Chocola[/b] and [b]Vanilla[/b] so I’ll be covering those two respectively. https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2549208475 You follow in the footsteps of [b]Kashou[/b] and we are in his perspective throughout the story. He is easygoing and is willing to lend a hand whenever he can, however, at times he can be a bit dense. Sometimes he is incapable of getting hints and has to be told directly what's on someone's mind.  [b]Chocola[/b] is cheerful, has a dog-like personality, and is very fond of her master [b]Kashou[/b] so much that she wants his attention. At the same time, she is energetic, friendly, and well-loved by those around her. [b]Chocola[/b] has a hard time doing difficult tasks and tends to leap into action without thinking of the consequences.  [b]Vanilla[/b] is the twin sister of [b]Chocola[/b] and is the exact opposite in terms of personality as she is quiet and calm. She can be smart but does prefer to do things on her own, however, she does remain kind-hearted and well-liked.  Out of the two, [b]Vanilla[/b] is my personal favorite due to her quiet nature and I would personally like to hang around her more than her hyper sister.  [h1]Problems with the story[/h1] The story is good but unfortunately, it falls short in many areas that prevent it from being anything more than average. There are no events that would serve to add excitement to the story instead I found myself more just waiting for the spicy scenes to happen as the primary focus. We do get to see [b]Kashou’s[/b] bakery gain gradual success, but it is not much else there.  Next, I have issues with two characters. Now I should point out that I do not hate these two in any shape or form but I still have problems with them.   [b]Chocola[/b] is the first character that I found issues with. While I didn't hate her character, I found her to be a big attention magnet in general. This is subjective of course, but I did not like how more attention was put on her compared to her twin sister [b]Vanilla[/b]. I understand that [b]Vanilla[/b] is meant to be the quiet one, but characters like that typically get their very own big moment and story segment. Unfortunately, this never happens so she becomes more of a background character being completely taken over by [b]Chocola[/b]. I feel some more time would have been nice on the other cat girl, especially when they did such a good job making her equally as interesting.  Then, there is [b]Kashou[/b], he falls flat in terms of character development. He does not really do much outside his focus on the bakery. There was a moment where he did talk about leaving his family due to some issues, however, this was not touched upon further in the story. I don’t know if this is tackled in the other volumes but it’s left untouched in this volume leaving us with a boring main protagonist.  The final issue I have is that some of the sexual story elements may be a turnoff for some people. If you are looking for a cute kind of VN, then [b]Nekopara[/b] does offer that, however, it will be drowned out with the spicy scenes later on.  [h1]Artstyle, Performance, and Soundtrack[/h1] The art style is something that I was really impressed with. There are some really beautiful scenes that you will be able to see throughout the game and each is very detailed. [b]Nekopara[/b] should run fine on any computer due to this being mostly pictures, music, and text. I came across no issues while I was playing. I tested the game on an NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 3GB, AMD Ryzen 5 1500X Quad-Core Processor 3.50, with16 GB of RAM.  https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2549208605 The soundtrack is an area that could have been shown some more love. There were no tracks that were bad or distracting, but also none that stood out or were memorable. The music choices simply fit the requirement of having background music while you play through the story.  There is an 18+ patch that is available for 11.49 CDN through Steam. This adds adult content that further shows how the relationship between Kashou and the girls develops. The patch includes three segments of H-scenes that are animated and fully voiced that are very well done. Personally I believe these scenes help complete the experience and should absolutely be picked up if you enjoy adult content in visual novels.   I also recommend going into the options settings and maxing out the chest jiggle physics. After that, press the "P" button on your keyboard during the regular dialogue scenes as you are in for a cute treat. This function will work with or without the patch.  [h1]Final Verdict[/h1] If you like are looking to play a visual novel with cute catgirls, then [b]Nekopara[/b] will most definitely meet your needs in this area. It has a nice charm with standout art in both the character and background scenes. As this is a kinetic visual novel, there aren't any dialogue choices that will change the routes or endings of the game, so be sure to temper your expectations as you are getting more of a story with cute cat girls more than something that will feel like a game.  I recommend [b]Nekopara[/b] to anyone who loves catgirls as I felt that even looking at the shortcomings developer [b]NEKO WORKs[/b] absolutely knows how to do catgirls. ;3  I also recommend getting the 18+ patch, you get the full experience of the story, and don’t forget to max the chest jiggle.  [quote]Looking for more reviews like this one? Then follow [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/5297658/]Life Needs a Little Sin [/url][/quote]

comentarios: I once again have nothing but positive words to say about this game. following Vol.0 it has continued to be a beacon for my healing mental state, every day for months I would feel extreme emotion about going home and being able to take care of my kittens. it was a constant cycle of anxiety whenever I left my house. I didn't want my kittens to think I didn't care for them but they seemed to understand that I needed to work and would wait patiently for me to get back home. After some time though I couldn't take the anxiety and stress that was leaving my silly little bakas at home. I couldn't go a millisecond of my day without thinking about them. It got to the point where I was hearing their voices behind the counter of GameStop asking me to pet them. I couldn't hear my own thoughts and my ability to communicate with other people began to diminish. it got to the point where I couldn't even talk to people anymore. the second I stepped out of my home I heard Chocola and Vanilla begging me to come back to them. I couldn't take it. I knew that they were ok with me leaving for work but I wasn't. So good news!!! I quit!!! my anxiety and stress calmed after I was able to come back to my kittens and stay with them for my entire day. I decided to learn how to code in python, java, and c++ so I could supply for myself and my kittens from home. it was really stressful cramming 3 whole coding languages into my brain before the money my parents left me ran dry but I barely managed to make it finally landing a coding job after running out of money and eating nothing but dry cup noodles since my water was cut. Life has never been better for me though. constant feelings of joy while my catgirls are happy. My new job supplies more money than my old one and I just couldn't ask for a better situation. this game has completely revolutionized my life, making me a new person. my love for this game will never hit a limit as it is infinite. My love is ever-expanding like the universe. I genuinely cannot recommend this game more. It picked me up and put, me on my feet. it supported me through not only one mentally ill phase but two. And hey even though the second one was triggered by the game it is self it was never to hurt me. I've never been healthier and happier. this game has brought me to new highs and even though it brought me close to a low it was only for my own good as afterwords I'm better than ever. please throw your money at this game, you won't regret it.

comentarios: Slow to start, but it gets better as you progress through the chapters. Unfortunately, if you're looking for a game to interact with then you're better off purchasing any of the other Nekopara games in the series as this one functions more as an animated visual novel.   Again, there is an 18+ adult content DLC if that interests you.   The music is a little repetitive and there are large gaps in which there is no audio outside of the background music since Kashou has no spoken lines. There is also a large amount of time in which the story focuses on the same image. I adjusted my settings to allow for the auto play feature to be active so it may be better to leave the text speed alone and navigate yourself if you don't want such lengthy scenes.   All in all, it's a sweet story and I did enjoy it. Even if it was a tad dry in places.

comentarios: My heart and soul can't take it anymore!  Ok so it all started when i discovered this cute little anime called Nekopara. I watched a couple of episodes which i really enjoyed, the cute vibes from it honestly warmed my heart and soul.  The next day(which is today) i watch a couple more episodes, and what can i say im really loving the whole cat girl concept they have. I really loved it for being such a cute, family friendly, and innocent show. After a couple episodes i call it a day, leave some episodes for other days.  As i was about to leave my browser i suddenly remember hearing that nekopara the anime originally came from it's game. Out of curiosity i searched it up. It said Nekopara is "from an adult visual novel", and that the game was 18+. I thought to myself "what's so 18+ about cat girls serving people in a restaurant"(i only assumed that this was what the game was about). Out of disbelief i searched "is nekopara 18+?". Google answered yes, "what really?" i thought to myself, so i decided to click images... And what i saw would continue to haunt me for the rest of my days. Immediately after seeing the dozens and dozens of nsfw nekopara images, my heart sunk, and my soul commited suicide, and shock froze my body still. I was very depressed(and still am) to find out that the cute and happy anime that i so enjoyed came from a fucking hentai game.  I am very sad, angry, and depressed right now. Im not sure how im supposed to cope with this sudden and shocking revelation, but thank you for listening till the end of my rant and goodbye, i shall cry in a corner for a solid hour now.

comentarios: [h1]I played Nekopara for the plot I swear[/h1] [i]That's half the reason at least[/i]  [b]The Plot[/b]  The plot of Nekopara is actually really well written, for a game that seems like its dedicated to be lewd, it's actually quite wholesome. You, Kashou is a man who has just moved and got a new bakery. But, from his past, the neko's catgirls he once looked down to as little daughters have shown up, and are looking to stay for long term. Of course, this isn't smooth sailing, but Kashou agrees and the catgirls are now workers at the store. A long the rest of the game, they do many different kind of activities like walk around, and "stuff". The last chapters of the story are a lot more loved-related, and is pretty cheesy. But, it works pretty well. I give the plot a [b]9/10[/b]  [b]THE MUSIC YOOOOOOOOOOOO[/b]  THE MUSIC IN NEKOPARA IS FIRE!!! There is literally a song that sounds like an altered version of "Sweden" by c418. Then, there is the slow melodies, the ones that are like, wow, this is wholesome. Then there is the PepeJAM songs. If the plot doesn't work, but listen to the soundtrack. I give the music a [b] 10/10 [/b]  [b]The nsfw content [/b]  How do I describe the nsfw content. I'd say that it is so good, that it feels wrong. I don't want to get into the details, but if you want an hour long session, Nekopara literally provides. But, it is very wholesome, and it seems like the catgirls actually enjoy it. I give the nsfw content a 9/10  [b]Summary[/b]  You will either be into nekopara, or really into nekopara. There isn't a choice. This game has a little something for everyone -IGN. Also, you can find the visual novels online, but please support the creator by buying these games.

comentarios: My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realised what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

comentarios: Awful waste of time. I bought it as a lark, but I was still shocked by how terrible this was. The story is awful: played through half of this game's chapters, and literally nothing has happened. One of the only two pieces of conflict in the first half of this boring snooze-fest was the Catgirl Certificate Exam thing, and it gets resolved off-screen 20 minutes after it's introduced.  The other conflict was about how the stupid MC didn't want to have two eager to help cute mascot girls hanging around his newly cafe. Bro, isn't it obvious that they'd benefit your business immensely? So, to recap: the only two things that actually happen in the fist half this story: one of them happens only because the MC is incredibly stupid, and the other is resolved immediately. The soundtrack is sappy garbage, the character designs are OK at best, the story is almost non existent, the characters are one-dimensional and uninteresting. Absolutely worthless.

comentarios: I know the joke is to review this well because of how degenerate the concept is but to be fully honest there are some parts of the story that could unfold into interesting and engaging plot points.  But the writers never notice that and squander their chances to tell that.  An example being the "bells", basically a dog tag that shows that a cat girl is trained: I find it interesting that the choc and vanilla are so proud of being owned, seeing the bell as a sort of mark of maturity, but the story never goes into simple things like whats the fail rate of catgirls that take the test or why there is even bells in the first place, instead it uses it for some cheap gags and a little tension.  TLDR; choc and vanilla have no personality, have the same bland hair cut and have sex with the mc right in the middle of the story, leaving the rest of the plot after that to flounder trying to find interesting things to do besides showing off the two main girls being mentally retarded for cuteness, you also have to pay for the sex scenes.

comentarios: My family struggled for food, we lived in Iraq at the time. I had no motivation, I was depressed, lonely, and barely managed to get out of bed each day. One day I finally brought myself to go on discord for the first time in a year and had a single dm from my only friend. All it said was "nekopara." I took a sip of my final glass of water (the water hole ran out) and downloaded it, it took 40 hours (best internet in the area). Immediately after mere seconds of opening it, I finally felt encouraged to do something. I applied for every job in my area and managed to secure 47 out of 10 of them, I worked all day long week after week, and finally managed to leave Iraq (without my family) and now I spend my days playing nekopara. I wish to do nothing else with my life. I am in love with Nekopara.

comentarios: This game saved my life.  I am 41.  My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.  When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.  After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.  Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay. After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.  Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.  I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.  Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.  Thank you

comentarios: This game saved my life.  I am 41.  My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.  When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.  After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.  Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay. After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.  Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.  I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.  Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

comentarios: Cons: - My dad doesn't talk to me anymore - My friends think I am an utter degenerate - My mum kicked me out the house - I have lost my dignity  Pros: - The catgirls are kinda cute    But in all seriousness: Nekopara is rather well made for a visual novel. Characters eyes and mouths are animated, there are a variety of different sprites and heads as well as tails and ears are responsive. Also there is a Chest Bounciness slider. Probably one of the better Visual Novels out there from a technical standpoint. And besides that it is a massive meme, a cult classic. Nekopara is legendary for a reason.  To everyone who doesn't need repsect from those around them and is willing to sacrifice their dignity:  Give this game a shot

comentarios: Do yourself a favour and play Volume 1 of Nekopara.  This is the very first game of the series and it really helped set the standard of the future titles. Visual novels are usually dependant on their style, and Volume 1 absolutely nailed it.  One thing that immediately jumps out at you is the music. It. Is. Amazing. Visual novel music just has that certain feel to it, and this game is a perfect representation of that. It's like playing Doki Doki Literature Club for the first time and taking a minute to appreciate the music. It's just so warm and nice, and fits the style of the game so well for some reason. It also has emotional pieces in the game, and those emotional songs are really tender and tug at your heart strings. The music is awesome, and I wish I could see more people appreciating it.  The artwork in this game is also something that immediately jumps out at you. It's just so well made. You can really tell that NekoWorks went all out with how they wanted this game to look. The thing is, the artwork and character sprites are used in future volumes, but you don't get tired of seeing it. I think that this series' artwork is some of the best I've seen, and it's in a visual novel alone. Really amazing stuff.  The voice acting is super good, and very cute. The characters are really sweet and the VAs did such a good job at playing their roles. That's really all I can say, it's just superb.  I have to admit, I saw this game pop into my recommended feed, and it looked interesting, so I made a mental note of it in my head. At the time, all I saw were cute catgirls and thought "I wonder if this will be some strange dating sim", but it turned out to be a really sweet game with a neat story! It's not choice based at all, meaning that you don't have to worry about making any game changing decisions at any point.  At face value, the game is a silly story about a man making love to catgirls, but honestly? Getting to know Chocola and Vanilla and seeing their relationship with the protagonist (Kashou) develop is one of the sweetest things I've seen. This game made me feel emotionally attached and invested in not a lot of time at all, and honestly, I'm happy that I stumbled across it one day.  I will admit, I've well known for instantly getting attached to something assuming it meets everything I'm looking for, and this game was no exception in the slightest. But, I genuinely believe that anyone could get into this game, assuming you don't mind the anime-esque tropes and the whole theme of catgirls, because it's not for everyone obviously.  All in all, Nekopara Volume 1 gets an 11/10 from me. This game helped shape a wonderful concept into the series it is today, and gave me something to pour my passion into. I felt very inspired by this game and it allowed my creativity to get fired up. It's got an overwhelmingly positive response for a reason, and I think that this is a lovely little game that people should consider playing.  Nya~

The game is pretty short, but animations are decent.

comentarios: So, you wanna hear my opinion on Nekopara, eh? Well, let me tell you all about it... It is the manliest fucking game in the WORLD!!!!!! It is so manly, I gained muscles from playing this game. I also became a member of the beards due to me playing this game. IT IS THE MANLIEST GAME TO EVER MAN MOTHERFUCKER!!!!!!! *Explosion sounds in the background*  All jokes aside, Nekopara Vol. 1 is actually a really solid visual novel. It isn't my favorite visual novel, but it is one that I really like. Let's start off with the art style. The art style of Nekopara Vol. 1 is so good, I found myself to be looking at it for a really long time. Another thing that I love about Nekopara Vol. 1 is the characters, goddamn it the characters in the game are so cute, to the point where I want to give them a hug (Oh wait... they are not real, DAMN IT!). The story of Nekopara Vol. 1 is one that I will not say because I want you to play it for yourself (If ya want to, ya don't have to!). Hell, some moments in the game made me laugh my ass off. I have played the other games (0,2,3,&4) and I will admit that they are pretty good. Conclusion: Nekopara Vol. 1 is one of the cutest visual novels that I have ever played. The art is pretty cool to look at, the story is really good, and as I said before, the characters in this game are really cute. I will give this game a 10/10. If you like visual novels or just anime in general, then I would suggest that you buy this game!

The story is really light and can release some stress and I enjoy it, UNTIL the unnecessary scene is come out. YES THIS GAME IS A HENTAI GAME. OMFG!!! I do really hope that one day NekoWorks can make an anime based on this game (without hentai scene).

comentarios: Catgirl. A term used to define a female human-like being with minimal cat features. Simply ears and a tail. However, this term carries a unique sociological connotation. Obviously, catgirls do not naturally exist. Yes, you may cry now. I know I have. However disappointing the fact, the creators of this work poured heart, soul, and determination into this production. Giving us a glimpse into the world where catgirls and humans live together. At a glance, one could objectively state that only perverts are interested in such a situation. Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaand... I won't deny that fact. Who bought the R18 content. Everyone. That being said, I'd like to make a strong assertion. The narrative, voice acting, art, programming, etc., every aspect of this novel is beautifully polished, a masterwork by my opinion. The fact I only paid $9.99 USD for both the game and R18 content stunned me when I finally completed the story. The interactions with the catgirls, especially Chocola and Vanilla were so organic. At times, they seemed completely like normal girls. And then the story would remind you they had cat-like instincts, which felt endearing as much as it did awkward. Then the adult content. As dramatized as the scenes may have been depicted, I enjoyed the concentration on "mutual benefit". The intensity of the vocals, sound effects, dialogue, and animations made these scenes exquisite. They're erotic yet tasteful enough that both male and female audience could enjoy. If you're considering the purchase, then definitely buy. I guarantee you won't regret it.

comentarios: Aloha, this is my review of Nekopara a visual novel with catgirls; the first 4 hours are awkward stilted interactions between the MC and the two catgirl roommates/concubines/employees. The final hour has copious corporal cuddling, mayonnaise and meowing. Use headphones. I honestly didn't pay much attention to the plot, I left it running on my other monitor while I play path of exile and watched whenever something interesting happened. If you don't like anime or catgirls, or H-games, why are you even here and reading this far? If you are a man of taste, such as myself, buy it in the name of the merchants guild.  The Good: Good artwork, cute music, Chochola, well animated H-scenes, voice acting is decent, easy 100% achieves.  The Bad: Vanilla and the irritating Oni-chann sister are trash.  The Ugly: Seriously, USE headphones.

comentarios: This game saved my life.  I am 27.  My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.  When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.  After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.  Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.  After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.  Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.  I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.  Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.  Thank you

comentarios: This was a game I ended up playing sooner than I thought I would, thanks to winning Volumes 0-3 in a giveaway (though I needed to buy any 18+ content and other DLC on my own). Without this aspect, this series that every anime fan already knows about would have likely sat in my wishlist for the longest time as it doesn't hit on my favorite niches - not that there's anything wrong with them, but as you'll see, my preferences are elsewhere:  I tend to prefer men to women I tend to prefer kitsunes to nekos and I tend to prefer the idea of [i]serving[/i] a "Master" rather than being in the position of one  If I played a visual novel according to these preferences, it would be entirely different. (Like, if anyone knows dating sims or visual novels where I'm opposite some smug or arrogant kitsune boys, let me know) But, I did get this series for free. I did make sure it was as uncensored as possible before playing, for the "full" experience. And I gave it a shot.  Honestly, not a bad story. It's cute. If it wasn't for the sex scenes, it would be one of the most wholesome reads in my library... still kind of is, actually. Everything is super vanilla, with the most loyal girlfriends you could ask for. Going by the demo I was afraid these girls would be lolis because I thought I remembered they were aged the neko-equivalent to 13 which weirded me out, but that turned out to be my faulty memory and the 13-year-old neko was just a random food vendor they met on the street during chapter 1. False alarm. Vanilla is flat, but she's not a child - none of the nekos are. The little sister-figure, Shigure, is a lot more childlike, but she's an incest-loli character that is flat-out denied basically, so again we are in the clear for there being that much discomfort, in my opinion.  The main two nekos also surprisingly seem to be into each other too, which I'm here for. This is one of the few instances where I can see some form of polyamory happening without any kinks in the machine later down the line. I believe the main three really care about each other by the end.  "the end" in quotes because I still have a good three volumes (0, 2, 3) left in my library alone to explore (and that's without even picking up Extra or 4).

comentarios: Being a pretty long-time fan of Sayoris (the artist) work, i bought this game together in a Bundle with the other Nekopara Games (excluding the newly released Part 4 and Nekopara Extra).  If you want the full experience, you will need to buy the R-18 contents for this game seperately because Steam does not allow 18+ content apparently. If you want the full Nekopara experience you pretty much need the DLC. The DLC includes multiple scenes for Vanilla and Chocola, the other girls come in later games.  The Story certainly isn't bad but if you came here for the Story alone, you should probably buy a different VN. Artwork looks gorgeous, especially the R18-Scenes which are animated, albeit only short looping clips. The voice acting seems pretty good too, at least judging by my limited japanese.  In conclusion this is a very good R18 VN (again, with the DLC), i recommend buying it together in the bundle with the rest of the series

comentarios: The Cultural Revolution, formally the Great Proletarian Cultural Revolution, was a sociopolitical movement in China from 1966 until 1976. Launched by Mao Zedong, Chairman of the Communist Party of China (CPC), its stated goal was to preserve Chinese Communism by purging remnants of capitalist and traditional elements from Chinese society, and to re-impose Mao Zedong Thought (known outside China as Maoism) as the dominant ideology in the CPC. The Revolution marked Mao's return to the central position of power in China after a period of less radical leadership to recover from the failures of the Great Leap Forward, which contributed to the Great Chinese Famine only five years prior.

comentarios: The term "culture" is a somewhat difficult concept to describe in a concise manner and greatly differs from person to person. To some, "culture" refers to customs, tradition, and common themes that regularly circulate one's society. To others, "culture" relates to achievements and progress by a group or nation that expresses the blossoming of a commonly experienced lifestyle. To me though, the term "culture" is one that is synonymous of only the finest cultured visual novels available for purchase, with Nekopara being one of the greatest and highly praised titles to top this list.  Nekopara has become one of the most prized and celebrated titles in the world of "cultured" visual novels that has never failed to disappoint from the day of its release; becoming somewhat of a modern classic whos content will prove to endure for the many years to come. Upon beginning the game, players are graced with a number of the most fine examples of catgirls the world of visual novels has to offer, most prominently being the two main catgirls of vol.1, Chocola and Vanilla. The mix of these two very different but very close catgirls offer an astounding fusion of personality, befitting the tastes a very wide range of enthusiasts with a masterful blend of loli and tsundere traits that leave very little to be desired. Throughout the various chapters of Nekopara, the reader will experience an awe inspiring story that is brimming with concepts and emotional sequences that would challenge even the most battle hardened players to not shed a tear in its climax.  Nekopara has proven itself to be a game that defines its generation, offering the community a source of "culture" that is simply put, unrivaled, among other visual novels and the many other games that fill the vast pages of the Steam store.

comentarios: Once in a lifetime you'll come across a game that truly captures the history and cultural distinctions of the modern world the way a person can subjectively perceive it through our guided field of perspective. I have to admit, I had my doubts when I first learned of this game. After all, Nekopara? Will this game even be good? How ignorant was I to even have these thoughts. Little did I know I was about to indulge in what may have been the best 6 hours and 1.42 minutes of my life. The game started out strong. The opening scenes enticedme  with a captivating enigma. I was so taken aback from the next-generation animation that I almost didn't even realize the underlying symbolism in the ongoing scenes. It wasn't until my twenty sixth playthourgh of the game where I finally got my bearings together and was able to focus on the gripping and labyrinthine stratagem. The underlying analogy for 21st century distopianism and the evangelical deviation of typical orthodoxy was enlightening to say the least. Just when I thought the game could not get any better, the increasing conflict before the climax began. I could not believe the complexity of the story as the main cat protagonists, Chocola and Vanilla, struggled with the everyday endeavors for a quintessential cat such as the consistent up- hill altercation of the fight against misogyny and the fiscal synergy of opposing interracial dynamism. There I was, gripping to my chair as the conflict of the game began. I was so enticed by the game that I felt as if I was both practically and relatively apart of the game. This is a special kind of high that not even the strongest of drugs can give you. Was I part of this game? Am I inside the game right now? This game will leave you questioning existential nihilism and the objective skepticism of our perceived valuation of anthropological existence. At this point in the game, I was fully intoxicated by the avant-garde animated art style. That's when the plot finally aggrandized and I was completely stupefied. You could have lived a thousand years of isolation trying to predict the plot twist and you would never even scratch the surface of what actually transpires in this game. I was so bewildered that I actually had to pause the game so that my existential crisis didn't dive too deep inside of myself. Even pausing the game was surreal. It's almost as if life paused with the game. I felt as though I had actually become a cinematic tangent quantum. The effects are still wearing off and I haven't been able to play the game in several years. I spent the following seven years afraid of what outside of my house actually looks like. Every single day and night I live in misery because I became fully aware that happiness is never achievable without catgirls. I realized that human life has absolutely no meaning and that no matter what I ever do, it is of complete unimportance and in years from now, no recollection of my existence will prevail, meaning that if I died years ago, died now, or die sometime in the future it will not matter whatsoever to anyone. But, then again, the fact that I'm living doesn't matter either so I might as well stick around for awhile, living in complete isolation, condemned to a life of traumatic memories and a completely corrupted sub-conscience. Nekopara Volume 1 literally ruined my life. 10/10

comentarios: NEKOPARA is a visual novel set in Japan where they have biologically spliced human DNA into cats creating the abominations known as "Catgirls". These cat girls are humanoid looking with feline characteristics such as tails and cat ears on their head. comentarios: The Nekopara series is truly motivating to any aspiring pastry chefs out there. Aside from that the artwork is phenomenal, paired with the intricate plot this is a master piece. The characters are very likable, Take vanilla for example she is just a kindhearted cat girl who truly loves Kashou but does not come out until later in volume 1. Chocola is another example of an amazing character, she is just like vanilla for she loves Kashou deeply, however she is just a little more likable because of her joyful and happy attitude. That said Vanilla still holds a deep place in my heart because of her Calm and quiet attitude and will always be my personal favorite in the Nekopara series. However the two paired together are Perfect, take the shower scene for example it was just exhilarating to see that kind of balance between the two cat girls. To wrap it all up Volume 1 of the Nekopara series was truly enjoyable and will continue to be my personal favorite visual novel series.

comentarios: Okay, so right off the bat let me be clear, outside of the catgirls there are a lot of problems (and the catgirls are a problem unto themselves).  The novel, because there are no interactions/decisions and it therefore isn't a game, is boring and mediocre.  Characters are more two dimensional than the art, and there's nothing interesting or exciting to hold up the plot.    Now on to the big problem of the catgirls.  I love catgirls, I grew up watching tokyo mew mew, and one of my first crushes on a fictional character was Ichigo monomiya from that series, so I'm willing to overlook a lot if there's catgirls involved.  THIS IS NOT WHAT I WAS LOOKING FOR, and I imagine it's not what a lot of other people are going to be looking for either.  What I want is a girl with cat features and aspects, not a cat in a humanoid body.  I don't want to fuck a cat, but you do so in this game *repeatedly*.  And on top of that, they're literally less than a year old!  Even in cat years they'd be under age!  The main character even *EXPLICITLY* says that he sees them as children, and this is *AFTER* he bangs both cats.  I got this game a while back from humble bundle, and I can safely say this would not have been worth the money even at the current price of 4$, especially not since the 18+ dlc (that I do not own) is a separate purchase of equal price to the game!  TLDR: don't play this game unless you really want to put your dick in a cat

comentarios: The timeless classic, the game that started it's own the most acclaimed visual novel franchise, and complete masterpiece in terms of gaming experience - yes, I'm talking about Nekopara vol. 1 - the game that scored many rewards and conquered the hearts of thousands of players. It's hard to review trying to find any flaws in this piece of art, but I'll try to be as much subjective as possible.    Visual novel takes place in alternative timeline, where humanity finally achieved their long avaited dreams - genetically engineered catgirls. The world itself may sound like an utopia, but the truth it's more darker than anyone could imagine.    Catgirls aren't treated like humans, they don't have any basic rights, which mostly end up as them being used as slaves to do human labor for the price of some food. Some of them instead, are treated like a pets for human entertainment.     The story begins with introduction of the main character - Kashou - young adult, who runs away from his parents that don't accept him for his passion of baking. He has a dream of starting his own business and live a fulfilling live without pressure from his family. We're thrown into the scene where Kashou finds out his sister send him two catgirls to help him survive in his solitude.     The story focus on showing the basic laws of this cruel world - even the youngest catgirls are thrown into the never ending circle of labor - as well as showing us the growing relationship between main character and his catgirls. By retrospections we also learn about sad story of the sisters. Kashou decides to make the future brighter not only for himself, but tries his best to support girls and make them smile. He doesn't know that his sister will soon visit him again...    In the end, I give this game solid 9/10. Character designs, music, and captivating story - the only downside is the dlc that was ripped of the full game and sold separately for better profit. But tossing that aside, it's a true masterpiece.

comentarios: Despite being one man, the developer of this game really knows what his fans want. On Friday, I had burned my hand with flaming oil and stayed eight straight hours in a neglectful "healthcare" facility that took eight hours to bandage my recently singed flesh. This left me with very limited use of my left hand, thus rendering me unable to play most games as they tend to require two hands. This hero of a developer kept his clientele in mind, and made it so this game could easily be played with one hand. I can tell just by that design choice that this is an upstanding Christian man who had developed a wholesome Christian game. Obviously this game was designed for people with limited mobility such as myself, as I cannot think of any other reason why this game should be played with one hand. These design choices lead me to believe that there is still hope left for humanity, 10/10.

comentarios: And then a friend got me a catgirl VN...    Nekopara is a Visual Novel where you get laid with catgirls!  That's what this game is!  You play this in order to overwhelm yourself with naughty feelings, and they will likely involve ladies with cat ears and tails!  Anyway, beat it in 4 hours using a keyboard and mouse.  The game has no difficulty; it's a VN.  Very adult.    - There are 8 chapters total, each running roughly 30 minutes of listening to voices in Japanese with accompanied text (in English, Japanese, or Chinese.)   - The game is just reading text.  There's nothing ground-breaking here like multiple choices or choosing what you say.  You're in this for the read.  - The menu has pictures, videos, and music from the game to access at any time after you beat the game.  - The base game is censored and lacks the kinkier scenes.  To get the 'full' game you have to pay extra for the +18 patch.  Even so, sex is still heavily implied and cannot be ignored.  Though why you'd get this without wanting the 18+ junk is beyond me.    - There is no TissueBox DLC.  You will have to acquire that on your own accord outside the main game.  - P.  PP.  PPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPP.      In summary, Nekopara is one of THOSE games.  If you're into lewd PssPssPss, you will very much like this game.  If you're into catgirls or furries, well, read the last sentence.  If you're a parent getting this for your kid, wtf?  Why would you do that?  What's wrong with you?

comentarios: This game is a nice little story for anyone who just wants something sweet and simple with awesome characters! Most fans or buyers are those who want to experience the lewd parts of the series however if you're like me and want an opinion on the safe version of the game is just for a casual and comfy experience; you've come to the right review. I can understand that it feels like you would be missing out on the content as they hint at the lewd scenes but don't show them in the safe version, however if you have watched the anime before playing then you will be shown more scenes in the visual novels that were cut out of the anime which is nice. Overall if you wish to have a safe for work experience with the games then its pretty good, you get all the same plot points as those who play with nsfw content, the only thing they get is just imagery and 'fapping material' lmao. I love this series and I hope that this review helped you with the choice of getting into it! My favourite Nekos are Coco and Azu btw ^v^

comentarios: Nekopara is a eroge game which mean a lot of ecchi scenes you might don't want to play it with public. The game storyline quite good and got some in-depth character development between these two catgirls (Chocola and Vanilla). The walkthrough of the game is not long but average 5/6 hours by completion of reading the dialogs (Noted that I played less hours to I'm a offline player). If you just chasing for the ecchi scene, it's could be shorter but seriously don't since you don't enjoy the game that way. Language wise for English are simple and not that hard to read. And yes the game have normal Visual Novel Save and Load if you really wanted to know.  Tbh this was my first ecchi visual novel and worth to buy it. If you wanted to access more info about the ecchi scene, you could buy the DLC through the game. Or you could play it like normal and can find ways to access more clear ecchi scenes throught Community Guide.  10/10 Catgirls never made me so happy to keep them.

comentarios: POSTED: JULY 22 This game saved my life.  I am 25.  My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.  When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.  After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline broken. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.  Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.  After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.  Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.  I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.  Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.  Thank you

comentarios: Story - 0/5 Characters - 0/5 - too much sugar, no soul Atmosphere - 0/5  Nekopara is a light novel or visual novel, I don't really know what is this genre of vg called. Anyways... It may seem like a good purchase, because it seems cute and the characters move and make gestures when you are talking to them, but that is about everything you are going to get. The whole game consists of monotone clicking and reading what the flat and mostly annoying characters say (+ what you, the main guy, thinks). Game has no plot and you can prepare for the many anime harem cliches like a young boy living alone, being kind yet stupid to realize every single girl (including his own sis, maybe) is in love with him, hard and sad past of the girls, which is not that hard nor sad at all.   This game is telling you that you are going to get a lot of anime cuteness and a romantic story. But prepare to get none of those. Instead of that prepare for hours of boring reading what "you" think about your very little intligent girlfriends. (yap, polygamy with people with minds of a cat is actually legal in this game)  Some new harem animes thesedays at least try to focus on the true main characters (the girls) but this game does not do even that.  One plus to the voice actresses who actually represented the characters very good. (yet they were still very annoying)  I juts want to add, at the time of writing this I was a big anime fan... so this is not a hate on anime or japanese pop culture. This game is simply not good.

comentarios: このゲームは本当にいいです！ それはいいので： -ねこぱら1巻には素晴らしい陰謀があります。 -Nekopara Volume 1にはR18コンテンツがあります。 -Nekopara Vol 1は（私のコンピューターのように）十分に速くないコンピューターで実行できます。 -ねこぱら1巻の声優（声優・女優）はすごい！彼らは素晴らしいです！ 買うべきですか？ あなたは本当にそれを買うべきです！後悔することはありません。このゲームについて聞いたとき、私は躊躇しませんでした。ネコパラ第0巻からネコパラ第3巻を購入するためにお金を節約しました。  This game is really nice! Why is it nice?  It is nice because: - Nekopara Vol 1 has great plot. - Nekopara Vol 1 has R18 Content. - Nekopara Vol 1 can be run on a computer that isn't fast enough (like my computer) - Nekopara Vol 1's seiyuus (voice actor/actress) are very great! They're fantastic!  Should you buy it or should you not? A: You really should buy it! You won't regret it. I did not hesitate when I heard about this game. I saved money to buy Nekopara Vol 0 to Nekopara Vol 3.

comentarios: I feel the need to be honest with this review.  This is an outstanding visual novel. The artwork is great, the story writing is near perfect, even the emotions that you are the reader develop for the characters is well planned. I really have nothing bad to say about this.   The adult DLC patch while yes adds the "kink" to the game however, with that in mind it really adds the love of the characters to one another. You understand their love for the main character as well as each other. The thought process, the development of feelings. While yes it is a adult visual novel this patch really adds to the story and one I thing should be bought along with the game.   It is truly a work of art and one that I think is understated and to be completely honest it is really missed in the Anime version. Enjoy the read, enjoy the characters, love the story. I am truly glad I gave this a chance.

comentarios: in this game...this place....this cursed land brought by this title.  there are no gods to save you from this place, no demons to take your life and relieve the pain of all this.  it's only you and these...young "girls" who like to mimic cats brought to you in these low quality boxes offered by the human trafficking service hired to bring them here.  but, why? why would someone "buy" these beings? looking at you with these...gigantic balls which don't resemble an eye at all, they look more like a demonic orb draining your soul every time you make contact with it.  and there are their voices.....so...high pitched in such a sharp tone it makes my ears almost bleed. what experience was it supposed to be? this game would fit perfectly as psychological terror.  it's been a week, i've played 6 minutes and i'm afraid to play it again because i still cannot surpass the trauma it gave me in such a small amount of time....i feel like i am dragged into the psychiatric hospital of outlast every time i open the game.  this thing is the perfect human psychological terror, no other game or terror experience can be as traumatic as this one, it goes deep into your mind disguised as friendly looking japanese cartoon characters but all they do is stare at you with these bottomless crystalline circles that were supposed to be eyes and take your humanity bit by bit.  it frightens me. how they look. the way they speak. what they do.  i do not want to play this anymore. but something in my subconscious tells me to come back.  maybe it's already too late for me. do not make the same mistake.

comentarios: This game saved my life.  I am 27.  My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.  When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.  After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.  Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.  After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.  Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.  I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.  Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.  Thank you.

comentarios: This game was recommended to me by a few friends so I decided to buy it and take a look, and honestly I'm glad I did. The story is interesting, the characters aren't bland with plenty of variety in personalities. And I found myself many times loving how adorable some of the characters got, yes this game does have it's lewd parts filling the fan service roll very well be if you brought the 18+ dlc or not. But the story is still nice as well, and honestly I haven't played many visual novels. But this is the first one I played where your character and his name are preset, and you don't really pick any dialogue choices at all you simply go along with the story. It's nice honestly though the option would have been nice to, however I didn't mind. Especially because the best part is the characters will constantly move when they speak or do something showing so much personality, it was refreshing to see so they were not just still images with a text box but actually looked like they had more life to them. I highly recommend this to anyone interested.  Side note for those who want to play it, here is a helpful tip: 3 achievements are set to the 3 types of languages that you set your text box language to, but they are accidentally not set to the right languages. You don't need to replay though the game to get these other language achievements simply set it to the language you want and start game, once you see the first text appear you will get the achievement then go to the main screen and change the language and repeat. English - gives you the "Play in Japanese" achievement Japanese - gives you the "Play in Chinese" achievement Chinese - gives you the "Play in English" achievement

comentarios: Since this game absolutely refused to get off of the list of games Steam was recommending to me, I decided to check it out to see if it actually lived up to all the hype. I mean, a game cant get this popular and ubiquitous without having some merit besides cheesecake, right? I quite enjoyed Senran Kagura, after all.  The story starts in the absolute worst possible place, acting like it's at the end of some other VN's common route with all the emotional payoff for scenes and relationships that have not happened. Starting the game a little earlier in the timeline would've given us some time to get to grips with the characters before trying to guilt trip us for no reason, and starting the game a little bit later would've been much more beneficial to the lighthearted fluffy tone the game obviously wants us to have. Instead, we start right in the middle where not only are character relationships not established, but we have to cram in all of the worldbuilding that explains what catgirls are doing here into two paragraphs that honestly generates more plotholes than answers. And most of the dialogue since then is just seeing one-note characters continuing to be one-note repeatedly.  If you want something cute and funny to enjoy yourself with, go pick up a Yuzusoft game or something. Yeah, the sprites may not have fancy mouth and breathing animations like Nekopara, but a yuzusoft game will give you a much better UI that doesn't lag on every animation, more solid character personalities to identify with, a story that doesn't try to guilt trip the player 5 minutes in, and the achievements aren't so broken that none of the game language settings give you the right achievement (seriously, Starting the game in chinese gives you the achievement for starting in English. Nekopara is a 6 years old VN. how is that glitch not fixed?)  Also, Chocola barely refers to herself in the third person in the voice lines, but the subtitles absolutely insist on shoehorning her name into as many of her lines as possible regardless...which makes it even more noticeable when they randomly let first person pronouns slip through. It's bad enough when translators force every sentence to follow that speech quirk in every line that it happens regardless of how awkward it is in English. It's ten times worse when they decide to do it MORE than the Japanese lines to.

comentarios: The drawing and animation is insanely good, (probably the best I have seen in a game), as is the voice acting.   However I do have 2 big gripes with it. I don't like reading subtitles when the game really is all about the visuals...It is a shame taking your eyes off of all the very well done body language just to read text. If I spoke fluent japanese, this would not be a con. The other con is that, I expected there to be some  (ANY AT ALL!) level of choice in this 'game'. You just click the text box, and it opens the next text box. If there are no choices in a 'game' like this, what exactly is the difference between this and a softcore hentai movie? I take issue with anything sold on steam where you have zero input on what happens. Classifying it as an indie game is bad.

comentarios: As the introductory story of the Nekopara Series, this was one of the most adorable and wholesome Visual novels so far that I've come across.   You follow the story of the MC whom has left his home, starting his own patisserie when he suddenly receives a delivery. Two cute cat girls in boxes whom have followed him from his home!  It's a simple yet adorable and enchanting story that fills you with happiness with the MC living his life with his two cat girls and taking care of his patisserie store. In addition to that, the characters are 2D Animated which adds even if the slightest to some a different kind of depth that makes the characters feel alive on top of their voiced characters.  [b]join my curator page and maybe I won't confiscate your mechanical keyboard[/b] https://steamcommunity.com/groups/dodoscorner

comentarios: In a world where Hitler and the axis powers won WWII, and the Nazis began research on a human-cat hybrid to replace the enslaved jewish workforce, a man recruits the work of 6 young genetically bred catgirls from the slums to serve his personal needs; ranging from menial labor in his shop to child prostitution. It is in his house where the catgirls are conditioned from birth to provide sexual pleasure to their master. Littered throughout the story are historical allusions to the Nazis and their final solution, especially the star of david required to be worn by all Jews, which is alluded to via the bell worn around the necks of all catgirls, which allows them to walk the streets freely and to work jobs. Similarly, the catgirls are treated only as property, no different from the Africans of the Atlantic slave trade of the 16th and 19th centuries. They are given practically no education, and mature quicker than normal humans, meaning that although they appear to be 14 to 18 years of age, they are in reality only around 1 to 2 years old. The only joy of which they are able to have is given through either being fed a strict ration of fish or providing sexual pleasure to themselves or others, playing out their depraved sexual fantasies. Overall, the story is both interesting and deeply depressing, and I would recommend this game to anyone who enjoys reading about these kinds of Orwellian alternate realities.
