comentarios: This novel isn't for perverts.  If you're thinking about getting this game because it's got catgirls dressed up as maids with boobs, and you think that's sexy, then you *may* buy this game, you may crank up the chest bounciness meter as high as it can go, but if you are capable of sentiment, even in the slightest, then you're better off not reading it all the way through, and just sticking to the first few screens of bouncy catgirl boobs. Why?  Because, if you go any further, you WILL become emotionally attached to this game and its characters, and you won't be able to get off to it anymore. You'd best be sticking to something like Sakura Spirit for that sort of thing.  This game...this novel...it's something else. I was gifted this game by a friend of mine. I honestly didn't expect much at first. I just thought he got it me as a joke, and it was going to end up like one of those other visual novels centred on sex or the like.  I was wrong. And I think it deserves a proper review.  First off, there's the story. I'm not going to spoil anything for you, but it's very well presented. It never once felt sex orientated. For the most part, the narrative was well paced, and the content was powerfully emotional and heart wrenchingly touching at times. I mean POWERFUL. Trust me, there were a few times through the story where I nearly cried. The story doesn't just deal with the theme of love. It deals with other themes such as loyalty, determination, family, selflessness and self-sacrifice. It weaves all of these themes into a beautiful yarn that wraps hard around your heartstrings and doesn't let go. It did seem to sacrifice narrative for..."Liberties" at times, but it's only to be expected. Sometimes, that's what people come to see.  The story is also structured solidly by its attention to detail. They could've just left it at; "There are catgirls in this world, and that's that", but they don't. They provide not only a reason for the catgirls coming to be, but also detail on how politics deal with the issue of an overabundance of catgirls, information on their behaviour, as well as their place in society and how they are treated. They don't really go into detail about any "Catboys", though. What? They also give detail on the catgirls’ mating cycle and their inability to produce young with humans, but they don't mention how they have been able to reproduce. Anyway, that's just a small nitpick.  Next, the writing. The game has its own sense of humour that expresses itself constantly. Not too much, letting up at tender moments, bringing greater contrast to its sentimental narrative. It's witty, and has a varied palette of different kinds of humour, stemming from cute humour, to blunt humour...It even makes the occasional dirty joke. Again, even though there are quite a few deliberate innuendos scattered around the story, it doesn't ever feel like it focuses on sex for appeal or humour, only occasionally applying it for the effect the other audience desires. Notice I said; "Other audience".  I say this because I believe it was created for the purpose of appealing to a demographic that desired emotional relationships, not sexual ones. Sure, it hints at it here and there, but ultimately, it goes for the audience that feels, rather than the one that..."feels".  As for the graphics, it's spectacular. The cutscenes and backgrounds are well drawn and detailed, with bright inviting colours, but that's not the star attraction. What's important here is the animation. Yes, animation. In a visual novel. Oh come on, just how did you think the "chest bounciness" slider was going to be used if the characters didn't MOVE? And oh, do they. The art style may be reminiscent of visual novels of the past, but the characters are far from static. They move even when standing still. You can see every breath they take, every gesture they make, every single movement is smoothly animated and articulated, and...*sigh*, if you really care about that sort of thing, the boobs do move realistically as well, and respond well to the respective slider.  For its attention to detail, story, romance, sparkling wit and of course, the animation, I would recommend it to any catgirl fan who wants genuine romance, not just sex.  Overall - 8.5/10 A beautiful story that flows well, but the whole "cat" gimmick may be too cheesy for some. Be warned.

comentarios: .//see below for TLDR summary well, to be completely honest theres not much story progression in this story and it's almost purely fanservice. whatever you see from the preview will be literally what you get, there are no choices in the game and you can practically foresee what's going to happen just before buying this game anyways. but still nekogirls, who wouldn't want that right? if you're looking for a visual novel that is more indepth rather than a typical 'semi dating sim' which has a huge storyline then this novel isn't for you.  //TLDR Pros: Fanservice Interactive Music is decent Nekogirls w/ diff personalities Explores character development You get both the girls so why not Uses real facts about cats (like when they feel heated etc) More into eroge than hentai (altho available on their official page)  Cons: No multiple choices There's not much storyline Could get boring after awhile since the story is quite predictable It's quite a light read, so I wouldn't recommend people that are looking for heavy contents  Overall, I still think it's quite decent for the right type of people (like looking for fanservice), and new readers altho it's not really a novel that suits my taste.

comentarios: How to make Chocola Fudge  INGREDIENTS 2 Cups white sugar 4 Tablespoon butter 1/2 Cup cocoa 1 Teaspoon vanilla extract 1 Cup milk   INSTRUCTIONS - Grease an 8x8 inch square baking pan. Set aside. - Combine sugar, cocoa and milk in a medium saucepan. Stir to blend, then bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Reduce heat and simmer. Do not stir again.  - Place candy thermometer in pan and cook until temperature reaches 238 degrees F(114 degrees C). If you are not using a thermometer, then cook until a drop of this mixture in a cup of cold water forms a soft ball. Feel the ball with your fingers to make sure it is the right consistency. It should flatten when pressed between your fingers.  - Remove from heat. Add butter or margarine and vanilla extract. Beat with a wooden spoon until the fudge loses its sheen. Do not under beat.  - Pour into prepared pan and let cool. Cut into about 60 squares.   Enjoy.

comentarios: If you see in any of my other reviews, they most likely are going to be positive due to it not really being a game. Its a matter of choices and the visual content (candy eye *cough*).  Visual Novels are what you call hentai games. Yes that may be true but who are we to judge for not having at least some curiousity in reading the contexts of pleasure in these games. Not all visual novels even have suggestive themes well besides the one im about to review.   M E M E  R E V I E W   Nekopara is cute and thats all there is to say about it. If you like cute anime girls, what are you waiting for? Just buy the damn thing. Usually I'd say watch someone else play it but why should you? Read it yourself and make yourself a character in the game. Involve youself. Sure its weird (okay its beyond weird, you'd just be considered insane *garugama*).   Just check the game out for yourself to see whether you like it or not. Search what visual novels (or hentai games) are and see if you're willing to try them.  Its not that bad, some are actually really sweet and romantic. One I would recommend to those who have a bit of interest is Katawa shoujo its free to download online. Its on steam. Thanks for reading

comentarios: If you own any of the Nekopara games on Steam then odds are someone bought it for you as a joke. If you DO decide to play them, be aware of two things, the first being that it's as standard of a visual novel as you'll ever get. It looks standard, feels standard, the story is standard, everything is standard. Second, there is no H stuff unless you specifically purchase the additional patches. And even then the H stuff is standard too. Feel free to ask me how I know, but it's not worth the time.     That said, I recommend it solely on the basis that people who enjoy visual novels won't have a bad time with this. But if you don't, don't waste your (or your friend's) money.   As for me though, I thought it was a decent romp. The mood is cheery and if nothing else, the game will make you laugh. You can probably guess the plot just by looking at it and you'll have a hearty guffaw when you realize you were correct.    All in all, it's an erotic VN / 10. You know what to expect.

comentarios: I got this Visual Novel for the NOVEL part, not the VISUAL part.  I got this game thinking that, because it is on steam, that the all nude parts would be filtered/removed (It seemed, according to other reviews, that a 'patch' is the only way to put them back.)   I was wrong (there is only one nude bath scene and two COVERED clothesless scenes).   Luckily, there is the 'skip' feature in this visual novel.  I personally think that all nudity is ugly (and I therefore actively avoid it), which is why I got this product on steam. I should have trusted the popular, user-defined tags.  Otherwise, this is a decent fantasy romance visual novel, involving catgirls that are discriminated against, and some typically societally unacceptable romantic activities.  I like the story.

comentarios: Kashou (the main character) left his home to open a cake shop. One day he receives two cardboard boxes in the mail, shipped to him by his younger sister Shigure. The boxes contain two of his adopted catgirls he left at home, Chocola and Vanilla. Kashou wants to send the cat-girls back, but they show that they can be useful as maids in his shop, so he decides to let them stay. The animations are great, the soundtrack as well as the  colourful artwork radiates happiness and the voice acting is pleasant. The story is average and pretty predictable since it's a hentai game. Be careful and play this alone, this game doesn't only have hentai scenes, but it can be cringe sometimes. If you want to be called a weeb by your friends and a failure by your family, play it where everyone can see it. Buying this game on steam will give you a censored version. If you want the hentai scenes you should either install a mod for them or buy the game from their [url=https://nekoworks.booth.pm/items/65412]japanese website.[/url]  [table]     [tr]         [th]Pros[/th]         [th]Cons[/th]     [/tr]     [tr]         [td]Great aesthetics[/td]         [td]Not family friendly[/td]     [/tr]     [tr]         [td]Hentai scenes[/td]         [td]Average story[/td]     [/tr]     [tr]         [td]You can save your story everywhere! Right! everything is a checkpoint [/td]         [td]You need to mess with files to get the hentai patch[/td]     [/tr] [/table]  Conclusion: I recommend this game if you stay online at night or if you don't have many people around you. I don't really care about the story, so I turned a blind eye to the average story. I'm in love with the game's aesthetics, so I'm unable not to recommend this game. I would recommend buying it while it's on sale though.

comentarios: A wonderful game with wonderful characters.  The characters and CGs are really nice and set that peaceful mood, the soundtrack is beautiful and really helps you relax or get tense in the right moments and the story is very heartwarming and makes you want to keep going. comentarios: This is the the first part of the nekopara visual novels and I have to say its quite good. It has beautiful artwork, the music is not that great but its not annoying either and the characters are quite likeable. The Story itself is quite decent giving you fun and enjoyable moments as some sad and hearthwarming moments as well. The writting was to my liking and not tiresome at all, I didn't notice when a full hour passed just from playing.  The game is not full since the adult scenes are censored and cut off from the game (but you can still find a patch online if thats what you are looking for) and doesn't have a major impact on the story development. Based on that I recommend you to buy the game during sale like I did.  PS: if you want the uncensor patch you'll have to look deep into gogle to find it, not that I've looked for it or smt.

comentarios: [i]Ooh... the heresy, he's doing an[/i] actual [i]review for Nekopara![/i] Nekopara is not really a game; it's a visual novel, more specifically, a kinetic visual novel. Think of it as a little story, since all the interactivity you'll have with this will be limited to advancing the story forward and [i]occasionally[/i] pressing 'P' to make all dem sweet catgirls jump (after of course setting the chest bounciness to whatever you want). Nekopara is essentially set in a near-future (or alternative) Japan where genetically engineered catgirls have been normalised. Catgirls are second-class citizens who must prove that they are able the act independently before being allowed to. However, this background tells you squat about what it's actually like, as this story focuses on Kashou Minadzuki (his name is usually romanised as Minaduki) as he founds a new patisserie with two catgirls who mailed themselves to the newly-founded patisserie, Chocola and Vanilla. Initially, Kashou resists their pleas to work with him, but as time goes on, his affection for the two catgirls grows until they become his 'catpanions'. Just to warn you, though, this visual novel does admit that any romantic relationship does turn sexual in the end. Because Steam is a company based in the West, they apparently ban all explictly sexual scenes from all their games (while allowing some positively gruesome violence; what the hell is going on!?) even though there exist methods to bar the little kids from experiencing them. So the Steam version has been censored from the original 18+ version, which, funnily enough, can be re-integrated with the Steam version. And, from what I've heard, it's pretty intense. Nekopara is essentially a feel-good story. Whether that feel-good comes from the heartwarming love story that unfolds through ups and downs, or from having a good ol' jerk off is up to you. A visual novel like this, though, is more than just a 'picture book for adults', since you've got music, voice acting, and beatiful animation which is probably the best you can get without using 3D animation. If you're a cultural elitist who dictates that 'all good media is deep and meaningful, and that which is not is utter trash' then boy are you gonna hate this. But if you've grown sick of how Western media has gotten so 'gritty' and 'dramatic' then this is a welcome breath of fresh air. I say I recommend this visual novel, but I only recommend it for fellow otakus. Not for normies, people who can't adequately separate reality and fantasy enough to realise that what happens here should not be concerning, right-wing Christian fundamentalists, fourth-wave feminists (just thought I'd mention the artist is female) and [i]definitely[/i] none of the 'anti-weebs'. [b]Have a fun time with your six catgirls![/b]

comentarios: [h1] [[Note: This review is written from using the uncensored version of the game.]] [/h1]  This review is for the visual novel of Nekopara Vol. 1.  This isnt really a game, but an experience better then most books can offer. Without spoiling any plot, I suggest anyone picking up this story gets the uncensored orginal patch to play the game. comentarios: The whole review in three sentences: BUY IT NOW!!! IMMEDIATELY!!! ALL OF 'EM!!!  OK, here it goes. Usuallt in my reviews I try to point out pros and cons of the reviewed game but this is not the case here. The game is simply flawless. Seriously,  The plot is as simple as it can possibly be, but the reason everyone (or at least 99% of people) is not the plot. It the ambience of the game. You look at the catgirls, you listen to the music, you read the dialogues and after 3 or 4 hours you ask yourself: "Why I cannot get enough of this? Why do I want to play more?".  Everything here is adorable. Every character is drawn perfectly, the music is as suitable as it gets and the dialogues are stupid. Yes, the most stupid dialogues in the history of VNs, but it makes the game itself. If not for them "Nekopara" games wouldn't have even the half of its charm and I mean it. Anime cliches are here and there but still I cannot imagine where they would suit more than here.  Characters + dialogues = 90% of "Nekopara". It is well known that if you don't have good characters in an anime-game it is trash. Well, the cutest catgirls you can find are here. In addition to cuteness they pretty charismatic so you will love them after first couple of minutes that you've seen them.  Lots of details like a cat on the tie that Azuki wears and straight pupils of the catgirls are the rest 10% percent of "Nekopara"'s secret. One can find a lot if interesting stuff if he just stops the game and look around.  All in all the is awesome, and it hits the highest possible mark, I would strongly recommend to play it to everyone who read it.

It is a VN, so there won't be any actual choices, but it's good nonetheless. There is technically no gameplay, but thats fine by me. comentarios: The occupation of Poland by Nazi Germany and the Soviet Union during the Second World War (1939–1945) began with the German-Soviet invasion of Poland in September 1939, and it was formally concluded with the defeat of Germany by the Allies in May 1945. Throughout the entire course of the foreign occupation, the territory of Poland was divided between Germany and the Soviet Union (USSR) with the intention of eradicating Polish culture and subjugating its people by occupying German and Soviet powers.[1] In summer-autumn of 1941 the lands annexed by the Soviets were overrun by Germany in the course of the initially successful German attack on the USSR. After a few years of fighting, the Red Army drove the German forces out of the USSR and across Poland from the rest of Central and Eastern Europe.

comentarios: I like this game a lot but was initially going to leave a review explaining why I wouldn't recommend it. In the midst of writing it though I came to the conclusion that doing so wouldn't be very fair and decided to talk about the two elephant girls in the room instead.  Firstly, it has absolutely no gameplay whatsoever. You can literally load it up, press autoplay, sit back and let the entire game play out before you without having to interact with it again. I'm no connoisseur of visual novels but I've played a few of them and this was a first for me. I went into it expecting to make the usual choices (which cat girl to be with, currying favour, dates etc.) and want potential buyers to aware that no such interactivity exists.  Secondly, the game is heavily censored on Steam, a platform that allows you to experience the likes of Hatred in their purest form. Patches can be acquired to remove said censorship but I was unable to get any of them to work with the Steam version no matter what methods I followed. Initially I was begrudgingly okay playing the censored version but a few points in the game made me feel like I was missing out on a lot of content - and I was. After a trip to the high seas, I realized that the hentai elements make up a sizeable chunk of the game. This became a double edged sword for me as I ended up feeling like the primary h-scene was extremely excessive and out of place with the tone and theme the game was setting. Your mileage is naturally going to vary here.  On sale, with the above in mind, if you know this is the type of thing you're into you will have a fun time.

comentarios: Don't let the categorizations and other reviews fool you. This game is, at heart, a horror game. When you look at all the underlying moral and ethical issues surrounding this universe, your soul will die a little. Or a lot. 10/10 would again drive people to drink by streaming this. (Note: Twitch allows the Steam version but not the uncensored version. For obvious reasons.)  Quick edit: Better yet, the main character will at times gain some understanding that this universe is screwed up and note it--the game itself mocks the players/readers for enjoying it! Glorious. And its defenders are diehard and get all butthurt when you point this stuff out, which is also really entertaining, which helps my soul after playing/reading it.

comentarios: What started out as a R-rated game has turned into the sweetest thing since Diabetics blood.   It's a visual novel about catgirl slaves that love their owner, with as much cuteness as the cakes they sell in their cafe "La Soleil".  It's playful and has an 18+ patch if you are into that sort of thing.  Apparently a lot of people are [or they just love these catgirls] , as the game got 2 sequels, volume 2 and 3, a prequel, volume 0 and a 60 minute OVA broken up into 3 episodes, with further volumes and projects tied to the franchise on the way soon, according to the developers.  All are on steam.  tl;dr its the reason Appear Offline exists.

comentarios: [i]The year is 2018. Random guy on the internet SILVER FOX creates a strawpoll to decide which visual novel to play next, and because his friends hate him, they all vote for the masterpiece that is NEKOPARA.[/i]  For years I have wondered if this series is actually any good and after playing it, I gotta say, not really a huge fan. I'll start off with the things I like about it because it wasn't all awful - the presentation overall is pretty nice, all of the characters have animations and I think a lot of effort went into it. They even have mouth movement! The CGs looks good too and I thought the music was pretty catchy.  The story is about a guy named Kashou moving out of his house to start up a bakery/sweets shop/whatever so he can start a new life without telling his family. However, 2 boxes arrive and contain 2 catgirls - Chocola and Vanilla. Shenanigans happen. I found the best parts of this game are when they do cat-like things like getting drunk from catnip.  Outside of that there isn't much to say. The story was predictable, the game is clearly an eroge that has been censored since they show you what happens before and after the sex scenes instead of writing them out and as a comedy it isn't really that funny. At least in my opinion. If you're interested in this game then you've probably played it already, and if you liked it then that's fine, but I don't really get it. If the sequels are the same as this, which I heard they are, then I don't think i'll be playing them.

comentarios: Rating: 6/10 ("Decent")  Recommended for: People who enjoy VNs, people who like slice of life, people who like cute things. I would not recommend this to a first time VN reader.  Nekopara Volume 1 (presumably) serves as an introduction to the series Nekopara, an episodic visual novel that centres around the main character, Kashou, and his bakery. He is helped by his multitude of catgirls, basically girls with cat ears, tails, and cat-tendencies. In-universe, they're generally treated as sub-human and as pets. They appear to have regular cat lifespans in (mostly) human bodies.  The premise is very obviously an excuse for a relaxing slice of life VN, and that is what Nekopara is. There are no choices to make and no branching paths to follow; it is all very linear. All you need to enjoy it is to click through it. It took me just under 5 hours to read the whole visual novel, which is decent, but a little short for its cost in my opinion. Of course, I read volume 1 without the H scenes, so perhaps those add a sizable chunk to reading time.   Nekopara boasts impressive production values; the character sprites are extremely detailed, and are also animated to go along with character movements and speech. Clothing is beautiful and full of different nuances. Backgrounds are very good and match the quality of the character sprites. The best thing about the game, however, is its CGs: they are colourful, vibrant, and exceptional. Without a doubt, most of Nekopara's value is in its artwork and the cuteness of the characters.  Speaking of the characters, the VN introduces Kashou, Shigure (his sister), and the many catgirls: Vanilla, Chocola, Azuki, Maple, Cinnamon, and Coconuts. This volume mainly focuses on Kashou's relationship with Vanilla and Chocola. Judging by the descriptions of the rest of the volumes, they will likely cycle to focus on the catgirls that did not receive as much attention during volume 1. That being said, all the characters are quite distinguishable, and all have different personalities.  The soundtrack was not particularly memorable, but it served its purpose.  In general, Nekopara Volume 1 was a cute slice of life VN to pass the time and relax. I might pick up the rest of the series when it is on sale.

comentarios: It only took over eight years to get these two perfect catgirls of the Minazuki family into a visual novel to really bring them to life, and that's excactly what NEKOWORKs' gals do with this game's animated sprites and voice acting. Though it's relatively short for a visual novel, and kinetic to boot I feel the quality of these sweet catgirls makes up for it. Depending on how long you've been a fan of Sayori's art this is a welcomed event regardless.   Just a heartfelt little romp where Chocola and Vanilla set out to help their master run his Cafe/Bakery whether he wants it or not! With some eroge thrown in there too if you get the patch.

comentarios: So I beat this game or more like Visual Novel. Usually, I dont see games on a high critical level, but this was a game I had some on. It was highly favoured and since I had some money left for the holiday sale, I said "why not?" and bought it. Many people told me "buy it, it's good, you won't regret it!" If I can share these people's opinion...we'll see.  TL;DR: 5/10. Definetly needs to be better to be actually worth 10€  The game looks very good, the graphics are (what I call them) "modern-anime-style" and with that absolutly good. It's fun reading the dialogues and it felt kind of good reading the whole thing. But this is where probelms start: The story is (imo) way too narrow, it's exactly how I expected the story to go. This happens, they do this as rection. I give you some spoiler-examples *SPOILERS AHEAD* [spoiler]The master has fun with this cat girls, he thinks, since it's a common thing to have catpanions,  loving them is ok. He gets ill, the girls help him by going out, the obligatory drama "we forgot our bells at home! we swear we belong to somebody!"[/spoiler] *SPOILER END* I tried to keep my expectations as low as possible since this is my first visual novel. But by doing exactly what I think's gonna happen...at least you dont make me completly satisfied. I do not want to say the story is bad at all! For what the story is, it's alright and enjoyable. A little thing that I didnt like that much, but isnt a big game breaker at all: (again, what I thought) You have all those adorable, beautiful catgirls and yet you get to experience what happens with 2 of them? This is where I gotta ask: Will we know more about the others in other Nekoparas? If no, then this is absolutly not ok imo. I'd really like to know more about Coconut or Cinnamon (tits yuheeeeeeee) If yes...well, the typical way to provide the user his information: We make a whole new game/story for some money. I dont want to say that is a bad thing, but I remember ye olden days where we got our stuff for free or we got games where we had so many stories in one game that we could play it for a massive amount of hours and we still didnt know anything. (yet again, I dont want to say the story is bad) But for focusing on 2 characters, the story is quite good.  Another thing I have to mention: The H-patch. Yes, there is one. you get hentaiscenes as you further progress through the game IF YOU HAVE THE H-PATCH DOWNLOADED UND INSTALLED. Google "nekopara vol 1 h-patch" and read the instructions carefully. that's it. Another thing to mention: If you have the H-Patch installed, you should be able to see if the H.Patch works if Chocola and Vanilla feel hot and it pretty much leads in an obvious way to the H-scenes What can I say about the scenes? They are well made, I actually didnt expect moving scenes tbh! But the sounds were...well, you can hear that the game isn't focusing on the H-scenes. But as a sweet, little addition, I enjoyed them (no, I did not (yet) masturbate to them).  Overall, I give the game a 5/10. But imo, I wouldn't pay 10€ for it. Maybe 7, let's say 5. But 10€ is way too much. Maybe I just had too high expectations, who knows.  Play the game for yourself and get your own opinion! In the end, it's just me who thinks this way :)

comentarios: An amazing visual novel. It takes 2nd place in my heart after ChuSingura. The artstyle is really cute. The choices of theme songs is excellent. The story is interesting and well written. It has ups and downs so it isn't a simple everything-is-perfect-and-all kind of story. This episode centers around the youngest members of the Minaduki family Chocola and Vanila who happen to be twins. Chocola is a really energetic and cute catgirl whose honesty and innocance is just dangerously moe and makes your heart melt. She always acts childish but once becoming Kashou's catpanion she sometimes become really lewd. Vanila seems lazy but is actually hard-working and while she may not be too honest about her feelings it only makes her more lovable. She acts really mature and she loves joking around. She especially loves pointing out what a "pervy pastry puffer" Kashou is. Taking everything into consideration i can't really say anything negative about all this. Definetly worth a 10/10.

comentarios: [b]NEKOPARA Vol.1[/b] is a light visual novel (VN) about two "catgirls" working in their owner's new cafe. The game defines earlier on "catgirls" as the "genetically modified human-feline hybrids" which are kept as pets. They are also required to wear an IAP (Independent Action Permit) item fitted with a GPS tracker, such as a bell, if they want to go outdoors without their owners (after passing "The Test").   + High quality art style with a lot of attention to detail + Entertaining voice overs (Japanese language) + Some catchy songs + Steam achievements and trade cards  - Very simple, straightforward and unintelligent plot for a VN - The sub par plot (in comparison to the visuals) offers no alternative paths choices, thus no replayability - Unless you are a "catgirl" fan, the storyline was bordering on uncomfortable - Some small glitches, i.e. black screen, no video for end credits etc - No achievements accomplishment; they dutifully drop after each chapter (+config change options)  Note: The review is for the standard steam version of NEKOPARA Vol.1, which even though it has a couple suggestive depictions, there is no adult material within (requires the purchase of external DLC to activate the explicit scenes).  ----- TL;DR: [b]NEKOPARA Vol.1[/b] strictly as a visual novel, suffers from a short, unintelligent and shallow plot but in contrast the high quality visuals, art and catchy songs perhaps will justify a purchase, especially at a reduced sales price.

comentarios: NEKOPARA is a sorta okay game if you can call it that. It's not bad but I feel it should be called an animated comic. Nothing about it is bad but I was under the impression before I bought it there would be choices and routes for each of the cat girls. So I can't really judge it by a mistake on my part but I will say there is more interaction in the options menu than the actual gameplay itself. It took me about 4-5 hours of cumulitve play of a few sittings to complete it. I got bored listening to cat girls squeel and pressing spacebar after about an hour each time. If you like Kawaii/Moe type Anime this should be right up your alley, If not I would pass on this one.   Pros: - Kawaii - Well written - Art is superb.  Cons: - The most linear game I've ever played.

comentarios: Okay, so, uh... yeah.  I bought this game sort of on a whim, and my initial thought process was "I've heard this was basically hentai so, being the type of person who is entertained by witnessing some depraved shit, I'm gonna get all 4 volumes and see what the deal is."  Naturally I discovered that's not all there was to it. I was missing something. Yes, indeed:  THE 18+ DLC.  I bought it after a great deal of mental preparation and hesitation. I regret nothing.  I'll start by giving a simple pro/con list for the steam version of the game, the "All-Ages" version.  PROS: -Breathtaking art style, fluent animations and excellent attention to detail. Easily one of the most beautifully crafted VNs I've seen or played. Of course, I'm also just a sucker for anime. Sue me. -The voiceovers, while entirely in Japanese, are excellent. Delivery is great, display of emotion is great, and the actresses fit their characters well, with clear differences in tone, pitch and delivery. -The story, while basically just a slice-of-life with some deeper elements thrown in, grips you well enough that you want to keep going (pun intended, you'll know why later.) -Characters are all interesting, some more than others, but you won't dislike a single one. Even Shigure, who has a rather uncomfortable big brother complex going on. -The soundtrack is upbeat when it needs to be, solemn when it doesn't. There's a pleasant mix of piano tracks and poppy, electronic tracks, along with some more traditional anime-like tracks with a jazzy vibe.  CONS: -The dialogue and general script, as is unfortunately the case with almost all JP > EN translations, fails to deliver a truly realistic representation of how one would speak in English. Things like "Ahh..." or "That's not...!" Some people might not consider this a con, especially since the characters all speak, meaning the text should be a true translation. More of a personal quirk I suppose. -Minor typos here and there. Easy to miss, honestly. -The story, due to the nature of it, lacks tragedy. Fortunately, everything else is delivered well enough that this may only be a setback for some. Still figured I'd mention it.   NOW THEN... Allow me to move on to the FULL version of the game, which I have. This pro/con list is strictly going to cover what the 18+ dlc (re)introduces. I won't be graphic in order to keep my review readable, but I will be detailed enough to get the point across  PROS: -Since the H-scenes were done by the same artist, the comment I made about the art style applies here as well. -The scenes are exaggerated, but not to the point of just not making any sense. If you're not getting what I'm saying, let's just say instead of the girls looking like they just hopped out of the ocean, they look like they maybe fell in a puddle or... something. -THEY ARE ANIMATED -The entire scene is voiced (Minus Kashou of course). This can be a con if you're the type that can't handle the sound of a voice actress making rather realistic sexual sounds. -Again, not much of a hentai guy, but the scenes are really well done for what they are. Not much else to say really... at the end of the day, you're paying $30 for hentai.  CONS: -Again, with the translations, shit doesn't always make sense. Without being specific, sometimes word usage in certain "situations" is off-putting. Even thought the VAs may REALLY be saying these things, it's still a little uncomfortable to read. Again, I'm not usually a hentai kind of dude, so it could just be me. -Frequency is... well, frequent. Vol. 1 alone, after the initial 3-4 hours of introductory story, probably has a scene every 45 minutes of play time. There are 3 scenes. The 3rd lasts well over an hour. I only list this as a con because it sort of makes you feel like the game goes from a story-driven experience with some porn thrown in for taste, to a straight up H-VN with a little bit of story mixed in. -There is almost ALWAYS some kind of wet/sticky sound effect going on in the background. Sometimes it's fine, but for the most part it's just gross. I recommend either turning down the sound effects or turning them off entirely unless you enjoy the sound of macaroni that's been sitting for a while being spooned around.  With all of that being said, the game is super adorable. ESPECIALLY Chocola and Vanilla... even if they end up being defiled halfway through the game. Feelsbadman.  If you've gotten this far, congrats, you know what to expect. If you're looking for a TL;DR, here it is:  11/10 Catgirls are cute, there's hentai if you blow (giggity) the extra $30, the game is pretty, buy it now no regrats.

comentarios: NEKOPARA is a VN based on Pantheon becoming what he wanted, except his personal space was invited by his family's Nekos*. Instead of filing a restraining order, he keeps them with him.  The VN novel itself is mediocre at best, with a few key elements. First, it's one of the few VN's to be animated, and not some pictures wired up (Though at parts, there are pictures, though this is obvious). Another key element is that the VNs are Voice-Acted (VA), thus bringing in MORE spirit.  One of the main attractions for me, however, was that the game contains hentai. To get the uncensored version you either: -A: Pay for the uncensored version online, and apply a patch to the Steam version -B: Pirate said patch -or C: Buy the uncensored version online, then set it to be a Steam game.  The main problem is that the game lures you with hentai, should you be a fan of hentai, and then makes you pay an extra 10 dollars, which just screams BS.  One of the problems I've had that's very common with the game is ''Invalid character AE''. If you don't want to deal with said problem, install the VN on C: instead of D:.  Verdict: A VN that is definitely worth checking, but pay online or pirate the patch for the hentai.  Final Verdict: 7/10 for the base VN, 8/10 for the hentai parts. The hentai parts did not feel empty, yay.

comentarios: 10/10, would be emotionally coerced into sleeping with nine-months-old anthropomorphic house pets again...? :s  Slightly more seriously speaking, I've probably approached this game from an unusual angle, as I wasn't looking for porn and didn't download the 18+ patch, but I knew how much praise the whole series gathered over the years and wanted to check it out for myself. What I found was:  + Absolutely beautiful visuals, with sprites, CGs, Backgrounds... Everything being georgeous. + Awesome scripting with animated sprites done maybe better than anywhere else, creating a lively experience you wouldn't expect from a VN. + Tons of cuteness and adorableness. + Good music.  But also:  - Extremely creepy owner/pet romance that made me uncomfortable even without seeing the H-scenes. - Creepy brocon subplot with the protagonist's little sister (who would be otherwise an adorable character). - Paper-thin story and absurd setting that doesn’t really try making sense. - Writing generally not on par with the visual quality.  [b]As a kinetic novel, it was definitely well-produced and fun to read, but not really exceptional in anything but the graphics. If I looked on it as porn, I think the power dynamic and characteristics of the catgirls (especially Chocola) really makes it quite horrible. If you don't get discouraged by this description though, you should have a blast with this and all the other chapters of the series. I don't judge. Or at least I try not to...[/b]  ----------------------------------------------------------------------  Oh, hey, I bought the whole series during the autumn sale? I guess it'd be a waste to not out check where it goes from here...  ...what am I doing with my life? o.o

comentarios: The characters in Nekopara are way too cute. Each have their own unique personalities, which are easy to get attached to. From an artistic standpoint, this game is also fantastic. While there aren't necessarily any branching storylines or choices, I never really considered this a negative aspect of the game, just a wanted addition. I'd definitely recommend you pick up Vol.0 to get a feel for the game and see if it's something you'd enjoy. Also the 18+ patch for Vol.1-Vol.3 adds quite a bit to the overall game - and lets be honest, that's what we're intrested in. However, you have to purchase these from the developer's site "Denpasoft" and they're quite expensive.

comentarios: NekoPara Volume 1 takes place from the perspective of a man named Kashou Minaduki, whom is part of a long line of Japanese confection makers. His sister has also been raising quite a few catgirls, some of whom have become attached to him over recent months and years. Seeking to forge his own path in the industry, Kashou decides to leave home and open his own patisserie by the name of “La Soleil” – completely in secret to avoid the attention of his family. Originally it was his plan to run this cafe by himself, without the assistance of either his family or any catgirls he left behind. But this all changes when he finds two unopened boxes sitting in the shop with some perplexing notices on them. The noises from the box show that two of the catgirls his sister was raising: the enthusiastic Chocola and more docile Vanilla, have decided to stay by his side and help run the shop. Although willing to send them back home at first, events that follow see him deciding to keep the two on board – as they begin their life of running La Soleil together.  + r18 patch + cute nekos + boobs bounciness (press "P" to see the magic)

comentarios: I never really could get in to the Visual Novel genre despite trying on several occasions.  I played ones that were critically acclaimed and then I played Nekopara.  Though its debatable whether I would actually call this a "game", but to my surprise I found this to be rather fun.  I mean its stupid but its charming in its own way.  If you enjoy reading manga at all you can think of this as a visual comic, or depending on whether you install the adult patch, an H-manga.  Recommended though I wouldn't pay full price for it.  Wait for a sale with its 75% off if your interested.

comentarios: Got to admit, I think the sexual content actively interferes with the novel. Steam's censored version is the version I played and thankfully skips past the actual adult scenes and is one of the only instances where I feel like it would have been an inferior experience, but even in Steam's version the implications of what happened doesn't feel quite right.  Fortunately, that's about the only notable issue for me. It's otherwise an enjoyable experience in seeing the relationship develop between Kashou and his unexpected catgirls Chocola and Vanilla, especially as the catgirls struggle to fully understand the way humanity works. Seeing the three earnestly try to pursue what they believe to be the best for them all while trying to understand the bonds they have was very nice.  Nekopara is not without its humour and the novel delivers well on this too. A lot of it ends up tying into the catgirl tendencies to slip into cat-like behaviour, and while I wouldn't say every joke worked it definitely hit the mark more plenty to make it worthwhile.  It was also great to see the E-mote system in use for the visuals. The last time I'd seen this was Tokyo School Life, and the implementation here is even better as they're able to give some illusion of talking, walking about or leaning to the side as a few examples. While it's not the norm for visual novels the impact is massive and I do wish it would become more commonplace.  There are no choices to make in the novel though, with a single linear storyline to the end.
comentarios_limpios: got to admit i think the sexual content actively interferes with the novel steams censored version is the version i played and thankfully skips past the actual adult scenes and is one of the only instances where i feel like it would have been an inferior experience but even in steams version the implications of what happened doesnt feel quite right  fortunately thats about the only notable issue for me its otherwise an enjoyable experience in seeing the relationship develop between kashou and his unexpected catgirls chocola and vanilla especially as the catgirls struggle to fully understand the way humanity works seeing the three earnestly try to pursue what they believe to be the best for them all while trying to understand the bonds they have was very nice  nekopara is not without its humour and the novel delivers well on this too a lot of it ends up tying into the catgirl tendencies to slip into catlike behaviour and while i wouldnt say every joke worked it definitely hit the mark more plenty to make it worthwhile  it was also great to see the emote system in use for the visuals the last time id seen this was tokyo school life and the implementation here is even better as theyre able to give some illusion of talking walking about or leaning to the side as a few examples while its not the norm for visual novels the impact is massive and i do wish it would    there are no choices to make in the novel though with a single linear storyline to the end

comentarios: [h1]Well, NEKOPARA vol.1[/h1] When first time I ran NEKOPARA, my mind was almost at my cuteness and kawaiiness limits :3 Those Nekos are amazing. Never seen such adorable and vivid kawaii characters before. I love all of them. They are completely adorable.  [h1]Characters[/h1] [olist] [*][url=https://youtu.be/yH4R0MwExvo][b]Azuki[/b][/url]. Aaah, my favorite one. She has me to crush on her with that frolic character and sarcastic enjoyable quips, always on a perky mischievous mood, more likely [i]tsundere[/i] character. Don't get me wrong and pls stop calling the cops - she's the eldest Minaduki neko! Also her responsibility and tender insides just makes me thrill. Guess I like her bluntness + shyness on the other side pretty much. She's a [i]Munchkin[/i] neko.  [*][url=https://youtu.be/ZmIqFqnMj60][b]Vanilla[/b][/url]. Well, she's also one of my favorites. With that corteous behaivor, cold and mysterious look in her eyes, sharp piercing phrases, calm and reserved barely recognizable emotions, rare soft and genuine tenderness - all that kindly teasing stuff makes [b]Vanilla[/b] truly catching one. Oh [b]Vanilla[/b]'s really makes my mind melt. She's more [i]kuudere[/i] than [i]dandere[/i] character to me.  [*][url=https://youtu.be/MWDFRIL7LoQ][b]Chocola[/b][/url]. [spoiler]Eheh, that's where the verge of crime becomes barely visible[/spoiler]. I like Chocola, her energetic mood always cheers me up, she's a really adorable one. A happy-go-lucky neko, I'm in love with her sincerity. Her innocent and genuine elated character, truly optimistic, sparkling eyes, exciting cute voice - all of it makes Chocola really really great. Truly, genki + moe char. [*][url=https://youtu.be/isJEI88_ZgI][b]Coconut[/b][/url]. Oh my, she's the best. She's quite different from the other nekos. Tall, athletic, smart, doing some martial arts. Even she's young, you can suppose like she's the elder one. Confident and cool, she's really modest and kindhearted from the inside. As she says about herself: [i]"...I think I'd rather be a cute catgirl than a cool one"[/i]. Also she's little bit shy, has some issues with low self-esteem and jelaous to other catgirls for their appearances. But for me, she's more than just good. She's gorgeous. Btw I really enjoy huge cute&clumsy shy girls too. She's a [i]Maine Coon[/i] neko [*][url=https://youtu.be/qVmrIZTE06U][b]Maple[/b][/url], kind, proud and also vigorous and extrovertous neko. She's quite a young lady. Sophisticated in some way. Well, trying to show that all the time - how be perfect and versatile. She's an [i]American Curl[/i] neko. [*][url=https://youtu.be/ccIkbzFxwjc][b]Cinnamon[/b][/url], kinda perverted Neko, maybe too much. Cinnamon makes me feel really awkward sometimes with her lewd and lecherous polysemantic phrases, but she's rather nice in her own special way. She's tender, even voluptuous character. [spoiler]Never liked overweighted melons though :D[/spoiler] So, I guess it's just a common moe character. She's a [i]Scottish Fold[/i] neko. [/olist]  [b]Kashou[/b]. Don't think that I might be able to say much about him, but, well, he's ambitious,  responsible, polite and most likely collective character, reasonable and collective in order to be compared to the player. Typical [i]"nice guy"[/i], he's the one the catgirls surely can rely on. [spoiler]Also, sometimes he's quite dumbass[/spoiler] To be honest, i like him anyway. I guess I should mention one more character, [url=https://youtu.be/WgJM99I_IAw][b]Shigure[/b][/url], [b]Kashou[/b]'s younger sister. To tell you the truth, she's not the person who can actually make you feel something more than common character interest. Not really catching. I guess the very plot needs her in order to be more logical and sense-making, to make whole story cohergent.   [h1]Graphics[/h1] [b][url=https://youtu.be/TQudvxDriz4?t=13m14s][quote=Noble, 2014]THE MOVE! THE MOVE! OH GOD! OH!! HOLY SHI~, THEY MOVE! THEY BLINK! OH GOD! OH MY GOD! THIS IS THE BEST THING EVER[/quote][/url][/b] [url=https://youtu.be/TQudvxDriz4?t=13m49s][b][quote=Noble, 2014]DID YOU SEE THAT THEY F*CKING BOUNCE?? MMM~! MY GOD, THEY F*CKING BOUNCE[/quote][/b][/url] My god, Noble's damn right, developers made them moving, using E-mote technology, and now the characters are no longer the static sprites or smth, they are quite active during the game process. That is surely the completely new level of a visual novel gams to me. Spectacular! [spoiler]THEY ACTUALLY BOUNCE! BOINGBOINGBOING[/spoiler] [spoiler]P is my favorite button now. Definetly.[/spoiler]  [h1]Voicing[/h1] Ah, the voices...mmm. In addition to E-mote technolgy of animation, each one of the characters, except protagonist, have their own voices! That is really niiiice! The actual seiyus done great piece of work! Well, that's really looks awesome, making them even more charismatic, catching and loveable. Because of highly developed anime voicing industry in Japan, all those characters are greatly sparkling and outstanding, I am really enjoying their different personalities. [spoiler]Aaand...in R-18 cutscenes the voice is actually doing about half of the work, ya know ;)[/spoiler]  [h1]Plot[/h1] Well you all should know the plot, it's simple and consistent, just th way it should be in such game. Well, I wish I could have had more influence to the game process like choices or smth, but whatever.  [quote=Wiki]Kashou Minaduki is an aspiring chef who moves away from home to open his own confection shop. While he is unpacking in his new shop, he discovers that two of his family's Nekos, Chocola and Vanilla, came along with him by hiding in cardboard boxes. After the two Nekos convince Kashou to let them stay and live with him, the three of them work together to run his shop, "La Soleil". Throughout the story, Kashou is frequently visited by his younger sister Shigure, as well as the other Nekos owned by his family.[/quote]  [h1]P.S.[/h1] [b][url=https://youtu.be/TQudvxDriz4?t=8m03s][quote=Noble, 2014]You know what? I don't care where we are in, this is HEAVEN. This is got to be Heaven[/quote][/url][/b] [b][url=https://youtu.be/TQudvxDriz4?t=9m23s][quote=Noble, 2014] OH GOD.  Every fetish... EVERY FETISH I HAVE EVER HAD... IN THIS GAME WE DOING RIGHT NOW![/quote][/url][/b] [h1]P.P.S.[/h1] [spoiler]Don't get me wrong, but there are also animated R-18 cutscenes. TOTALLY ENJOYABLE[/spoiler] [spoiler][url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YGw5-rUdeXA]Why do you need real women after this?[/url][/spoiler]  In conclusion, I wanna make-up some rates. Well.  [table]     [tr]         [th]Characters[/th]         [td]9.2[/td]     [/tr]     [tr]         [th]Graphics[/th]         [td]10[/td]     [/tr]     [tr]         [th]Plot[/th]         [td]7.8[/td]     [/tr]     [tr]         [th]Boobiness[/th]         [td]10[/td]     [/tr]  [tr]         [th]Voicing[/th]         [td]10[/td]     [/tr]     [tr]         [th]Playability[/th]         [td]8.3[/td]     [/tr]     [tr]         [th]Total[/th]         [td]9.21[/td]     [/tr]

comentarios: Economists assume all humans act rationally. That is to say they act in terms of marginal benefits and marginal costs, and behave in their own self interest. Now, as an economist, do I think a rationally acting human would purchase this good? First we must determine the marginal costs and the marginal benefits  Costs: $9.99 More than 10 hours of your time Your social status Most of your friends Your chance of ever getting laid again  Benefits: Cute catgirl pseudoanimation "nade nade nade nade" (sound of headpats) You develop a new lust for catgirls and them alone You become a microbiologist to study CRISPR/Cas9 and perfect it to genetically engineer real life catgirls  As we can plainly see, any rational human being would purchase this game.

comentarios: A well crafted story driven video game, very emotional and very well developed. Its completly original and there are no cliches or just used them to make the story better, iwas amazed by this feature. The gameplay is completly revolutionary. I spend a whole saturday just to master and try to comprehend such a complex way to play a game, all of the other most difficult gameplay experiences you've ever had will be completly blown away by how HARD this game was for me. Finally trhe character development is so deep and complex I was amazed. It ponders deep questions about the human nature between fighting for their own nature and insticts against some of the socially accepted constructs. If I were a teacher i'd use this videogame as an electronic learning tool for students to depate about the concepts of ethics, moral and philosophy.  My mom saw me playing it and she said nothing, also she believed the voices were from my 10 year old cousins, so that's a plus. Finally  I'll keep playing this game for at least 100 hours before uninstalling, it's completly not boring at all.  Edit: After some 50 hours i just realized there is an automatic option to not leave the game, when you hit close it automatically points to NO. So i'm never leaving this precious game.,

comentarios: [h1]Liked[/h1] [list] [*] Really liked the animation and voice actors as it made this visual novel come alive.   [*] The art style is high quality and clearly a lot of care went into drawing the characters.  [*] The story was an emotional roller-coaster and to me at least was a lot darker then what is presented on the surface.  Considering most reviews are jokes I am not convinced those players get what is really going on in the universe the game creates.   [*] Sliders to adjust text speed.  Fast reader here and all text at once is an option. [*] Easy 100% achievements.  [/list] [h1]Disliked [/h1] [list] [*] I suppose my only complaint… where are the cat boys? I would not mind some Yaoi action. [/list] [h1]Other Thoughts[/h1] I prefer ecchi/softcore/tasteful erotica.  This steam version is just that, cuts what is literally porn and keeps all the good stuff. Would not recommend the patch or full version, it ruins the story if anything.

comentarios: The same friend gifted me another addition to this stifling story.  It was supposed to be a great time, y'know; late at night, experiencing it with close friends, getting a few drinks down me. And just to seal the deal, a friend recommended me to download the 18+ mod hidden from Steam. So I thought, why not, right? I'm only going to play this once, so I may as well get the most out of it. And that's exactly what happened.  We got the most out of it, and us.  Nothing can prepare you for what you see from this. Nothing. You think you'd have some idea as to what might happen, but anything you imagine gets crushed through the floors of your nightmares by the haunting reality of NEKOPARA, Vol. 1. Through blood, sweat, tears and alcohol, I managed to escape and live to tell the tale. My friends, however, weren't so lucky. I dedicate this review to them and simultaneously pay my respects.  Remember folks, in the world of NEKOPARA, sharing is caring.  Sharing... is caring.  Until next year.  P.S. As always... press P for bounce. ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

comentarios: Kinetic Novel (no choices). Nice story about bonding and "romancing" with Chocola and Vanilla, your two Catgirls. Pet the catgirls and follow their story through the opening of your bakery. Regular genetically manufactured CATGIRLS, that are normal in that world. They can be kept as pets, companions or lovers. No catboys, that is genetically impossible, I presume. Nekopara has one on THE BEST art and animation in VNs or KNs that I have seen so far! Steam has the All Ages version (no nudity), R18 version available to buy on the publisher's homepage. Reeeeally cute and mostly heartwarming dialogues. Really stupid parts as well.  Follow me as a curator at http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28337205-Fair-Minded-Witness/?appid=298050

comentarios: [b] NOTE: This review is made for the uncensored version, without uncensoring no H-scenes can actually be seen afaik.)[/b] [strike] [url=steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=370848130] Instructions for uncensoring here [/url] [/strike] My experience with Nekopara Vol1 was amazing! i really loved the theme and artwork. This visual novel is not really a game in any sense of the word, it has zero interactivity except for *ahem* a certain button that makes a certain thing bounce by which i mean [spoiler] cats [/spoiler] and thus does not have multiple endings or branching, which most visual novels do have. You have to be [strike] a fitlhy weeb [/strike] a fan of Manga style art or anime to get the best out of this game, if you dont then you may or may not get the point of this "game" [b] Pros: [/b] - Awesome artwork - Good voice acting - A sweet love story - Well-written - Eroge to the max (lot of h-scenes, probably uncensored only) [b] In-betweens: [/b] - Japanese voice acting ( which i loved) - Settings are pretty basic (not a con, since this is very normal and understandable for visual novels) - No interaction - Very easy to get 100% achievements on - Absolute singleplayer - you will want to play this when you really are all alone. - requires tissues, socks or towels to play, will crash-to-desktop without them [b] Cons: [/b] - On the short side (my play time being calmly reading and getting trough the whole story) - side-characters have little to no development (but, it seems the developers are going the route of making new volumes focusing on the other side characters, with Vol. 2 having 2 of the side characters in the spot light as what i assume are main characters) -  [strike] not actually a con [/strike] [spoiler] DEAR GOD I JUST FAPPED TO 2 FUCKING CATS, SEND HELP  [/spoiler]  All in all a good game for you [strike] to play with your daughter to show her why her cat had kittens [/strike] to play with when you want to play with yourself. I would honestly rate it 8/10

comentarios: NEKOPARA Vol.1 looks like it fits 100% into an outsider’s view of visual novels; a dull, fandom-focused story with pretty girls who do nothing but dote on you. Yes, these catgirls are pretty devoted, but there’s more going on than a simple harem storyline. One can’t help but be intrigued by Kashou’s devotion to baking, understanding both catgirls, and wanting to see everything turn out well. With that said, some may be put off by the sexual storyline aspect which suddenly shows up. Others might be mad knowing they’ve missed out on some scenes due to Steam’s restrictions on adult content. Still, NEKOPARA is a light and fluffy visual novel that fans of catgirls will enjoy their time with.

In ancient India a great German windmill engineer came to offer his help in exchange for chocolate chip biscuit cookies, The ones wich where loved by many British farmers far in the south west.   As it stands the Federal line of Russian Democratic Countries has combined its forces to sexual harras the people of Turkey, Ofcourse the Communist state of global economic replublicans wasn't all too happy about this, so they sended out the People's Army of United China to fight these space monkeys wich led to an all out war of diplomatic aggresion against Africa, And thus nuclear winter begun.  You are given full control over Alkeb Mussin he's an european communist party advisor of the great Mexican wall production industry, As the player you're tasked with some pretty lame stuff "To make this city of united space rats run like crisps of baked cow oil." it's like a dream come true. This particular story features some amazing moments such as the one time you flew a Tu-144 into United Austrian Space Territory and Generic Black Male had to come and save you... Well that's about it, I guess.  More filler, Potato baking competition of united global potato states funded by the African Aqua Powerd Car Fuel ..eh Company yes that's it. comentarios: Nekopra is a well told dystopian story about a race of genetically engineered slaves, cleverly told from the point of view of the slave owners. With near human intelligence and an apparent need for sex to stay healthy, the "catgirls" are used for sex, companionship and free/cheap labor. Is their affection towards the protagonist and his family authentic or simply an act to aviod the greater horror of being an un-owned catgirl; hunted by the authorities and forced to live as fugitives?

comentarios: Game: Nekopara Vol 1 Genre: Visual Novel Developer/Publisher: NEKO WORKs/Sekai Project System: Steam (PC) Total Score: 80/100 Value Score: 8/10  Length of Playthrough: 4 Hours  • Story: 7/10 • Characters: 8/10 • GamePlay: 7/10 • Graphics: 10/10 • Sound: 10/10 • Music: 8/10 • Length: 6/10 • Replay Value: 5/10 • Player Value: 9/10  [u]Pros[/u] +Great Voice Acting and a lot of VA work +Great animations and backgrounds +Decent OST +A lot of setting options most of which involve voice settings for each individual character, you can lower their voice or raise their voice during scenes +English, Chinese and Japanese language support for text +Gallery mode which has CGs, music and videos (OP and ED)  [u]Cons[/u] -Only Japanese voices in the voice acting -Kinetic visual novel (only one ending/route) -Game is censored, a uncensored patch is available but you would need to pay for it or mod it in

comentarios: As far as I have noticed, this is the best visual novel out there. High quality drawings, decently animated, and enjoyable story with solid writing, nice music, etc. This is a great first visual novel if you've never played one before, it's leaps and bounds beyond others. I would recommend installing an R18+ patch for the full experience though. This steam version has a lot of censorship that takes away from what you're likely expecting.

comentarios: Its meant to be a light hearted storybook about Catgirls/Neko and their human Owners/Masters. In this storys' setting, Catgirls are bio-engineered cats to have humanoid bodies and mostly human Intellegence. Think of all the other things the Japan has made into cute humanoids. Computers, cars, tanks, food, you name it its out there somewhere.   This VN has had some light hearted shenanigans. But parts of it really tug your heart strings.   I've known about Nekopara for over a Decade it seems.  Before Steam was big, it was sold as a top tier game from Japan on J-list. Surely it didn't have the censorship this one has.   I'd recommend it for anyone who is looking for a sweet story, or are Cat lovers themselves. I'm sure you'll like the scene where he is looking for a book to learn about taking care of Catgirls.

comentarios: I am not a fan of catgirls, yet I enjoyed this relatively short VN.  The most prominent feature would be its highly animated characters, which is definitely a fresh experience as compared to other VNs. Just by having animated facial expressions and movements, the characters felt more lively.  As for the story, well, you can say that it is definitely lacking in content. But let's be real, I'm sure no one buys this just for the story  ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)  After all, plot > story.  Just relax and enjoy it

comentarios: Let's be honest. Nobody bought this game for it's "cute story" or "cute animations". I bought the game because I saw the tags "sexual content" and "nudity". Yet I have sat through about 10 hours of cringey-ass japanese meowing, in the hopes of the game living even remotely up to it's tags.   If you don't mind paying for ½ a game with a cringy story, and cringy characters, which there are 1000's of better iterations off, then feel free to fill Valve's piggybank. But if you are buying the game for it's sexual content, then don't buy it on steam. You will likely only end up dissapointed like I did.

comentarios: So having completed Volume 1, I have to say that this game was surprisingly entertaining.  I picked it up in a bundle deal and I just thought I'd give it a spin to see what it's like.  The character art is certainly NEKOPARA's strong point, the character desings are well done and having them have an animated aspect really put it a cut above the visual novels out there with static graphics.  Chocola and Vanilla are able to emote and thanks to the stellar art it really helps drive home the emotions of the script.  And as someone who worked in the culinary industry I could relate to the struggle the MC was dealing with; which is always a plus.  The only downside is that this game is that you're locked in to one route, so you better enjoy the ride. I suspect that since there are other volumes of the game out there, they might focus more on the other characters introduced in Volume 1.  Though there is one character that I hope they don't, just to avoid dealing with certain taboos.  This game is at it's best when it's light hearted and silly.  So in conclusion; give NEKOPARA a shot.  The art, combined with the animation and voice acting make for a potent combo.

comentarios: Do I find this creepy? Well... on the one hand, the restaurant owner isn't paying the girls, and also thinks of them as family members, daughters and even actual cats at times, and yet has sex with them. On the other hand, the girls are working voluntarily and are perfectly well looked after, and they also repeatedly request the sex and also perfectly understand what sex is.  Meh, I'm not paying up for the 18-rated version of the game anyway, not after only getting this at a large discount and only because it contains other things I really love: flamboyant outfits, pretentious cake shops, cake, cats, pretty manga art and nice music.  I'd recommend buying it but not paying full price for it and definitely not paying extra for things that the game's dialogue still doesn't exactly hide is happening, and that you can have more fun imagining for yourself :p

comentarios: A truly distopian world wrapped in a kusoge shell.  [spoiler] Some time in the recent past, scientists have created a successful human-cat hybrid creature, all of which are female.  Their growth patterns are bizarre, combining "cat years" and human physiological growth to develop an adult at a mere one to two years of life.  As a side effect of the hybridization, they are born infertile.  As the hybrids grow in popularity, Japan's legal system develops a crude set of regulations to keep the new pseudospecies in check.  Catgirls, as they are informally regarded, must have legal documentation on hand at all times, or they may be arrested and detained.  They must be owned by a documented citizen, and may only be employed by express concent of their owner. [/spoiler]  All of this is explicitly detailed in the roughly two to three hours of text composing NekoPara Vol. 1.  There are no choices to be made, little player interaction, and basically no replay value. It's a technologically sound, high quality Visual Novel, with perhaps the strangest, most thought-out plot for getting cat ears on french maids even written.  Regardless of whether you download the 18+ patch for explicit nudity, and this truly is a plot spoiler, [spoiler] you unambiguously mate with both cats. [/spoiler]  It's not for me.  But it delivers moderately on every promise it makes.

comentarios: At 4 and a half hours worth of content, Nekopara Vol 1 doesn't have a ton to offer. The plot is a slice of life about opening a bakery and living with nekos that will either work for you because you wanna bone one of the characters or not work because it is, penultimately, boring. The writing isn't particularly good but the voice work is cute, the translation is one of the better VN productions I've seen in a while as well. The art is fantastic, I've been a fan of Sayori for a number of years so you won't be let down. Pretty much if you buy this, you know what you're buying it for and will enjoy the cuteness of it and the shallow self-insert fantasy. But if you're looking for a decent plot to complement your "plot" I'd check elsewhere.   But overall, it's a fun VN. I'd purchase it on sale though, the price tag is a little steep for the minimal content you get.

comentarios: Where can I start? This game follows a Male Protagonist, Kashou, as he tries to stand on his two feet in society by starting his own cafe. Kashou discovers that two of his family's cats, Chocola and Vanilla, has followed him and allows them to stay by helping out with the new store.  Nekopara is slightly different compared to VNs of the past where sprites are not used. Instead the game relys on "E-mote" system where characters are brought to life.   This game has a very light hearted tone and vague storyline. Everything is done over the top like most VNs in Japan. There really isn't anything majorly wrong with the game per say, but I could imagine people not enjoying cat servicing.  I really enjoyed playing this w/o the 18+ DLC as it keeps it very light hearted. I do wish however, rather than skipping the 18+ scenes and placing the story just after the deed it done, the story should be skipped directly to the next chapter.  For the price of the game, it's definitely worth buying even without the 18+ DLC.

comentarios: I expected this to be a mindless, plotless bit of cute fluff and lewdness that I could tab over to during downtime in other games.  Instead, I plumbed the depths of human depravity in an unintentional horror story about an eerie world in which people are chattel, either abandoned to die hopeless and alone or treated as a mix of animal and idiot child unless their owners feel like fucking them. The developers of Nekopara needed to tackle the question of how their faceless, voiceless player self-insert vehicle would come to live in a cramped apartment with a bevy of amorous catgirls.   They had many options. They chose, apparently totally blind to the implications, the option in which humanity uplifts another terrestrial species to human levels of intelligence, but then elects to keep them as pets/slaves/sex toys, maintaining a system of psychological degradation and police-enforced dependence in order to keep them docile and reliant on their masters.  And nobody comments on this intensely unethical behavior--in fact, it is so normal that people publically praise individuals who chose to maintain sexual relations with sophonts who are a) their property, b) in an extremely submissive relationship (in terms of power dynamics), c) viewed as nonhuman animals or children by most of the population.  That's purely the worldbuilding. I could comment on the fetishization of mating seasons or the usual pseudo-incestuous relationships, but frankly none of that could top the entirely unintentional creepiness of the worldbuilding which makes the plot possible.  Of course this probably came about because they used 90% of the budget animating sex scenes and boob jiggle, leaving their writers to subsist on the packaging from the instant noodles the rest of the team ate. Long-term dehydration and malnourishment probably doesn't help the creative process.  "9/10, needs more mosaic censoring." -IGN

comentarios: [h1]OVERVIEW[/h1] Nekopara Volume 1 is the second in the Nekopara series of anime visual novels from developer NEKO WORKs, published by Sekai Project. It was actually the first game released, but now has a fan-made prequel: Volume 0.  Nekopara Volume 1 introduces Kashou, a young man who has vacated the family home and moved into an apartment above his new bakery, Patisserie La Soleil. The game hints at various previous happenings in the family that have led Kashou to move out and attempt to start his adult life again on his own. While moving in, Kashou discovers that two large and unfamiliar boxes have been left in the bakery by the movers. When he opens them, he finds Chocola and Vanilla, the two youngest catgirls in the Minaduki family, waiting inside.  If you're not familiar with Nekopara lore already, catgirls are genetically modified human female / cat hybrids, who are partly treated as pets and partly as valuable family members. They are human-sized and with mostly human looks, but with ears, tails, and very feline personality traits. The Minaduki family's youngest member, Kashou's sister, Shigure, owns six of them, all with very distinct personalities: Vanilla, Chocola, Cinnamon, Coconut, Maple, and Azuki  For various reasons, not the least of them being emotional blackmail, Kashou ends up keeping the two catgirls around to help with setting up the bakery, and chooses to hire them as the shop's poster catgirls when La Soleil opens. He soon finds that to be legally employed or to travel around by themselves, the catgirls must pass a test and carry a bell-collar license with them at all times.  Volume 1 focuses on Kashou, Chocola, and Vanilla, in their efforts to open and run the bakery while also learning to live together.  [h1]Graphics[/h1] Graphics are extremely similar to Volume 0, with beautiful paper-doll cut outs and animated models of the catgirls over slightly blurry digitally painted backgrounds. As with Volume 0, animations are much more detailed and frequent than in any other visual novel series that I've seen.  The game has some different drawing styles in parts, including 'chibi' art.   [h1]Sound[/h1] As with Volume 0, both title and in-game music fall into the typical anime theme-song style, with upbeat electronic instruments and an elevator-music feel. The music is well produced and inoffensive, but not the sort of thing I'd listen to while on a long drive.  Sound effects are good, but few and far between, being used to punctuate the music and speech at appropriate places in the story.  All characters except the protagonist, Kashou, are fully voiced. Though I don't understand Japanese well, they seem quite professional to me and suit the personalities well. Sounds and voices are normalised well.  [h1]Gameplay[/h1] Nekopara Volume 1 plays like a traditional visual novel, with no player choices and thus only one available ending. The norm in the genre is to promote replayability through multiple available choices and multiple endings, so it seems a little bit of a letdown to have only a completely linear path with no real interaction available.  The game engine appears to be exactly the same one that is used in Volume 0, with features such as autoplay, skipping, backlog, multiple languages, animations, and the all-important chest bounciness. There are no real interaction points on the screen; all you do is click to advance to the next line of dialogue or the next scene where appropriate.  Though the game has the sexual content and nudity tags on its Steam store page, without the official adult patch it's actually very tame for an anime-themed visual novel. There's a mildly raunchy still shot of a shower scene, with censored nudity, and sex scenes, which are implied or talked about, but not actually shown. The patch is prohibitively expensive -- often more than the game itself -- so I wasn't able to review the adult version of the game.  The story is fairly typical of a manga, anime, or visual novel plot, with no real twists or surprises. It's mostly light hearted and fun, and there are a few genuinely funny parts. The translation isn't the best, but it's definitely passable. You may notice some poor grammar and weird sentences: "She smiled with her usual tone of voice."  The Achievements are almost all unmissable, though there's the same secret Achievement as in Volume 0.   [h1]PROS AND CONS[/h1] Pros: + The same attractive catgirl characters + Steam Achievements and Trading Cards + An adult patch is available, but ...  Cons: - ... the game is already a bit pricey, and the adult patch doubles the cost - Some grammatical errors and other weirdness - No choices or control; just watching and clicking  [h1]CONCLUSION[/h1] Nekopara Volume 1 is an enjoyable visual novel with beautiful, lovable catgirl characters, but a somewhat banal script and no choices or real replayability. Anyone interested in the adult version of the game needs to realise it will cost them double the price of the 'safe' version on Steam, and the Steam version completely skips the erotic scenes that are included in the patch.  Autosave [h1]Save[/h1] Save for Later Pause Quit Rage Quit  [code]For more game reviews, visit [url=http://saveorquit.com/]Save or Quit[/url].[/code]

It's pretty good just like all the others (depending if you played VOl 0 first or if this is your first) The design/art of this game is really great and is worth the money. (imo)  Only thing I kind of wish they could've added to this game were decision making but I guess it would take alot longer and more money to do that stuff ether way though it's a really fun game and again worth the money. comentarios: Been watching NEKOPARA again recently in preparation for vol 3, so thought I'd give my reviews an update too.  NEKOPARA was the first visual novel I tried reading, and it's still the best I've read. What its story lacks in choices, it makes up for in a story with excellent characters and actual depth, which I personally find is lacking in most VNs. Though to be frank, the people who read VNs for the story is probably less than the ones... you get the idea :) Anyways, most of the characters (<3 to Chocola, lol :D) are amusingly quirky, the plot has some great twists to it, and it has a really solid ending - most VN's I've read tend to kind of flop at the end tbh.  A more than solid 10/10. Here's hoping the OVA is as good :) (Only thing I've ever supported via Kickstarter, so it better be, lol)  As a side note, ignore the playtime. I've put far more hours into this than it says, lol. Had to start running it off steam because they made a mess of things and trying to run it with the adult patch installed now makes the game go up the spanner >.>
