comentarios: Here's the review at least a few of you have been waiting for!  For those of you new to visual novels, Nekopara and games like it aren't really games. There are no decisions to be made, no changing the outcome of the story. Just like a book or a movie, you're merely observing as everything plays out.  This story is set in a world where genetically modified cat-girls are kept as pets and servants. The main character opens a bakery and his (oddly obsessive and possibly incestuous) sister sends him two cat-girls as companions to help him out.  The story is, to put it mildly, odd. It gets even stranger when the cat-girls become, ahem, "interested" in their master.  GAMEPLAY  There basically isn't any. You can advance the dialogue and you can interact with the characters in a limited way (by petting them). Again, this isn't really a game.  STORY  There's basically nothing else to Nekopara, so this had better be good. And it is. You'd never expect a story about running a bakery with two "curious" cat-girls to be interesting, but a good visual novel gets you invested in its characters. The two cat-girls are well-written and their personalities are quite distinct. The relationships develop somewhat naturally, as naturally as relationships between humans and genetically-modified cat-women can.  I *did* say it was weird.  GRAPHICS  Honestly, these matter more to a visual novel than you'd expect, since they're half of the game (the *visual* part of visual novel). And here's where the game absolutely shines. Not only are the characters extremely well designed and drawn, the animation is lifelike and fun. Since it is an H-game, there is adjustable bounce, but it seems somewhat odd to include it when neither of the characters it affects are particularly busty.  The backgrounds and settings are pretty average, but the characters themselves are so eye-catching and fun that it's never really an issue.  CONCLUSION  The game's weird, and not really a game. Those are two key points here. It's also (if modded to its intended content) an adult game. However, the story and art are fantastic and the animation is the icing on the cake. If you're the sort of person who doesn't mind games with extremely strange premises that are basically waifu simulators, then this is a really great game.  I give this game five cat-girls out of five.

comentarios: Before I begin, yes. Yes this game is almost exsactly what you think it is. If you can't draw judgement from that, I'll elaborate.   This game is a visual novel, so not so much a game as much as it is a short story with some pictures and animations to go with it. You do not play it at all.  For what I was expecting, I actually got a lot more, though I"ll say my experience with visual novels is extremely thin. It has a great menu system. Everything is where you'd expect it to be, and there are a lot of options to help fine tune the game should you feel the need to. There's even a "Bust bouncyness" option, which thank the lord because it's akward to see them flounder like a fish whenever they make a move. It even comes with 80 save files for whatever reason.   Visually, it passes all the tests. Backgrounds and characters are detailed, and said characters are animated and fully voiced, minus the one male in the game. They even have proper lipsyncing and animations that play on queue to what is said. Though the farther into the game you go, the more you'll see repeating animations and movements. They serve their perpose well, but it does get old after a while.  The music is fine, good even. Nothing to hum to, but enough to set the mood. There's only five of them though, so expect to hear the same tracks many times.   Lastly, the writting... Kinda a mixed bag. What little lore they put in place makes complete sense and makes a great backdrop to the happenings of the game. Things don't tend to "Just be like that". It's coheisive and straight forward.  However, they hit all of the sugar sweet troupes for an anime of this type. Everyone loves the none discript main charecter, everyone is amazing by in game standerds, yadda yadda, you get the idea. You'll catch on to the true motives of the game really quickly. It's dangerously sweet, to excess even. I'll admit I was having fun for a while, but it wore off right around chapter 5 when things started settling in. The pacing is pretty shotty, like a photo album someone made of their favorite parts of a story, the biggest exsample being [spoiler] When the two cover catgirls are trying to obtain their bells, a sort of right of passage permit. One day the little sister know it all comes over to help them study for the first time  to the end of some hijinx, and the very next scene they're coming back from a delivery, bells firmly hung from their necks. No signs of an endevor or anything. [/Spoiler]  Can I reccomend the game? Honestly, I don't know if I have the right to. It's obvious that it has a very specific market it's trying to pitch itself to, even more blatently so in the R-18 version which, thankfully, was edited down in the steam version. My positive recomondation score is based purely off the effort that was put into the workings of the game and the effort that was obviously put into it. What you get out of the game is up to you. Just trust you gut on this one.  TLDR: Sugar, hold the spice, but leave the everything nice. What you see is what you get.

comentarios: I have a love-hate relationship with visual novels. I love the medium and its potential, but the unfortunate truth is that the vast majority of them -- even many popular ones -- have downright execrable writing. Fortunately, [i]NEKOPARA[/i] does not.  While [i]NEKOPARA[/i] occasionally stumbles by including a few of the typical "visual novel-isms" such as a bland protagonist (not too bland, thankfully), characters who state the obvious (though the game doesn't assume we're dumb), characters who announce their feelings ("You can't just have your characters announce how they feel! That makes me feel angry!"), and unnecessary flashbacks (mercifully few and brief), it is, to my amazement, well-written and intelligent for a visual novel and eroge.  The dialogue is, for the most part, passable with occasional flashes of brilliance and poetic constructions -- yes, really; there can rhythm and beauty in seemingly ordinary prose, even in the gutter -- and I have to admit that certain word choices really provided some much-needed scratching of itches. In addition, the dialogue often made curious use of English-language idioms which, to my utter disbelief, were not only used [i]correctly[/i] but also used in evocative ways. For that, I commend the writers and translators for their work.  You may find this hard to believe, but there is some thoughtful and intriguing world-building going on in the background of this silly little erotic visual novel. The idea, for instance, that the catgirls will be arrested if they wander around on their own -- that some catgirls have turned to crime to support themselves -- provides a brief but tantalizing glimpse into a world in which the visual novel's cute, nonsensical premise clashes with a serious, harsh reality. Even the idea of the Bells the cats wear -- the idea that catgirls can educate themselves in human culture in order to be more autonomous -- is fascinating, not the least because the idea's foundations rest on a very old English-language proverb with political connotations: "bell the cat." Think about it.  I'm a writer, not an artist, so I can't give any in-depth review of the art, but in my opinion, the character design is fine. Some of the secondary characters are a little too forgettable in their design, but the main characters are appealing enough. (My personal favorite is Vanilla.) I think the breast bouncing is a bit silly, but the animation during story scenes is often striking. And the animation in erotic scenes is quite good, indeed.  The music is all right. Some of the tracks wear a little thin after a while due to their short length, but others are quite evocative. Some of the sound effects are bad, and they're made even worse by how short they are and how frequently (and unnecessarily) they're looped. The licking/sucking sound effect in particular is irksome -- ugly, even. I would rather have just silence between lines of dialogue than [i]that[/i] particular sound effect.  The voice acting is good. You will likely find some characters more enjoyable to listen to than others, but for my part, I liked all of them. Chocola and Vanilla's voice actresses, of course, deserve particular note. They went above and beyond in recording erotic dialogue. I often found myself astounded by their voice acting.  I have high praise for the UI. It's simple, aesthetically-pleasing, and the configuration menu allows you to change a number of aspects about the game, which I appreciated.  [b]One final thing, and this is important:[/b] if you buy this game on Steam, note that [i]you are not getting the full version of the game[/i]. You are buying a version of the game which has apparently been heavily censored -- all the erotic scenes have been removed from it. I [i]strongly[/i] disapprove of that kind of censorship. [spoiler]Fortunately, there is an unofficial patch available on the patch18 website which (in my experience) allowed me to effortlessly restore the originally-intended content.[/spoiler]  I believe in the right of all artists to write, draw, and otherwise depict whatever they wish. And there are other erotic visual novels available for sale on Steam -- completely uncensored -- so why was this one subjected to such heavy-handed and needless censorship? I don't know the full story, but I can say this: if not for that patch, I would not be recommending this game. To me, it is unconscionable to sell only part of a product but market it as the whole. Perhaps this is Steam's fault. Perhaps it's the distributor's. I do not know.  Overall, I would say that [i]NEKOPARA[/i] is worth taking a look into if you're looking to play an interesting and sexy visual novel with fairly good dialogue. I would especially recommend taking a look at it if you are interested in, as I am, writing and developing erotic visual novels. It has many elements that it does well -- dialogue, voice acting, character design, animation -- and you could certainly do worse in finding games to guide and inspire your own work.

comentarios: [h1]Nekopara is a visual novel where the main character moves out of his home to start his own cafe in the city. Not too long after moving, he learns his kawaii catgirls decided to tag along with him.[/h1]  [i]When I boot up this game, many of my friends call me a creeper, a weirdo... and some even call me a nerd without a girlfriend, and one even called me a weeaboo freak. When I look at the cute neko girl faces in this visual novel, I don't care what my friends call me.[/i]  As a visual novel, [b]Nekopara is just a game you play for the story[/b]. Listening and/or reading dialogue, and seeing the characters animate (which they animate pretty well). This game is pretty short, and [i]could be completed in about 4 hours on autopilot.[/i]  [b]There is an 18+ version/patch available not on Steam, if you would like to see cutscenes involving intimacy with the neko girls[/b] (I personally have it).  Is it worth the $10? I personally enjoy anime/manga, so a visual novel of this quality is actually fine for $10 in my opinion. Is the 18+ version worth $20? Well, I'll admit it's the first time I've seen an 18+ visual novel with animated scenes, but uh... no comment...

comentarios: I know these kind of games usually gather the funny styled reviews but I will try and give it a more serious one for people who are geniounly interested in Visual Novel titles (Hentai or not).   Let's start with the positives first. Everything in the game is well drawn and all characters during dialogues are animated giving it far more flair than most games of this genre which are usually consist of static images. The voice overs are decent (even though there is no choice for other languages other than Japanese), and the translators did a good job not butchering the script. Also if you apply the 18+ patch the sex scenes are well drawn and animated, so if you bought this game just for the porn aspect you will get your money's worth.    And those are all the positives of the game. Unfortunately the negatives outweight them by quite the margin. For start there are no choices to be made in the entirety of Nekopara. You just read the dialogues with no way to alter the story. And since I mentioned the story, basically there is none. It tries to tell a story of a world were humanoid cat girls exist and what is their place in the society but quickly it stops bothering. After the half hour mark it only cares about the sex and every conflict it tries to create is resolved in a couple of panels. Also, not only the game last around 2 hours it doesn't have multiple endings.   All in all, a well drawn Visual Novel with decent echhi scenes but nothing else. No decent story, no memorable characters, no multiple endings, extremely short. Get it only if you are into anime cat girls.

comentarios: Japan holds technology capable of breeding a race of humanoids who reach maturity in about a year. In most cases, this would lead to an army of easily and quickly replacable samurai assault troops with the capacity to conquer, say, the South China Sea. In this case, however, we take a sharp left through a brick wall and create a race of adorable, female only, human-feline hybrids, whom cannot produce offspring with humans and have no logical means of maintaining population, and are also quite dim-witted. World conquest grows ever farther, but cuddles and fucks aplenty here.  Nekopara is a kinetic novel about a guy/possible robot who finds family and companionship with his ever loyal twin catgirls. Yep, that about sums the plot up. That said, the animation is pretty amazing, with characters that sway and blink and whatnot, appearing quite lively compared to most VNs I've seen. I was quite taken by the animation, and the catgirls are endearing characters, although I sure as hell wouldn't want a real one. Overall, I'd recommend it, especially if its on sale.

comentarios: NekoPara Vol 1. is an adult oriented, though there is an All-Ages version available, VN featuring adorable catgirls and is the 1st of a series of 3. There are no choices to be had just plain ol’ reading/listening & a few vanilla sex scenes in the 18+ version, this is an Eroge not a Nukige, so the sex is not the aim of the game, one does not equal the other. It features only Japanese voice acting, a lot of it & for everyone but the MC. The story follows Kashou Minaduki, an aspiring baker who has recently moved away from his family for reasons to open up his own shop. Metal Gear Solid style our 2 main catgirls, Chocola & Vanilla, have snuck in inside of his moving boxes. After some back & forth they convince poor baker boy to let them stay.  Right out the bat I will say that the overarching story is a bit drab as this is an introductory game, though individual characters show some growth so it isn’t all that bad & has its funny as well as its share of sad moments.  The story is presented in the VN style of text boxes & sprites, though the sprites are animated using ‘E-mote’, a system akin to Live2D. It is pretty amazing seeing what would normally be plain static images come to life as they express themselves in various ways as they talk. This feature is also used on most of the sex scenes to great effect. Standard art is also used, with some chibi art used on comedic occasions & backgrounds fitting the overall style, which I appreciate. Music is decent with most of it being cheery stuff and a few somber tracks.  Option wise, it is also the standard VN affair for the most part, with sliders for sound volume, text box transparency, etc. The game features Chinese along with Japanese & English text, as mentioned voices will always be Japanese. You can customize the sound volume for each character along with extra voices. The ‘E-mote’ system allow for... chest bounciness (Press the ‘P’ on your keyboard, trust me) which you can customize with a slider too, though I must be blind since I didn’t see much change.  All in all, Neko Para Vol. 1 is a beautiful, but only ok storywise VN that would be of best value when purchased at a discount as the story was very tame & serving as more of stepping stone to the sequels. The art & usage of ‘E-mote’ to bring to life sprites is pretty amazing & something to be experienced & will definitely continue to experience as soon as I get my hands on the sequels. With a 3rd one in the works along with an anime OVA fans are sure to have plenty of NekoPara for a while to come.

comentarios: 水無月嘉祥(みなづき かしょう)は伝統ある老舗和菓子屋である実家を出て、パティシエとして自身のケーキ屋『ラ・ソレイユ』を一人で開店する。 しかし実家から送った引っ越し荷物の中に、実家で飼っていた人型ネコのショコラとバニラが紛れ込んでいた。 追い返そうとするも二匹の必死の嘆願に嘉祥が折れて、ついに一人と二匹でソレイユをオープンすることに。 大好きなご主人様のために、失敗しながらも一生懸命頑張るネコ二匹が織り成す、ちょっとＨでハートフルなネココメディ、ここに開店！

comentarios: Well, 2017 (well, the Winter Sale, actually) got me to give in and try these "Light Novel" things.   Now, as an anime fan, I thought this was cute. Since all you can really do is watch it go by (automatically or at your own pace) it's another show to watch / experience.  As a gamer, this was boring as HELL!!! There is little to no input on your part. All you really do is click to continue the script and that's it. If there were any choices, that would have made it more of a game (and IMO, more fun) but as it stands, it has none and shouldn't be considered a game.  But, all in all, this was a fun experience (if, at times, a bit uncomfortable - I never will understand the Japanese fascination of sisters wanting to get it on with their brothers) and I recommend it if you need a break from long gaming sessions. I can definitely see the appeal for Fan-Service fans and anime fans alike. If the Nekopara franchise ever makes an actual game where you can do things, I'm in. An anime is planned, I believe, and that will be something to look forward to as well.  TTLD: If the price is right, pick up this little show but don't expect any actual gameplay, there is none.

comentarios: Ok, I want to be honest.  NekoPara is my favorite visual novel.   I mean, come on, agree with me. Who never thought about Nekos and how nice it would be for them to be real. Well, NekoPara lets your wish come true. IN A VERY GOOD WAY. First of all, I should warn you, since it's on steam, this is the ALL-Ages version, means no "special" scene's and censorism, but still, that doesn't kill this for me. I love the story and the characters into the absolute. You really recognize that this visual novel was made with lots of love and hard work. The drawings are good, the story better and the characters are the best. I love how vanilla changes her way to think of her "master" Kashou. First, she dislikes him a bit, but then slowly she begins to fall in love with him. Also, the music is just great.  Huh, I love NekoPara. 10/10, You should definatly buy it if you like Nekos and Visual Novels!  (Btw, an Anime is coming soon. Before someone insults me, I mean an "OVA"!)

comentarios: Note: I played the non-patched adult version, meaning no sexual content was shown or told, but time lapsed over.  I had to read these in short bursts, like a chapter each.  People kept implying it was a porn-game with the screenshots I kept seeing so wasn't interested in getting it. A friend gifted me this and Vol 0. I read vol 0 first and wrote a review for that then started reading this. (Vol 0 review here: http://steamcommunity.com/id/BluePaw/recommended/385800 )  There's a lot of tear jerking moments that at times seems overwhelming or ubundent, or just drones on as filler that it gets annoying and want to move on. The characters you meet are unique in their own way. The animation for a VN seemed good. Voices... I guess were okay? Usually prefer english dub in Anime so... what do I know?  How the story ended left a sour taste in my mouth... felt it should've ended a few chapters sooner.  However... despite all that, I loved it. I was slowly warming up & understanding the characters and the world they lived in. My only constant irk was catgirls always refering to their owners as "master"... I understand it's part of that world but just felt awkward, always, when they tell that to the guy you're viewing from that it feels like they're saying that to the reader directly.  There was suggestive themes that I didn't mind since it didn't get carried away or annoying, as they were either comical or romantic... however some parts were overly romantic that I wanted to throw up! (I'm not a romance person, obviously.)  This is a good read though. The story is actually interesting overall and the characters have their purpose in the story, regardless of how they were designed. This isn't a porn game, this is a story with minor adult themes but not focused on such things.  I have no interest in getting the 18+ or patch as I prefered, in this VN, to time lapse them and let me speculate what could happened on the after-math scene. Wouldn't feel comfortable to see such a thing with these characters.  -----  Check out more games I see that deserve more attention from my curator group: [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/BPUGL]BluePaw's Underrated Games List[/url] Join and/or follow if you wish.

comentarios: Nekopara Vol. 1 is a Japanese anime Visual Novel. This story is an alt future slice of life story with an "eroge" love triangle. I thought it had good, understandable, cute, funny and interesting story. It has great artwork, japanese voiceovers, english subtitles, animation, music and sound.    Has more animations of characters, including a chest bouncyness slider.  It is a cliche anime story, characters and fanservice.  There was no choices, but Good for 5 hours of "Reading". Has Easy steam achievements and badge cards.  Has a movie gallery and a scene gallery.  It has a free hentai patch, wow nice extra hentai material, blurry xxx.   Warning: NSFW, NSFH and could give men a boner. I needed a shower after finishing this. Nudge Nudge Wink Wink.  Might be worth the full price, but better to get this on sale or with the Nekopara Bundle.  For more info. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7cfrxT1p9c0  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oN0qraATfMg  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YLvTHPzy0nc  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KIoglhtaPDk  http://kotaku.com/nekopara-vol-1-as-told-by-steam-reviews-1681441419  http://www.hardcoregamer.com/2014/12/29/review-nekopara-vol-1/125709/  http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/nekopara-vol-1  http://www.otakustudy.com/visual-novel/2015/01/nekopara-volume-1-visual-novel-review/

In fact, there is a semi-crisis near the end and I felt all sad for them. - the story was pretty decent. - lots of cat-girls!  I didn't like: - there was nothing about this I didn't like!  With all that said, I feel like this isn't for everybody.  If you're into VNs or cat-girls, then get this on sale.

comentarios: This game just looks so pleasant and Weebie! who wouldn't like to play it.  Of course if you're unsure then this may help you decide if it's for you -  It's a VN so there's little gameplay and no choices but the story is quite nice and the art is really clean! the characters speak and even move and erm... Bounce. The game nicely caters to your fanservice needs with cat-girls, but it's all very linear like a kinetic novel.  You don't have choice between your hoes, despite it saying "dating sim" in the tags, it in fact follows the two simple-minded neko girls Chocola and Vanilla as they're being cute around Kashou Minaduki, the owner of La Soleil. The whole Nekopara bundle is probably about 20 odd dollars all up so it's reletively cheap for such a pleasant experience.  It's basically a kinetic novel but if you like cat girls you should buy it.

The bee, of course, flies anywayy     because bees don't care what humans think is impossible.     Yellow, black. Yellow, black. Yellow, black. Yellow, black.     Ooh, black and yellow! Let's shake it up a little.     Barry! Breakfast is ready!     Ooming!     Hang on a second.     Hello?     - Barry? - Adam?     - Oan you believe this is happening? - I can't. I'll pick you up.     Looking sharp.     Use the stairs. Your father paid good money for those.     Sorry. I'm excited.     Here's the graduate. We're very proud of you, son.     A perfect report card, all B's.     Very proud.     Ma! I got a thing going here.     - You got lint on your fuzz. - Ow! That's me!     - Wave to us! We'll be in row 118,000. - Bye!     Barry, I told you, stop flying in the house!     - Hey, Adam. - Hey, Barry.     - Is that fuzz gel? - A little. Special day, graduation.     Never thought I'd make it.     Three days grade school, three days high school.     Those were awkward.     Three days college. I'm glad I took a day and hitchhiked around the hive.     You did come back different.     - Hi, Barry. - Artie, growing a mustache? Looks good.     - Hear about Frankie? - Yeah.     - You going to the funeral? - No, I'm not going.     Everybody knows, sting someone, you die.     Don't waste it on a squirrel. Such a hothead.     I guess he could have just gotten out of the way.     I love this incorporating an amusement park into our day.     That's why we don't need vacations.     Boy, quite a bit of pomp... under the circumstances.     - Well, Adam, today we are men. - We are!     - Bee-men. - Amen!     Hallelujah!     Students, faculty, distinguished bees,     please welcome Dean Buzzwell.     Welcome, New Hive Oity graduating class of...     ...9:15.     That concludes our ceremonies.     And begins your career at Honex Industries!     Will we pick ourjob today?     I heard it's just orientation.     Heads up! Here we go.     Keep your hands and antennas inside the tram at all times.     - Wonder what it'll be like? - A little scary.     Welcome to Honex, a division of Honesco     and a part of the Hexagon Group.     This is it!     Wow.     Wow.     We know that you, as a bee, have worked your whole life     to get to the point where you can work for your whole life.     Honey begins when our valiant Pollen Jocks bring the nectar to the hive.     Our top-secret formula     is automatically color-corrected, scent-adjusted and bubble-contoured     into this soothing sweet syrup     with its distinctive golden glow you know as...     Honey!     - That girl was hot. - She's my cousin!     - She is? - Yes, we're all cousins.     - Right. You're right. - At Honex, we constantly strive     to improve every aspect of bee existence.     These bees are stress-testing a new helmet technology.     - What do you think he makes? - Not enough.     Here we have our latest advancement, the Krelman.     - What does that do? - Oatches that little strand of honey     that hangs after you pour it. Saves us millions.     Oan anyone work on the Krelman?     Of course. Most bee jobs are small ones. But bees know     that every small job, if it's done well, means a lot.     But choose carefully     because you'll stay in the job you pick for the rest of your life.     The same job the rest of your life? I didn't know that.     What's the difference?     You'll be happy to know that bees, as a species, haven't had one day off     in 27 million years.     So you'll just work us to death?     We'll sure try.     Wow! That blew my mind!     "What's the difference?" How can you say that?     One job forever? That's an insane choice to have to make.     I'm relieved. Now we only have to make one decision in life.     But, Adam, how could they never have told us that?     Why would you question anything? We're bees.     We're the most perfectly functioning society on Earth.     You ever think maybe things work a little too well here?     Like what? Give me one example.     I don't know. But you know what I'm talking about.     Please clear the gate. Royal Nectar Force on approach.     Wait a second. Oheck it out.     - Hey, those are Pollen Jocks! - Wow.     I've never seen them this close.     They know what it's like outside the hive.     Yeah, but some don't come back.     - Hey, Jocks! - Hi, Jocks!     You guys did great!     You're monsters! You're sky freaks! I love it! I love it!     - I wonder where they were. - I don't know.     Their day's not planned.     Outside the hive, flying who knows where, doing who knows what.     You can'tjust decide to be a Pollen Jock. You have to be bred for that.     Right.     Look. That's more pollen than you and I will see in a lifetime.     It's just a status symbol. Bees make too much of it.     Perhaps. Unless you're wearing it and the ladies see you wearing it.     Those ladies? Aren't they our cousins too?     Distant. Distant.     Look at these two.     - Oouple of Hive Harrys. - Let's have fun with them.     It must be dangerous being a Pollen Jock.     Yeah. Once a bear pinned me against a mushroom!     He had a paw on my throat, and with the other, he was slapping me!     - Oh, my! - I never thought I'd knock him out.     What were you doing during this?     Trying to alert the authorities.     I can autograph that.     A little gusty out there today, wasn't it, comrades?     Yeah. Gusty.     We're hitting a sunflower patch six miles from here tomorrow.     - Six miles, huh? - Barry!     A puddle jump for us, but maybe you're not up for it.     - Maybe I am. - You are not!     We're going 0900 at J-Gate.     What do you think, buzzy-boy? Are you bee enough?     I might be. It all depends on what 0900 means.     Hey, Honex!     Dad, you surprised me.     You decide what you're interested in?     - Well, there's a lot of choices. - But you only get one.     Do you ever get bored doing the same job every day?     Son, let me tell you about stirring.     You grab that stick, and you just move it around, and you stir it around.     You get yourself into a rhythm. It's a beautiful thing.     You know, Dad, the more I think about it,     maybe the honey field just isn't right for me.     You were thinking of what, making balloon animals?     That's a bad job for a guy with a stinger.     Janet, your son's not sure he wants to go into honey!     - Barry, you are so funny sometimes. - I'm not trying to be funny.     You're not funny! You're going into honey. Our son, the stirrer!     - You're gonna be a stirrer? - No one's listening to me!     Wait till you see the sticks I have.     I could say anything right now. I'm gonna get an ant tattoo!     Let's open some honey and celebrate!     Maybe I'll pierce my thorax. Shave my antennae.     Shack up with a grasshopper. Get a gold tooth and call everybody "dawg"!

comentarios: I do recommend this game for lots and lots of reasons, but to keep it short, it's "amusing" how "engaging" this game can be. From the characters being virtually alluring in many kinds of ways you can describe "lewd" of any sort. However, not just the product of eye candy and blood enducing moments does this "game" can make you create, but it can also twirl your heart in such a way no man can ever explain, only a neko can I presume, no, I believe. As this game can toy with you here and there it can also shape you into a person you'd never imagine. A human, a cat, heh, a NEKO. The embodiment of all creations, the starting point of life itself, the almighty NEKO can change not only your mentality towards the world revolving beneath your feet, but the soul residing within you can change from a pitiful shrowl of death to a blossoming garden of tranquility.  In short, this game is pretty good :D

comentarios: I saw Dodger play the demo and thought it would be funny to do a let's play of the full game.  Even got my best friend to agree to what I -thought- would be a short, cutesy co-cast.  What we got was countless hours of recording an emotional rollercoaster: uncomfortable bonding, coping with alcoholism, developing the back story and lore of an Italian cashew masquerading as a French baker in Staten Island, Japan, battling to keep the game as Wholesome, Family-Fun™ for as long as possible, and trying to salvage a finale we accidentally skipped through twice.  Nekopara destroyed my channel and I still haven't shaken off all the subs asking for more catgirl/animu/VN videos.  100/10 actually the most enjoyable ball of fluff I've ever played.

comentarios: In consideration of the ageing population of Japan, it is a relief to find that there are still young members of the workforce who are able to take the next step forward in small business ownership.   NEKOPARA Vol. 1 is a visual novel that deals with the startup and establishment of a small business in the local economy. While not so much touching on the subject of financing and legal procedure associated with new entrepreneurship, NEKOPARA Vol. 1 does delve into the issues associated with human resource management particularly those of the interpersonal relationships between employees and employer. As with any SME (small and medium enterprises), delegation has long been an issue in the first few years of ownership. In fact, inefficient assignment of responsibilities is a major cause of business failure.   NEKOPARA Vol. 1 follows a young business owner in Japan as he works through the bumps and kinks faced by new business owners. It touches on subjects related to the securing and development of human resources which in turn leads to the promotion of organizational growth. Subjects such as: - pampering your kawaii neko-chan employees through intimate skinship - sleeping with those same neko-chan employees to indulge their lust as they sexually mature - acquiring the most kawaii desu attire for your neko-chans to wear to satisfy your filthy maid fetish - appease your imouto-chan who calls you up every second day to get off to your alpha male-testosterone filled voice - baking cakes.  I'd highly recommend this game to anyone who is looking for insight into the development of SME's in Japan under the parliamentary guidance of Shinzō Abe during his second term as PM.  And lolicons.

comentarios: I played this game during a bout of heavy insomnia, stress (moving houses/downsizing) and anxiety. at first i was intriuged at the thought of girls that were also cats (once a wholsome concept to me i assure you) but around the time of the "give us a bath"scene (if you've played it, you'll understand) i began to realize the true horror that was "NEKOPARA Vol. 1" after the aforementioned scene i clung to my chair as the lights in our neighbor's house flicked on and in my desk mirror, i watched my neighbor's eight year old son stare on in horror through  his livingroom window into our diningroom window (moving houses so no curtians) as the cat girls "chesticles" ungulated at high velocity. at this point i could do no more than turn off my monitor and then all the lights in the room untill his mother escorted him sternly (assuming) back to his bedroom. after that, i decided to tempt fate and return to the game (i have to finish what i start... i'm also sort of a self loathing masochist) i ended up completeing the game with all but two achivements (something that jiggles...) and by the time dawn rolled around my face was frozen in a perpetual scowl and my voice obliterated from screaming "NO!" as loudly as possible. overall, not a bad game for someone who's into this sort of thing, but for eight year old boys discovering voyurism for the first time, curiosity definately killed the catgirl.

comentarios: this is a game that your friend sends you when it's on sale to be funny, but then one night you get really bored and your friend is like "hey remember nekopara? you should play that" and so you do and it's really bad but you have nothing better to do so you play for like 3 hours and then the story comes to an end and it fades to black and you celebrate cause at that point you'd rather be sitting in a pit of flames than playing this game, but then the title screen pops up and you realize that was just the intro so you close the game and go to bed while contemplating your choice of friends and the overall direction of your life.  and then the next day your other friend is like "hey you should finish nekopara" and you're like "no" but he's like "if you don't finish nekopara i'm gonna burn your house down" so you decide to finish nekopara. so you're playing it (and by playing i mean watching cause you do literally nothing but click forward) and it's like 2 in the morning and you're kinda tired and like 31% more confused than usual and your friend is starting to get... kinda into things despite not even being the one playing the game and then suddenly he's off somewhere having jason bourne grow potatoes in his ass and you're alone and vaguely traumatized so you go to bed.  then it's sunday and you're like "man sunday sucks" and hey guess what else sucks? nekopara. so you decide to finish the game cause you've got like 20 minutes of it left anyway, and also you noticed that the trading cards sell for like 3 dollars each for some reason. so you finish the game without paying attention to what's actually happening in it and you're like 40% sure you might've fucked your little sister but nekopara is finally over so you don't care anymore.  for weeks afterward you have nightmares about catgirls running for president. your friends are starting to look like catgirls. you went out to see the new jason bourne movie, but it was actually about a 12 year old catgirl escaping the bonds of slavery and leading the catgirl revolution. after deciding you need to do something, you schedule an appointment with a therapist.   8 years later, the hallucinations are gone. you've got your life back together. you married your high school sweetheart, and you live with her and 3 kids in a nice suburban home you bought with the money from selling nekopara steam trading cards. you're working at your dream job, and everything is going well.  it's christmas morning. while you relax, watching your children play with their new toys, you feel a buzz from your pocket. you got an email.   you read the subject line.  [b]You've received a gift copy of the game NEKOPARA Vol. 2 on Steam.[/b]

comentarios: This is a visual novel about You opening a brand new bakery away from home. Your little sister is left in charge of the Nekos (catgirls) at the home. However she is rather good at being a troll it seems. While unpacking you discover that there are two boxes that are quite heavy and also making noises. Two of the Nekos, the two main Nekos of this chapter, have stowed away and are now living with you in the bakery. This follows You and Chocola and Vannila as they try and become official workers at your bakery.   This story is awesome. It is full of adorable voice acting and scenes. Slight animation on the characters help to bring them more to life. The pros and cons will follow now.  Pros: 1. Excellent Voice Acting 2. Adorable Characters 3. Well written story 4. Quite fitting animation 5. Written text is available in English for us Muricans 6. Character development is pretty natural in the story flow and not choked in with exposition. 7. Voice over is only in Japanese 8. Optional H Patch  Cons: 1. Optional H Patch ruins the purity and cuteness of the Characters. 2. Animation can be a little jumpy and can glitch out the character sprites. (Happens very rarely) 3. Voice over is only in Japanese  4. Story is over a little to quickly

comentarios: I really want to make a serious review on this title as I actually quite enjoyed it not because of the mature parts, but more so for the art and music.  Got this game when it went on sale as I wanted to try and see what the appeal of visual novels were and why there were so many on Steam. My reasoning for choosing this one is actually pretty simple: it's very colorful and the characters all have glass-shine eyes which I really adore. Anime in general always inspires me to be creative whether it be art or writing.  Anyway, the story itself is not bad. It's a simple story of a guy wanting to start a life of his own only to have to deal with his catgirls which are considered pets. If I recall correctly, they're not Humans made into Cats, but the other way around which kind of gives me some moral issues. That's just me, but each their own.  Each character is a stereotype of some kind. Chocola's an airhead, Vanilla is calm-minded but always goes to the extremes, etc. About halfway through, I actually stopped caring about any of them apart from Vanilla who at least stayed consistent enough to not have me smash my face against my desk. There's one minor arc in here that I made me sad which I won't spoil here.   Music in this game is fantastic, each track sets a perfect mood for the scene even if it's cliche as hell. Art, as I said before, is really beatiful and very well done. For me it was worth the price I paid which I think was $8. As for the suggestive scene(?) it's not really that bad. Definitely want to make sure nobody is around, though.  Also, I want to gripe about this because there is absolutely [b]NO REASON[/b] for this, why the hell are there 10 pages of save slots? Also, deleting them corrupts the file so if you accidentally saved, I don't know of a fix right now other than probably a fresh install. Back to the point, no visual novel, I don't care how long, does not need 170 save slots even if I were to save at every single scene.   I recommend this if you are looking for something simple that you can read for an hour.

comentarios: [i]Joke reviews aside[/i], this VN is pretty good! The artwork is superb, the VA is great and it has animations, that's right, animated characters! Be wary though, because the animations in this VN is quite taxing on your CPU/GPU (It might not be the case on your PC, but it's a little too heavy on my netbook). Also, make sure to set your [u]mipmap quality[/u] setting for this game in your GPU control panel to [u]"High Quality"[/u], since setting it to "Performance/Low Quality" will make the characters in animated scenes blurry. How about the story you say? Well it's there and it does its job, but it's there so you can see cute catgirls moments and nothing else really. Also there's no different conversation choices and ending for this VN, but you're going to see catgirls anyway, so i won't worry too much about that part. In conclusion, if you like animated catgirls and you don't mind going through texts to see more animated catgirls, go buy this VN! -billy96

comentarios: The world of NEKOPARA sounds interesting enough. At some point, genetic engineering has progressed to the point where catgirls are available as pets, companions, and whatnot. Nowadays, there are less stray catgirls, and there are hints of problems with some involved in criminal activity. To combat this problem, catgirls with owners can have their pets take an exam to get a Bell collar that allows them to be monitored and walk in public by themselves.   Unfortunately for those who like visual novels with serious storylines, this is not one. Kashou leaves his strict household to open a Western-style bakery. However, two of his family's cats, Chocola and Vanilla, follow him, and refuse to leave. He ends up hiring them, and light, fluffy, slice of life romance ensues. Made somewhat awkward by his initial impression of the two as daughters, the romance is pretty much tacked on.  Thankfully, the ero scenes have been removed from the Steam release.  However, as someone who loves cats, there are some interesting questions that just don't get any answers. Catgirls, despite their humanoid appearance, age at the same rate as real cats. People refer to treating their catgirls as their children. There's a bit of fridge horror in that question. Catgirls seem to be genetically engineered to be sterile, presumably to save them the trauma of a surgery. The criminal element is not explained, though for some reason, catgirls stealing people's food, knocking things over, and causing trouble by climbing tall things comes to mind.   So do I recommend this game? That depends on the player, really. Too bad there's not a 'so-so' button. Despite that, I want to see how Kashou and his cat family do running the bakery. I'm actually curious about the background of this world. Will I like what I find? I'll find something, I'm sure.

comentarios: Bread is a staple food prepared from a dough of flour and water, usually by baking. Throughout recorded history it has been popular around the world and is one of the oldest artificial foods, having been of importance since the dawn of agriculture.  There are many combinations and proportions of types of flour and other ingredients, and also of different traditional recipes and modes of preparation of bread. As a result, there are wide varieties of types, shapes, sizes, and textures of breads in various regions. Bread may be leavened by many different processes ranging from the use of naturally occurring microbes (for example in sourdough recipes) to high-pressure artificial aeration methods during preparation or baking. However, some products are left unleavened, either for preference, or for traditional or religious reasons. Many non-cereal ingredients may be included, ranging from fruits and nuts to various fats. Commercial bread in particular, commonly contains additives, some of them non-nutritional, to improve flavor, texture, color, shelf life, or ease of manufacturing.  Depending on local custom and convenience, bread may be served in various forms at any meal of the day. It also is eaten as a snack, or used as an ingredient in other culinary preparations, such as fried items coated in crumbs to prevent sticking, or the bland main component of a bread pudding, or stuffings designed to fill cavities or retain juices that otherwise might drip away.  Partly because of its importance as a basic foodstuff, bread has a social and emotional significance beyond its importance in nutrition; it plays essential roles in religious rituals and secular culture. Its prominence in daily life is reflected in language, where it appears in proverbs, colloquial expressions ("He stole the bread from my mouth"), in prayer ("Give us this day our daily bread") and even in the etymology of words, such as "companion" and "company" (literally those who eat/share bread with you).  Contents [hide]  1 Etymology 2 History 3 Types 4 Preparation 4.1 Formulation 4.2 Flour 4.3 Liquids 4.4 Leavening 4.4.1 Chemical leavening 4.4.2 Yeast 4.4.3 Sourdough 4.4.4 Steam 4.4.5 Bacteria 4.4.6 Aeration 4.5 Fats or shortenings 4.6 Bread improvers 5 Properties 5.1 Chemical composition 5.2 Serving and consumption 5.3 Nutritional significance 5.4 Shelf life 5.5 Crust 6 Cultural significance 6.1 Europe 6.2 Latin America 6.3 North Africa 6.4 Asia 6.5 North America 7 Religious significance 7.1 Abrahamic Religions 7.2 Paganism 8 Anti-bread movements 9 In Medicine 10 See also 11 References 12 Further reading 13 External links Etymology The word itself, Old English bread, is most common in various forms to many Germanic languages, such as Frisian brea, Dutch brood, German Brot, Swedish bröd, and Norwegian and Danish brød; it has been claimed to be derived from the root of brew. It may be connected with the root of break, for its early uses are confined to broken pieces or bits of bread, the Latin crustum, and it was not until the 12th century that it took the place—as the generic name for bread—of hlaf (hlaifs in Gothic: modern English loaf), which appears to be the oldest Teutonic name.[1] Old High German hleib[2] and modern German Laib derive from this Proto-Germanic word for "loaf", which was borrowed into Slavic (Polish chleb, Russian khleb) and Finnic (Finnish leipä, Estonian leib) languages as well.  In many cultures, bread is a metaphor for basic necessities and living conditions in general. For example, a "bread-winner" is a household's main economic contributor and has little to do with actual bread-provision. This is also seen in the phrase "putting bread on the table". The Roman poet Juvenal satirized superficial politicians and the public as caring only for "panem et circenses" (bread and circuses). In Russia in 1917, the Bolsheviks promised "peace, land, and bread."[3][4] The term "breadbasket" denotes an agriculturally productive region. In Slavic cultures bread and salt is offered as a welcome to guests. In India, life's basic necessities are often referred to as "roti, kapra aur makan" (bread, cloth, and house). In Israel, the most usual phrase in work-related demonstrations is lekhem, avoda ("bread, work").  The word bread is commonly used around the world in English-speaking countries as a synonym for money[1] (as is the case with the word "dough"). A remarkable or revolutionary innovation is often referred to in North America and the United Kingdom as "the greatest thing since sliced bread" or "the best thing since sliced bread". In Cockney rhyming slang, bread means money; this usage is derived from the phrase "bread and honey".[5]  History Main article: History of bread  Bread shop, Tacuinum Sanitatis from Northern Italy, beginning of the 15th century Bread is one of the oldest prepared foods. Evidence from 30,000 years ago in Europe revealed starch residue on rocks used for pounding plants.[6] It is possible that during this time, starch extract from the roots of plants, such as cattails and ferns, was spread on a flat rock, placed over a fire and cooked into a primitive form of flatbread. Around 10,000 BC, with the dawn of the Neolithic age and the spread of agriculture, grains became the mainstay of making bread. Yeast spores are ubiquitous, including the surface of cereal grains, so any dough left to rest will become naturally leavened.[7]  There were multiple sources of leavening available for early bread. Airborne yeasts could be harnessed by leaving uncooked dough exposed to air for some time before cooking. Pliny the Elder reported that the Gauls and Iberians used the foam skimmed from beer to produce "a lighter kind of bread than other peoples." Parts of the ancient world that drank wine instead of beer used a paste composed of grape juice and flour that was allowed to begin fermenting, or wheat bran steeped in wine, as a source for yeast. The most common source of leavening was to retain a piece of dough from the previous day to use as a form of sourdough starter.[8]  In 1961 the Chorleywood bread process was developed, which used the intense mechanical working of dough to dramatically reduce the fermentation period and the time taken to produce a loaf. The process, whose high-energy mixing allows for the use of lower protein grain, is now widely used around the world in large factories. As a result, bread can be produced very quickly and at low costs to the manufacturer and the consumer. However there has been some criticism of the effect on nutritional value.[9]  Recently, domestic bread machines that automate the process of making bread have become popular.  Types  White bread (left) and brown bread. See also: List of breads Bread is the staple food of the Middle East, North Africa, Europe, and in European-derived cultures such as those in the Americas, Australia, and Southern Africa, in contrast to East Asia where rice is the staple. Bread is usually made from a wheat-flour dough that is cultured with yeast, allowed to rise, and finally baked in an oven. Owing to its high levels of gluten (which give the dough sponginess and elasticity), common wheat (also known as bread wheat) is the most common grain used for the preparation of bread.  Bread is also made from the flour of other wheat species (including durum, spelt and emmer), rye, barley, maize (corn), and oats, usually, but not always, in combination with wheat flour. Spelt bread (Dinkelbrot) continues to be widely consumed in Germany, and emmer bread was a staple food in ancient Egypt. Canadian bread is known for its heartier consistency due to high protein levels in Canadian flour.  Pita is an ancient semi-leavened bread widespread in the Middle East, Levant and South Eastern Europe. White bread is made from flour containing only the central core(endosperm). Brown bread is made with endosperm and 10% bran. It can also refer to white bread with added coloring (often caramel) to make it brown

comentarios: NEKOPARA Vol. 1 is a great game, theres are countless hours of fun and there are a lot of aspects to if that a similar game league of legends is lacking.  1. The workshop, this is where the community really has its biggest aspect on the game, most of the items put into NEKOPARA Vol. 1 come out of the workshop and community artists that are dedicated to their work! 3. Unlike League of legends, all the catgirls in NEKOPARA Vol. 1 are unlocked when you start the game, giving the game a total different aspect and feel. 4. The catgirl pool is very big and very diverse, all the catgirls have differing abilities and there are multiple catgirls for everyone. 5. The catgirls looks beautiful - I personally prefer NEKOPARA Vol. 1 graphics and they way the catgirl  is layed out far more than that of League of legends, I just think its a smarter design. 6. It is usable through steam - My biggest complaint with LoL was that I couldn't play it through steam, but NEKOPARA Vol. 1 solves those problems. 7. If you have a full party or at least 3, the game can be super fun - I think this game is way better with friends, as it adds a whole new aspect to the game. You can show off your gaming skills and honestly have better gameplay with friends, as you know you will be able to communicate with them and pet catgirls much bettter than if you were playing with a bunch of randoms.  There are many more pros but those were just a couple i wanted to say. however there are downsides to NEKOPARA Vol. 1.  1. The community, many members of the community are hostile, or dont communicate or just cant understand you, For example, when I try to que in US West, half the time my team mates are from mexico or just dont speak any japanese. Than you get the people who just mic spam for no reason. 2. It can be really hard to get a match sometimes because of the people who take forever to accept or the people who dont load into the game. I have had times where my games have failed up to 6 times in a row! 3. NEKOPARA Vol. 1 Reborn. For people who may have played the game previously and stopped for a while, NEKOPARA Vol. 1 reborn may be a shock. NEKOPARA Vol. 1 reborn was pretty unecessary and has made the game much more confusing than it needs to be. With NEKOPARA Vol. 1 reborn they are trying to make NEKOPARA look like a much more fancy game than the old loading screen stuff did before, but instead has just made everything more confusing. It will take them a while to work out all the kinks but I think in the end they will work it out.  This is one of my favorite games, it is up there with the likes of Counter Strike - Global Offensive as my top all time most played games, also, living in the NorthWest region, I did get the chance to attend the Sakura-Con, which was one of the best Experiences of my life and would recommend it to anyone interested in going.

comentarios: This game, much like vol. 0 did, will make you question your life. [i]What am I doing with my life?[/i]  This game, is unique to it's story, it teaches you a lot in the relationship between 2 catgirls, how to care and look after them, and what to do and not do as an owner. [spoiler]But let's face it, you just came for the explicit content...[/spoiler]  The game starts off quite what you'd expect, you are a business owner and you have just moved out of the house to try and make a living. But of course, let's not forget, you have extra boxes of stuff that you [i]didn't[/i] order. Which turns out that someone else ordered, you and the delivery woman take care of that and so it then on progresses to you noticing 2 boxes with strange labels on it, that has no delivery notice or anything. You hear a sound from the boxes, and notice that it's the catgirls from the home you moved out from.  As the story progresses you become more and more attached to them, eventually making said catgirls your "catpanions". In other words, they are basically your girlfriends in bed and for life. [spoiler]( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)[/spoiler]  If you are like me, then you will probably chat with other people 90% of the time and the remaning 10% just not care about the explicit scenes. Though, this makes the game appear longer than what it is, partially because it's not really suited for everyone's taste.   To summarize, I enjoyed the story, the details were good and, (I never thought I would say this) felt some kind of attachment to the catgirls. Don't blame me, I like to read, but I aint a bookworm.  It's a good game to "troll" your friends with, but I wouldn't recommend buying it for full price unless you basically have no worries about your economical situation (unlike me).  [spoiler]Though, you should convince them to install the "special patch" for full effect[/spoiler]  10/10, would learn how to get emotionally attached to virtual catgirls again.

comentarios: Characters: 6.5/10  The main character is relatable, and his role seems to be something of a bastion of reliability, and, well... normalcy. His sister, although quite quirky, is also well written. The two main catgirls, by contrast, often behave instinctually, and can be unpredictable. To be honest I found their characters a little exaggerated at times, and difficult to engage with.  Story: 6/10  The story is long, but slow. Character develop and plot development happen in relatively discrete steps, rather than a gradual progression, which for me made immersion difficult. The development of relationships between the characters similarly seemed a little difficult to credit. The story reads like a chapter-based fairy tale or sorts. The fantastic nature of it is good, but it lacks the kind of interal consitency and attention to detail that make other stories believable.  Visuals: 7/10  The artwork is quite nice. Animation is basic. If you have a particular interest in catgirls in maid outfits, or the loli aesthetic (ribbons, bows, lace etc.), it may take your fancy.  Sound: 6.5/10  Voice acting is good. A few nice soundtracks as a backing to the story.  Overall score: 6.5/10  As a visual novel, this story just doesn't have quite enough going for it for me to recommend it.  It's worth noting here that while there is a mature content patch available for this game, it's not the product being sold here on Steam, and as such it's not what I'm basing my review on.

comentarios: As far as erotica goes NEKOPARA is on about the same level as stuff you can find for free. There's no real gameplay, so the achievements are pointless. Thanks to Steam's ban on adult content you can't even get the full package unless you resort to an unofficial patch, so if you are interested you need to make sure that's still available before you even consider purchasing.  The only reason someone might have to pay for this is the art and the voice acting. Unfortunately, the art and voice acting are in support of a dumb harem-style adventure. The plot is over-written at times and the main character is a jackass. Not the worst jackass I've ever had the displeasure of reading (the male protagonist isn't voice-acted), but still annoying. He's also kinda condescending, but considering he's basically a slave owner that's to be expected.  The weird cat-girl slave-race thing is both omnipresent and ignored, like in most pretend-monsterworld-japanese-fantasy-things. Some of the issues that might result from having to share society with less-intelligent genetically-modified human-like creatures is almost touched upon at times and swiftly discarded, because no one wants to go there even if it's hard not to wonder at the twisted possibilities the writing skirts. They make it clear that humans can't breed with cat girls, say nothing about cat boys, and leave the player to fap.  Not worth paying for unless it's heavily discounted or your really into stupid sappy hentai plots and meaningless achievements. Or, if you don't care about buying actual games on Steam. I'm still hoping there's a failure state in here somewhere :(

I experienced true terror, constantly turning down the volume, looking over my shoulder every few minutes, making sure my door was locked several times throughout the game.   My parents are talking in the kitchen just outside my room... I know they're talking about me. I just know it! They must know I'm playing this game... Minutes pass by, I'm just trying to enjoy my catgirls, pressing P more than occasionally. I just know they know! This feeling of dread washes over me... I have to rip my shirt off as a cold sweat takes over and my heart begins to race.... My breathing grows quicker and quicker. I hear footsteps approaching my room... Then it happens. As I get to an H-scene, there's a knock on my door. It's my mom..... she says dinner is ready. A wave of relief passes over me. I step outside my room, happy as can be and go to the dining room. The look of horror and disgust from my parents... They did know... "Son... What were you doing just now?" That's when I realized I was in my boxers, drenched in sweat, with a raging boner. comentarios: [h1]Short Review[/h1] NEKOPARA is one of the best VN's available on Steam right now. You play as a startup cafe owner joined by two catgirls. The story is a slice of life revolving around these three main characters with a few cameos from your sister and the rest of the catgirl bunch. The character development and voice acting are well done.  From a VN standpoint, NEKOPARA utilizes great animations and a full voice cast (besides yourself). The layout is clean and a few game features, such as: repeat voice dialogue, CG/scene/movie viewer, text speed, menu opacity etc., sets this VN above other generic pieces.   Also fyi, the Steam version of this game is censored. There are many guides out there on how to unofficially patch it to the uncensored R-18 version.  [h1]Score[/h1] Great - 9/10

comentarios: NEKOPARA Vol. 1 is a visual novel about uh....Nekos x). The story is about Kashou, who has always wanted to be a western ''pâtissier''. He decided to work his own way to manage his bakery named ''La soleil pâtisserie''. However, arriving at his bakery, he found 2 of his old cat friends - Chocola and Vanilla. At first He tried to make them leave, but soon after, he knew that he was actually forced to accept them to work together with him. You will see how they are going to co-operate and develop their relationships between them little by little, following the story.   This one is quite exclusive and different from the other VNs with its ''E-mote'' system, which adds movements and changes to their attitudes and gests during the dialogue, even without clicking it. Which is almost a perfect combination with those cute catgirls since it makes them even more attractive. [spoiler]Notice that there are quite some sexual themes in the original version of this VN, you can still enable it on steam by an add-on system; albeit I still recommend you to play this VN with a feeling of ''pure'' love, not that kind of ''feeling''.[/spoiler]  Positive remarks +E-mote which makes this game more lively +dynamic and romantic soundtracks  +very well-designed graphics +actually appropriate for all ages if you play the steam version +a different genre of characters- cats!^^  Negative remarks -the R18 version (or positive for ''some'' players) -a little too short

Simply put, the story and dialogue made me go from seeing these girls as nothing more than sexual objects for me to unleash my heavy load into, to seeing them more as my own daughters. So therefore, when it came to the sex scenes, i felt like I was nailing my own daughters which btw, I'm not fond of since i'm not american. The second sex scene comes at the end of the game and then thats it. They're alright I guess but they're kind of boring. OVERALL: This game is worthless without the hentai patch and even with it, it's still not that good. I only purchased because it was on sale for like 80% off. Had I known how less than average this game would have been, I'm not sure I would have even bought it for a price even that low. Basically, If its the sex scenes you're looking for, just find them online. If it's the story you're interested in, Don't bother, it's garbage. comentarios: It's a great survival horror, when you're not being viciously assualted by the Cat Human Hybrid Mutants you're being tormented and emotionally abused by them. This game is hard for new players to get into, it has many advanced mechanics and follows a very emotional, dark and horrific underlying plot.  A recap of my experience with the game: -Moved into a new house to start my business. -Weird things start happening on the first day, two of the boxes in the house begin to move on their own. -Two Cat Human Hybrid Mutants leap out of the boxes when I open them. -Absolutely Terrified. -They feign friendliness after failing their intial suprise attack. -Young possessed girl claiming to be my sister brings more Mutants to my dwelling. -A few days pass without incident. -Out of the blue. my eyes are assualted by their true form. -Saved game and hid under the covers of my bed quivering in fear. -The next day I played and things seem okay. Then I'm assualted during that night by the Mutants. -Alt+F4  If you love Psychological Survival Horror games I completely recommend this game to you. This game is NOT for the faint of heart or easily scared.

comentarios: It is more than its thematic turbulence that makes NEKOPARA Vol. 1 extraordinary, actually. Excellence abounds at every turn in this open-world role-playing game: excellent exploration, excellent creature design, excellent combat mechanics, excellent character progression. But the moments that linger are those that reveal the deep ache in the world's inhabitants. In one quest, you reunite two lovers, one of which is now a rotting hag, its tongue lasciviously lolling from its mouth. In another, a corpulent spouse-abuser must find a way to love two different lost souls, each of which test the limits of his affection. Don't worry that these vague descriptions spoil important events: they are simple examples of the obstacles every resident faces. On the isles of Neko Paradise and back home with Shigure, there is no joy without parallel sorrow. Every triumph demands a sacrifice. Overall nice cheap porn - 9/11

comentarios: The cat girls were cute, but the developers overdid the "childlike innocence" and instead it came across as the cat girls literally having the mind of an 8 year old. Unless you are a pedophile, that's most likely not a turn on. I personally wasn't particularly interested in the sex parts and thought it would be cool to play it for the story as the cat girls were adorable and the art style is very beautiful. Sadly, the story sucks and is bland, there is nothing really going on.  Spoilers: You are a guy opening up a cafe, your sister's 2 cat girls mailed themselves to your cafe, you end up setting them up with their own room. You go shopping together and do mundane boring things as well as eat takoyaki while the cat girls act like children. It is really very boring and given that this eventually wanted to lead to sexual stuff, I think they made it very unappealing. Even as a porno this fails because you would have to scroll through huge walls of text to get to any sex parts.  If you like boring visual novels with girlchildren "love interests" and no plot, sure, you'll love it. If you were expecting some kind of story? Nah.  Not worth the money.

comentarios: Nekopara is one of those feel good games (and I'm not just talking about the sex). The plot is very basic, so it's more about the interactions and conversations the main character has with the cat girls. Every moment is an opportunity for the cat girls to act cute, say cute things, and do cute things.  The graphics are beyond par for this type of game, with incredibly beautiful visuals and details, and impressively animated using Live2D. The vast array of gorgeously frilly lolita inspired clothing will make you constantly fawn over how adorable Chocola and Vanilla look. The character voices are also very good. It's a bit on the trope-y side, but it helps tying it all together in a comfortable familiarity. You'll quickly find your favorite character.  Since this is the first volume, a fair bit of the first few chapters deals with setting the stage, and introducing you to the personalities of all the characters. The "plot" doesn't really "pick up" until about half-way through.  One thing I do like about this particular game is the small attention to detail that they've designed. Things like automatically moving the mouse cursor to the center when selecting yes/no for loading/saving. The user interface is intuitive, and the colors are welcoming.  In terms of gameplay, there really is none. It's a non-interactive, visual novel. Don't expect more than that. That's not to say it's a bad thing. It's just to be expected for this kind of game.  If you're thinking about purchasing this game for the sex, you will be disappointed to know that Steam has made the developer completely cut the sexual content. And relatively speaking, that's about 40% of the game! Fortunately, if you google it, you can find an easy to install patch that will restore all the content. So at the very least, buy this game to support the developer!

comentarios: Set in an alternate timeline during the Cold War, the greatest minds of both Russia and Japan combined their knowledge to create a great superweapon in the hopes of destroying western culture. After years of tireless research and 10,000 Gulag prisoners the first catgirls are born. With the catgirls being intergrated into their society western civilizations surrender to their Russian overlords with the promise of an endless supply of catgirls.  The game begins 40 years after these events and now catgirls outnumber the humans with many families owning several catgirls and the majority roaming the streets.You play as Kashou the prototype in a line of Russian bakery robots assinged to a family who own 6 catgirls. Watch him find and lose his humanity as he attempts to manoeuvre the harsh political landscape that is the cat paradise.

comentarios: In one word: What can keeps you from playing with such lovely cat girls? No way. Just buy it and enjoy your fun time playing with Chocolat and Vanilla~  The advanced E-mote system lets Chocolat and Vanilla looks more lively and lovely. And you can also add some, hmm, [strike]exciting[/strike] contents in the game, find it using your internet.[spoiler]Or ask a Chinese friend to help you get it if you feel confused reading Chinese comments.[/spoiler] Download, overwrite directory,prepare your tissues, have fun~  10/10 recommend√  一句话概括的话：萌即是正义√  Sa姐作品，国人画师，画风良心，cv激萌，还自带中文字幕，你问我吼不吼那？当然吼那！ 即使不谈国人情怀，看到这样可爱的猫娘还有这样良心的价格为什么不买买买那√ 即使抛开完全体是个日常向[spoiler][strike]啪啪啪[/strike][/spoiler]游戏不谈，猫娘们也真的卡哇伊，有些天然呆还有些天然萌的猫猫们陪你度过一天忙碌之后，给你轻松愉快的时光。而且本作中以E-mote技术加入的动态表情也让人物看起来更加生动。[u]虽然说人物立绘中加入表情动作等等已经不是第一次出现在galgame之中了，不过能够像这样生动的应该还是比较少或者说是第一个把。[/u][spoiler]而且打补丁之后还有各种真·福利我会说么(手动斜眼[/spoiler] [spoiler]所以说玩这种游戏之前一定要看评论区的说，隐藏在玩家之中的老司机们全天候24小时不间断轮流发车(手动斜眼，记得准备好你的乘车卡[strike]手帕纸[/strike][/spoiler]  10/10满分好评√

comentarios: First and foremost, this game is strictly 18+ so the rest of the review will assume you are aware of that fact and are ok with it  Nekopara Vol. 1 is a simple Visual Novel where you follow the adventures of kashou and his attempts to make his living running a bakery, but there's a surprise in store for him once he starts unboxing in his new home 2 Catgirls, Chocola and Vanilla   The story itself is good enough, I give it a 3.5/5 character development is poor but it has plenty of humor combine with serious moments  But I'm sure if you're looking to buy this game it's for the 18+ content There is a patch avalible on the internet (I just googled Nekopara 1 patch and it was the first result) It add explicit sexual scenes into the game at certain points, they involve the main character(you) having sex with the 2 mentioned cargirls so if you want to play the game with the patches I suggest playing at night, and always be ready to switch to something more normal, like pornhub  The artwork is pretty nice, a solid 4.5/5 for me, I would of liked something that involved a couple of darker colors as well as the light ones common through the game, but that's just a personal preference  In Summary, if you want something only cost a couple bucks and you can use for fapping then this is a easy choice, though I beg you to keep the volume down at certain parts

comentarios: Nekopara Vol 1  The Nekopara series is a wonderful series where its a world of humenoid modified catgirls were they are either pets, partners, or companions, some work as emplyees in the stores of there owners, or some are just friends to the owner or the family and or they can become a life partner to there owner.  The story is about a young man who decides to move out of his families house and start a new life and buiness by opening up a baking store, but it turns out that two of his families catgirls snuck in by hiding in some boxes and thats were the story begins. Thats all ill reveal of the story and plot.  The game is written very well full of funny moments and filled with some sad moments never to much of one type of drama they keep it very even and not repetitive I found myself laughing alot from the jokes and i also felt the feels when it was either a sad or seriouse moment.  The artwork in the game was done very well I love how the sprites have so much movement and such expressions within the game including the sound effects and voice over its a very good combination the devs have done with the game.  The music was composed very well it fits the mood of the situation within the game there is alot of songs within the game so it will not get to repetitive while you play the game.  I highly recommend this game if your a fan of anime,neko's,or just visual novel's this is one of the best vn's I have played in a good while I hope you all will enjoy the game as much as I have   ~Bloodwolf

comentarios: [h1]An actual serious review[/h1] This is the first visual novel purchased I've purchased on steam. The VN itself is very well presented (good VA, music, art). It should be noted that his release is toned down (i.e., H-related content was removed).  [b]What I liked[/b] - Music and Art - Characters are nicely constructed and their VAs are great. - Story was decent. There's not too much exposition which would pull you out of the flow of the story.  [b]What I disliked[/b] - Not a fan of the "imouto" which is almost oppresive with one of the characters. Just not my thing. - Maximum in-game resolution was 1600x900.  [b]Other notes[/b] - I quite enjoyed going through this VN. I'm very tempted to pick up Vol. 2 when it goes on sale.  - Vol. 1 is a passive VN. You just go from one panel to the next with no interaction with the content on-screen. Vol.0 and Vol. 2 are more interactive.  - VA is Japanese only.  - The eroge content has been removed, which requires [b]re-purchasing[/b] the game from the developer at it's true full price to obtain. The steam version is actually half-priced compared to the full-game due to content cuts. Purchase the steam version if you want access to the cards and achievements. Should you wish to have both, there are guides/posts in the community on getting the developer's full version to "patch" the steam version which will get you all game content and all steam content available. Vol. 2 actually has an official content patch that costs extra.

comentarios: What in the Oblivion Steam? When I heard this game has sex cut from it I expected something like Playstation 2 port of Fate Stay Night (excellent VN, play it), where they removed sex completely, and replaced sex scenes with apropriate scenes (storywise), and here we get: "Oh they do have sex, no you're not getting to watch it, you could get traumatized." treatment... OK, I understand that it's actually loli, so I guess there are some issues with showing them, but at the same time it's clearly shown they do get in action, so it's kinda useless censoring it (playing kinetic novel centered on relationship progress with sex clearly happening, but not shown, is like watching soccer game with every goal not being shown). Especially taking into account how Nekopara was created (I mean Vanilla and Chocola as characters).  Which takes me to other point. Why is it not OK to show sex on steam, but it's OK to show dismemberment, gore, mutilation, etc... A year ago friends kid, who for some reason likes to latch onto me asked me to download game for him called Sniper Elite, and out of curiosity, I decided to watch some videos from this series. In one lets play video PC shot a guy from sniper and suddenly game cut to a cutscene where bullet in slowmotion exited gun, hit victims head, and then we got to see how his skull got crushed, brain splattered, and bulet exited on the other side. IN GREAT DETAIL.  That game is not censored on Steam (I could not find any mention on censoring). Why is it OK to watch guys brain being splattered, but not OK to see a naked girl?

comentarios: NEKOPARA Vol. 1 is a phenomenal game; it's respectively one of the most popular visual novels on Steam. Though the main story-line of the game is fairly average without much action, it still manages to keep the user entranced in the game. What it lacks in action, it makes up for in character development; this resaulting in the adoration of the main characters (Chocola and Vanilla).  I highly recommend NEKOPARA Vol. 1 to anyone interested in visual novels. However, if you've only come for the NSFW content NEKOPARA is rumored to contain, I'm afraid you won't find that here. The Steam version of the NEKOPARA series is the non-NSFW version.  I'd also recommend checking out NEKOPARA Vol. 0 for some insight to the story-line and characters of the game. Although Vol. 1 is entirly playable without having played Vol. 0.
