comentarios: First of All, for those who doesn't know this is "STEAM CENSORED" version, which mean there is no S** Scene in it  On to the Review  The game is pretty straight forward, you don't need to do anything but click through the story (LITERALLY, there is even an auto play feature to save you all the problem of clicking your mouse).  Pros :  The art are pretty nice and smooth, it pretty and will satisfy any otaku,anime, and cat lovers. The story is short but still heart warming.  Cons :  It really doesn't have much difference from other VN games, which is a shame cause it has potential to be a bit more original in the story, and this game has LITERALLY 1 path and 1 ending, there are no choices need to be made during the whole gameplay, you only need to keep clicking and move along with the story, which is a real shame that made this game has no replay value whatsoever, considering the short story of the game itself, and for the price tag, its not really worth buying if your not really into the VN game genre or cat girls  Overall, i think this game is really good (even though considering the cons are longer than the pros) for those who love VN games in general, it has almost has everything you wanted from a VN. The cute and loveable character combined with a heart warming story makes up for it lacks of replay value and choices within the game. as for the price it self, its maybe a litte bit too expensive considering you only have 1 story line to play, but the beauty of the art within the game is pretty much worthwhile, especially for those who love VN games

comentarios: The year is 20XX. In what would later become known as the 2nd Great Thermonuclear War, Russia and the United States of America, the two great superpowers of the Earth, launched an all out nuclear offensive against each other. The sheer volume of warheards launched was so gigantic, that many of the missles collided over the North Pacific. This caused the atomic fallout to blow over to the neutral ground of Japan. The pollution reacted with the double X chromosomes in Japanese females, causing over 60% of the population to mutate into catlike hybrids.  In this fast paced first person shooter, you play as a special black ops soldier who is a member of the strike force known as NEKOPARA, callsign "Master". His mission: to eradicate the catgirl abominations with extreme prejudice.  The game incorporates a new morality system of choosing to spare or kill various catgirls you meet during the story. Spare earns their trust, but killing them seperates you furthur from your humanity, allowing you to take more damage in battle.  The choice is yours, decide the destiny.

comentarios: This is the BEST visual novel I have ever played. Not only is the script impressive and the emotions strong, but there is animation, which is both new and rare for visual novels. Steam took out the 18+ content, but even so that is OK. You can buy it with that content...somewhere...a quick google search would bring it to you. Even that content is aquite good to other Eroge I have played. Vol 0 is great as well and reccomended. You meet the other catgirls in it, and just a personal note, I love Maple. There are problems, but they are few in number. There is never really a good spot to stop playing, so I suggest playing in 1-2 sittings, as close together as possible, to get the best result. The MC is kinda an idiot, but that is to be expected. There IS the holy grail of all eroge, just so you know. The godly "Physics meter". It controls how...gravity effects...the...chest area. Final notes; awesome professional artwork, backround-worthy work. Nothing seems forced. The girls are well made, personality and all around design-wise.   NOT RECCOMENDED FOR PEOPLE WHO DON"T LIKE ROMACES OR NEKO (or straight females (this is a male-oriented game) THis should be obvious, but I feel like I should drop this in anyways.  If you liked this (as I did), Vol 2 should be out around Feb 10th, 2016. I know i am going to buy it, for sure. I don't even care if the reviews are bad, I am buying it.   -Vlad

comentarios: Well it took me a few days on and off to finish this game and all of my issues with nekopara volume 0 were resolved in this version. I was happy to see the story was MUCH longer and that really annoying walk is very limited in this version which I was happy about. The story was interesting when I first started I didn't expect the story to go the way it did but even with that being said I enjoyed the story. It had a lot of comedy to the story so that made for an amusing read.  I wish the game had a bit more interaction maybe a story branch but even then I can say it wasn't bad. The images and voice work on this version are just as good as the first volume which I was very happy about. Had some "adult" content in it but nothing you wouldn't expect from a game of it's type. I personally enjoyed the story and I am hoping a volume three will come at at some point. However it didn't leave you with any cliff hanger so I can live with it ending here.

comentarios: To even call this a game is a stretch, its basically a visual novel on your PC.  The plot is so boring, even with the constant hints at incest between the main character and his younger sister and the lolicon background plot between Chocola and Vanilla.  I got this game as a gift, and was kinda eager to play it mostly because I thought there would be SOME gameplay. It's all story and basically two hours of clicking through text before the credits roll. $10 is so overpriced for what you get, and if youre hoping for nudity- there is none. one bath scene with censorship throughout the entire game. Dissapointed, not because of the lack of nudity or fan-service, but because all these reviews just give too much credit to this "game".

comentarios: A short kenetic visual novel. Overall it is not a bad game.  Why not recommended then? Simply because there is really only one single reason to play this game. That being to look at very nicely drawn pictures of catgirls. Apart from that there is really nothing here. So if that is something you would enjoy, by all means go ahead and play. If you are wanting something a little more substantial in terms of content though, there is really nothing here.  The story plays out sort of like a 4-koma. In that there are chapters, but these are further divided into several short vignettes. It is basically a slice-of-life story about a man opening a bakery and training two catgirl staff. In a relationship that later becomes sexual in nature. And yes even this Steam version makes certain you know you are missing sex scenes, they just show the before and after.  I think if this game were a comedy, it would have turned out really great. The style would have fit a comedy really well. But this is unfortunately not a comedy. For such a rediculous background story and world, the game is remarkably terse and serious in tone. There is some situational stuff and jokes, but nothing consistant enough to make the reader have fun. In that sense taking this solely as a story, it is fairly generic and boring. It is just cute girls doing cute things, that personally isn't really enough to carry it.  The main saving grace is that it is short. If it were longer than the 2-4 hours it is, it would have outstayed its welcome being as simple as it is. That said the value for money at $10 seems a little lacking because of that. Vol. 2 really will have to do something to change up the situation a little. Unfortunately I expect it will be more of the same, just more catgirls in the shop.

comentarios: I'm going to admit that I am probably not very qualified to review this title. But I'm going to give it a go anyway. The reason I don't feel qualified is that I didn't understand what the tag "visual novel" meant. I didn't realize that there was no actual gameplay. I thought it was some kind of little cafe-shop-simulator or something. So we'll set aside the head-scratching and slow-realization that dawned over me as I began to understand what I had purchased.  However, I like to get my money's worth, so I did click through the story to see what a visual novel was like. It isn't terrible, but it's also far from interesting. It's cute, I suppose, but even as an avid fan of anime, I wasn't impressed with the narrative at all.

comentarios: My overall rating for NEKOPARA Vol. 1: 80/100  This is a game, that does not have to be taken seriously. Or has to? This visual novel is a lovely, relaxing game, where you can find both amusement, but also deep ideas about love, friendship, loyalty and things, that accompany us in our lives. Let's see this in detail  GAMEPLAY  + Decent animations + Format + Chapter selection o Some anime clichés   I absolutely love playing this game. It is true, that I picked it as some not-so-serious game, but I was pleasantly surprised. The story is simple - the hero, Kaishou Minaduki, is opening a bakery and his two most loyal catgirls are coming to join him.  The Visual Novel format suits this game well, you are progressing through chapters and revealing the destiny of not only Kaishou and his two Catgirls - Chocola and Vanilla, but also support from his sister Shigure and the rest of Minaduki's family Catgirls - Azuki, Cinnamon, Coconut and Maple. Present times are switching with memories in the right time, so the player will not get bored.  Also setting of Catgirls role in society was interesting, many procedures are similar to our in our lives (getting of personal identification card is a metaphore to Bell exam etc.).  Only what bothered me, were some anime clichés, like to much boob shaking (I know this will bring negative points for this review :-D ), but besied that, I liked, how this novel was able to change from completely funny, to very serious and vice versa.  CHARACTERS  + Chocolla + Vanilla + Kaishou + Shigure + Steam cards, backgrounds, emoticons o Azuki, Cinnamon, Coconut, Maple  Also characters shown a variety of personalities. Kaishou is on a big crossroad of his life, full of both hopes and worries. Chocolla is a typical extrovertial person, on the opposite, Vanilla is an introvert. All of this characters are transforming, they are becoming more responsible, feeling how it is to be in love and get closer to someone.  Setting of characters is brilliant, both Chocolla and Vanilla are at the age of the first love, filled with innocence and romantic dreams. Many things are shown metaphorically, but they suit their needs.  Shigure is also important, as a younger sister she looks up to Kaishou, but also gives him important advices. The rest of Minaduki's Catgirls were just an addition, game could be also good without them, but they were not something disturbing.  Also extras as Steam Cards, backgrounds and emoticons are nice and lovely, one of few games with that accesories.  SOUNDTRACK  + Lovely according to the atmosphere + Music player + Interjections  I liked the soundtrack, it was suited for not only funny and smiling moments, but also for serious times and thoughts. Very satisfying, also as the presence of music, movie player and gallery of most conmemorable moments.  Onomatopoeia is a very important part of Japanese games and here it was used perfectly. I did not know, that so many sounds and activities can be pictured in this way!  VISUALS  + Perfect, lovely  There is nothing to complain here about, everything was right as it should be. Animy style is a bit close to Shoujo manga, but it is not overfilled with sweetness. Just several clichés, mentioned above.  SUMMARY  NEKOPARA Vol. 1 is a game that should get its chance to be played. I have to say, that you need a specific mood for playing, and when you have it, the story will catch you to the very end (I finished it in two days :-D ).   I think this game should deserve a higher score, but it is suitable mostly for genre fans and most player out of it, can see this game as childish and disturbing. That is why I have chosen this evaluation.  Anyway, it is perfect and worth to try. Catgirls paradise!  PS: There is a mature version, but I have not tried it. If you would, I will not stop you, but I do not think it is necessary to spoil the nice metaphores of the game. I leave it up to you.

comentarios: Let's do a review without all the jokes here, hm? Nekopara is a fantastic visual novel, both in appearance, and in features. With Steam starting to take a shine to allowing Visual Novels, we're getting a lot of them recently, and it's hard to know what to look for. In Nekopara's case, it's lighthearted fun, certainly a bit perverse, but never takes itself too seriously or goes into an awkward zone that makes you feel uncomfortable.  Sure it's catgirls, but this series knows it's not to be taken seriously, and it knows it's very heavily anime styled, and they don't hold back. There are moments characters get chibi styled, the eyes show silly, emote style expressions, and they really feel very fresh, lively, and amusing all at once.  Characters as shown in the vids feel alive, as they are always moving a bit along the screen. Whether it's their eyes trailing from one side to another or pupils shrinking, it's them bouncing about and getting active, changing perspective, ears perking or drooping, or even the 'chest bounce' or so, the characters are very smoothly done. It doesn't change from panel to panel and sprite to sprite, instead it's animated, and it really feels like they're a bit more lively than your normal visual novel.  As for settings, there are some fantastic touches that make this game so easy to manage. The usual quicksave and quickload is there, but you can add 'notes' to these and your regular saves to really know exactly where you left off. The sliders allow text speed for normal and auto, window transparency, even individual voice volumes per character, music volume, sfx, and just voice in general, really giving you a lot of ways to adjust it and make yourself comfortable with the game.  The english translation is fantastically done, and the series is presented in 'chapters' with even a fantastic intro after chapter 1 that made it feel like a legit anime. Each character is very different, and while it seems to focus a bit more on two in particular, every character gets a lot of love and spotlight.  Overall, I've always been a huge fan of visual novels, from the really deep stories, to sometimes a fun and lighthearted one, and sometimes a few are forgotten or just aren't worth completeing. Nekopara though is not one that will fade away from my mind any time soon, and is worth the playthrough. Great sound, fantastic voicing, beautiful animation, user friendly, and just silly, fun, and adorable ride worth taking.

comentarios: I feel that if you are reading this you know what this is. Its a visual novel starring mainly 2 Catgirls and a mainly faceless protag with no choices. If you are looking for hardcore then I say look elsewhere. But what story is there is interesting and I was able to stay invested enough in the characters to see it through to the end. To be honest the H-Scenes really just gave more context to the story as you get to see how the relationship is developing between them all.  I paid $5 for it on sale, and it was worth it. While I dont see myself going through it again it was about 7 hours and change in length. Thats not a bad ratio. Might pick up Vol.2 as well. I would say probably even worth the buy at $10, but thats my opinion. I enjoyed it, you might too.

comentarios: Yes, there is an R-18 patch. No, you're not really missing out on too much if you don't patch your game. It's pretty obvious what's going on and, if you *really* want to see, that's what Tumblr is for. The only reason I didn't patch is because, frankly, I'm lazy.  Story wise, it's very cute and does a good job of establishing characters and scenes before diving into sexy tropes. The art is simply beautiful to look at and all the animations are very smooth. Music and voice acting are also lovely to listen to. Even though their cat girls, they're never THOSE kind of cat girls, if you know what I mean.   Characters are very cute and there is some solid humor in the game too. The only downside is that the story does leave some strange implications that make you want to take a long shower to scrub away the shame though.   While I do wish that Steam had left the R-18 version intact (especially when you have to be over 18 to view the store page), it's really not needed for this title. It's just as enjoyable and explicit without it.

comentarios: If you're one of the people who found the "funny" reviews regarding this game less than helpful, here's a review that covers actual game play:  Totally and utterly adorable. Definitely worth a play if you're into anime of any genre. I know most of the reviews only mention how sexy and suggestive the game is, but it's unfair to ignore the other factors that make this game shine. Nekopara Vol. 1 is also...  Cute. Insanely cute. Funny. Quirky. Tear-jerkingly sweet at times.  The artwork is beautiful and the translation is, for the most part, very good. As you've likely read around, this was originally a hentai game. That being said, the game is very, very short (I finished it in a little over 4 hours, but that's only because I took my time and wandered away from my PC at times). Calling Nekopara a game is a stretch, however: it's a visual novel through and through. You click, you read, you enjoy the story presented to you. Plain and simple. But that isn't to say it isn't worth a look--especially if you can get a deal for it. I'm happy to say I played through this from start to finish and enjoyed it in it's entirety.

comentarios: tl;dr: 5/10. It's all right. Mostly just cute stuff and a lot of nothing happening.  [h1]Full review:[/h1]  Upon release, I heard Nekopara had become a cringeworthy, BnP-tier meme and unfunny Youtubers were doing let's plays and reaction videos and whatever other garbage that pre-teens love to slurp up. I quickly forgot about this, along with the game, until I saw it on sale once and decided "why not?".  First off, the story. It's certainly existent, but that's about it. Other than NotShirou preaching MUH MORALS at people who really don't want to give him the time of day, the story literally goes nowhere. It's quite honestly on the level of porn without plot VNs, and although the story isn't supposed to be the selling point, the game is strictly a visual novel, so it's worth a mention.   Contrary to this, the technical points were more or less up to scratch, the worst of it being no lower than "subpar". There are a good number of CGs, sprites and backgrounds despite the game taking the better part of 2 hours to finish, and the soundtrack, although nothing really to write home about, doesn't subtract from the overall enjoyment of the game.   Another feature I liked was not the chest bounciness slider (though that was a welcome addition), but the option to play in Japanese. Although this translation isn't as bad as some of Sekai Project's other releases - being barely up to scratch this time - I felt like I got a lot more out of what little story there was once I switched over.  Overall, it's cute girls doing cute things with H-scenes you can patch in. I wouldn't buy it at $10 considering the amount of content, but if this is what you're after, then it wouldn't be a terrible buy if it were on sale. [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/blankaex/recommended/385800/]On the other hand, Nekopara Vol. 0 is an entirely different story.[/url]

comentarios: NEKOPARA is not only a game, you need to think it as book that sucks you inside it once you start, and after that returning to normal life is really depressing and just like CIV, NEKOPARA makes you *play one more dialogue*.  The story is deeper than in Game of Thrones and the characters grow and change as the story goes forward. The game doesnt give you any chooses, but its made so well you dont really need them.   After buying NEKOPARA my life has doubled its value, even tho Ive lost some of my friends and my parents dont look to me the same way they used to before buying NEKOPARA, I still say it is worth it.  When im feeling really down, I turn NEKOPARA on and start new fresh save, and I instantly feel better about myself. Because in this world of cute cat girls, I feel immortal. There is nothing that can harm me, or my precious cat girls.  NEKOPARA truly is Cat Paradise.

comentarios: This is a horrifying tour de force.  In the grim near future, mankind has genetically modified cats into humanoid "catgirls." This in itself raises MANY to question the ethics of the world at large if this were to pass: but it gets darker. They don't have the brainpower of a human, they are essentially children with some cat instincts as far as their minds go. So: without an owner they cannot sustain themselves in human society, and they are not physically equipt to survive in the wild like feral cats do. Not that they could sustain themselves even if they could function in either light because the rabbit hole goes deeper yet. At the time of writing this i have not finished the game but there is no mention of a male counterpart: the species is "catGIRL", they are incapable of (to put it delicately) unassisted procreation. They also go through life with all the biological failings of a cat (going into heat, GREATLY accelerated aging).  In his arrogance man hath birthed a lifeform incapable of anything but being a pet at best and a stray beggar at worst: and that must be (again, delicately put) assisted to perpetuate their species. A race of humanoids too human to survive as an autonomous community or being in the wild, yet too animal and simple minded to go through life in human society fluently.  And perhaps the worst part is that they lack the faculties for the deeper thought on these issues to even realise their horrifying place in the world at large.   If I had to rate it on a number scale, I'd give it a "SCIENCEHASGONETOOFAR" out of Ten it really makes you think

comentarios: All the perverted jokes and silly reviews aside, Nekopara Vol. 1 is actually a very cute/funny read. If you're not super uptight and don't have some vendetta against cliches, it's worth the few hours you'll spend read-watching it, even if you go with steam's prudish version (BOOBS BAD GORE GOOD, right Steam?). I certainly laughed far more than I was expecting to.  Cons: Short-lived story VN, (non-skipping readers will get a good handful of hours out of it atleast), not enough entries in the series. Hopefully it becomes a long running VN series.  Pros: Very soothing soundtrack, with built in music player extras for your listening pleasure. Goofy cliches everywhere, pretty much guaranteed laughs for all but the most uptight/boring/sheltered of minds.  All in all, anyone who likes romance and CATGIRLS!!! . . . ahem, anyone who likes romance, catgirls, goofy cliches, 3rd-person speaking, and general sillyness, will definitely enjoy this.  Now excuse me while I go try and find the...Ahem, 'removed' content. F-For review purposes, I swear!

comentarios: Having completed NEKOPARA Vol. 1, I ask myself three questions: 1. What is the purpose of a visual novel game? 2. Are visual novel games for me? 3. What the flying fuck am I doing with my life?  Playing a visual novel is essentially reading a book with beautifully drawn and animated pictures but with voices to offer that extra bit of immersion. Nekopara is a story about leaving home, running a patisserie and looking after catgirls (I was  especially interested in Nekopara because of my unnatural weakness to animal girls.) What I did find especially interesting is that if you were to collate all the information you find out about catgirls in the world, and try to understand it, it doesn't make too much sense, let alone give a reason for the existence of these scientific 'abominations'.  On the other hand, they're SO CUTE, and I totally want one. Nekopara does a good job of telling a rather sweet story (or erotic story, if you buy the uncensored version) that is in actuality quite mediocre as I can summarise it in about two sentences.  The 'player', if you can call them that, is told the story from their perspective, which is as far as the game goes to involve you. Honestly, I was a bit bored, having just finished 'Hotline Miami' before playing Nekopara I felt a bit psychotic and was surprised to find myself a little disappointed that I didn't get to kill anything in the visual novel (anybody else feel like that after playing video games - perhaps you can recommend a good psychiatrist?) For people who need a dose of "kawaii", who are too restless to watch anime and too lazy to play a 'proper' game.  Ending on a positive note, you can speed run the game, with only one hand, in about 5 minutes or 20 minutes for the uncensored version ;)

comentarios: There are only 3 ways to get this "game".   1.) You like Catgirls and buy this game. 2.) You are a perv and buy this game.  3.) You get this game gifted and cannot decline (like in my case)   Now, im not gonna lie, this game is all about... Catgirls! Surprising, right? Long story short:  Its a Visual Novel about a character (you) moving away from his family to open his own bakery and get things done.  Unfortunately (unfortunately?) 2 old acquaintances of you get "delivered" to you. Chocolate & Vanilla, 2 very charming Catgirls.  Unfortunately (unfortunately?) you can't get rid of them so you have to live with them together in your flat.  Thats the start of this incredible journey.   The visuals are top notch, the dialog is acceptable and the fan service is great. (even better once you get your hands on the uncens... i mean, advanced version... so i've heard)  One small thing to add from my side: Don't play this when relatives are around, don't play this while being online, under no circumstances point out that you own it / play it / like it and ... don't forget to patch before you play.  Rating it 10/10. As a visual novel - good! As a game, trying to please the specific audience - great!

comentarios: Do you have a lock on your door? Then you're going to love NEKOPARA! The voice acting is great as well as the jiggle animations. The story is about a baker or someshit, who cares, cat girls cat girls cat girls cat girls cat girls. Durring the game you encounter the first enemy of the series, your disgusting little sister who tries to incest your ass, but you quickly shoot her down so you can get it on with cat ears and fluffy tails. comentarios: OK let's get the first thing out of the way: this is a kinetic novel, as in a visual novel with absolutely no choices. The characters are very well animated and the voice acting in Japanese is fantastic, at the level of "real" anime. The catgirl characters are very, very cute. The story lasts somewhere between 4.5 and 5 hours if you have it on auto-play. On the basis of these things I do recommend it.  There are some negative points though. A small negative point is a small number of mistakes in the text of the game: an apostrophe that shouldn't have been there, a word that doesn't exist and some awkward phrasing. The story is a bit rambling and oddly-paced in places and I felt like a "real" anime would have probably been paced better. This brings me to another point: I did enjoy this but a real anime would probably have been better with more varied animation and so on. I felt maybe I only enjoyed this so much because I haven't watched a real anime for a while.  In terms of adult content: most of the game is just cute: there's almost zero fan-service but there are one or two pretty adult things in the text (not in the pictures).  Anyway that's it. Please stop reading now because I want to moan about something in the plot but it is possibly spoilery and since the story is the whole thing with this, you don't want to know it ahead of time:  SPOILERY BITS UNTIL THE END    SPOILERY BITS YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED   Ok, so I'm really not some tumblr kind of "feminist" or anything, and I hate that sort of person who goes around being "offended" and "triggered" by everything but really there are some pretty "off" things in this story. You have this whole category of women: catgirls who basically resemble women except for having tails, ears and certain feline behaviour traits, but apart from that they are women. These women are "owned" by "masters" as pets (but basically slaves, I suppose). They are utterly subservient, pathetically eager to please and very naive about the world and have to be told everything. They are used for work and for sex; If they go out on the street without displaying their bell that proves they passed an exam where they have to suppress their true nature, they get arrested. This is not just like the normal "harem" type of anime like Tenchi Muyo, Oh My Goddess or Love Hina: it really is a step beyond that in the treatment of its female characters. Anyway, I'm not really complaining about it or being offended, it's just something I didn't like about the anime.  Apart from that you have the main character saying some line about being a bit confused about seeing his two catgirls as both daughters and lovers which was a bit creepy; the drawing of them both in bed with him they really are drawn as underage; then there's the incestuous masturbation of one catgirl on the other (they are supposed to be twins), and the incestuous love the main character's sister has for him.  I'm just saying really that despite enjoying the story I was creeped out by a few of the lines in it

comentarios: Honestly, this game is way over-rated. There's practically no conflict in the story, and what little exists is solved within a few slides of being created. There are *literally* no choices to make so that kills replayability.  Basically, you're this guy opening a bakery and everything just seems to go your way and everyone seems to love you for no appearent reason. The "love" everyone has for you doesn't feel remotely real and feels incredibly forced. As for the sex scenes, this is the pg edited version that has awkward jump-cuts jutted in there jumping straight to the aftermath when they're asleep and under the covers.  However, I will say if you're looking for a feel-good, happy-go-lucky, cutsie story, then this is for you.  Overall, I'd give this game a C+. It's a passing grade, but it's not all that great.  P.S. If you're looking for fap material, you can put the tissues away, because there isn't any. This had very little effect on my rating, because, tbh, I dislike visual novels that randomly throw in an extremely graphic sex scene here and there, making it risky to play with someone else in the room.

comentarios: 6 catgirls + a loli sister accompany you through out the chapters.  Ok first thing you're a guy named "Kashou" who moved out of his family home to open up his very own pastry shop called "Passitre La Soliel". After he moved boxes out from the truck, he noticed 2 boxes were heavier than others. He checked it out, it was Chocola & Vanilla, family catgirls. From there, the story starts with three of them on a way to become the most popular pastry shop in the district.  The story is straightforward with no multiple choice options of getting through different endings unlike common VN.  Its blant. You cant choose the way it ends since it only has one ending. NEKOWORKS overcome this lack by producing a very beautiful art and outstanding voice-acting. 6 catgirls with 6 cute voice-acters.   Took me 15mins to "ctrl" skip everything till the end for free achievements. There is one achievement "hidden", i had to lurk into the guide and found out that i need to shake the screen to get that bouncy boobs achievement". LOL.  Overall a good score of 7/10 for lack of story choices.  Oh, dont forget to get the 18+ version. Heh.

comentarios: [h1]A lighthearted story... with catgirls.[/h1]  A Visual Novel about a man, his bakery shop, and his catgirls. The story's light and fluffy,  great to read for a few evenings. It's music suits the game's light tone and should not  annoy throughout the gameplay. While sadly there are no choices for the player to make, I assure you that there wouldn't be a reason to. The Visual Novel's elements are modernly made, and makes enjoying the game an easy task. Character sprites are animated in a modern way, which I was strongly impressed by.   [b]-Pros-[/b] [list][*] A happy 'fluffy' story, perfect for a strained heart from all those Evangelions and Madokas... [*]Visual Novel elements are modernised which makes the reading all the more fun. [*]Lovable characters. Cheerful and fun-happy catgirls, must I say more? [/list] [b]-Cons-[/b] [list] [*] Veteran novel readers may find the length of the story rather short. [*] The sexual hints between characters may put off people,  who are strictly there to enjoy daily lives of characters. [*] The story's simplicity may also turn-off those who enjoy a rich, deep story  as there are not even a single choice to be made by the player. [/list] In overall - Nekopara is a pleasant experience. If you're up for some relaxation  accompanied by two lovely catgirls, I 100% recommend this game to you.

comentarios: I wanted to like this game.  But the more I played it, the less I liked it.  The story just didn't appeal much to me as it developed.  The ethics of this society where catgirls are pets despite having basic human intelligence is perplexing, and people having romantic and sexual relationships with them draws further question.  Plus, how do the catgirls reproduce if they're all female and cannot procreate with humans?  Lastly, little sister characters in love with their older brothers is a character archetype that really bugs me.  Story is the basis of a visual novel, and this story did not work for me due to the reasons listed above.  I know I won't make a dent against this game's great reputation, nor will I convince anyone not to buy it, but I feel it necessary to voice my opinion as to why I really didn't enjoy this game.

comentarios: I liked it. Pretty good storyline. Very linear and mostly predictable, but spruced up with enough humour and ‘oh my god lol’ moments that make it enjoyable. There isn’t a choice factor here, so it’s a LITERAL Visual Novel. The fact that the characters aren’t static images but actually move through different expressions in real-time, synced with the audio is a fresh dynamic to what I’m personally used to with VNs, so good job there. As a game/VN, this gets a thumbs up. Not for the price it's at though.  Also, regarding the tone of the story: IT’S SO FLUFFYYYYYYYYYYYY!!!!!!!  I threw up rainbows.

comentarios: Perhaps, a bit to my surprise, but... This game turned out to be quite good.   The story itself, while simple, is enjoyable. It's silly, it's fun, it's told well, and it does the job.  More unexpectedly, though has been just how well the unvierse has been set up. From quite early on, we know how this game's interpretation of catgirls operates, their limitations, how the world they live in interacts with them, and how they integrate into society. The biggest surprise has been, though, that there have been a number of hints of some particularly dark undertones to things going on within the world of this game, many dealing with the consequences of human actions.   I'm looking forward to more, whenever that happens to drop.   P.S. Vanilla is best catgirl n_n

comentarios: Well, playing through this Visual Novel was a breath of fresh air for me, and I did quite enjoy reading through the story.  Aside from that, the novel had some good and bad points in my opinion that need to be noted.  Do note that this is my opinion and to respect my opinion on this game.  Why do I like the game?  1. The Story is interesting, and different that one you would not expect from the Visual Novel genre. 2. The characters are very interesting, and each character plays off one another in interesting and humorous ways. 3. The E-mote system in the Novel is a wonderful addition to Visual Novels.  (Characters can move, seen talking, sway, jump, all sorts of stuff.) 4. The art style is amazing.  What am I neutral about in the game?  1. The Jiggle Physics slider.  Don't really care much about it.  It goes from unresponsive to Armegeddon level movement for anyone and everyone.  I just left it neutral for a more realistic experience. 2. The Earthquake Button... 3.  No dialouge choices... as long as the story is entertaining and fun. 4. Shigure... 5. The English sub could be written better.  I have seen a good share of bad grammar and misspellings in the game.  What do I dislike about the game?  1. The story is interesting, but It really isn't that deep of a story.  I know It's the first volume, so It can be different later on.  but that was a bit offputting when I finished the game. 2. Extreme lack of other minor male characters.  This made me feel like I was in a world losing a lot of it's men.  The only other male we know the existance of is Kashou's and Shigure's father. (I do hope the story includes their parent's in a future volume for a much better story.) 3.  Extreme lack of other character portraits in general.  The only other character that got a portrait was another catgirl you see early on in the story. 4. The Catgirl lifespan.  This was quite annoying that they could read and write in under a year after birth, this making them smarter than humans in that regard, and growing to human size much faster than a human was creepy.  Besides, they are a mix of the 2 species, A lifespan of 35-50 years would be more fitting for them, instead of a cat's 20-33 year lifespan.  (Maple is only 2 years old as said in her trailer for the game.)  Other than that, It still is worth the buy for all the shenanigains that go on in the game, the characters, and the story.

comentarios: Like so many others, I had gotten this game expecting nothing more than an easy fap to nekos. That was seriously the ONLY expectation I even had coming in to the game was sexy catgirls. First thing I did, before I even opened it, was download the uncensored patch from online. Then I actually started playing...  See, the game (story really, there aren't any options) met my very basic expectations, and added substantially. It really made me a PART of the story, I really felt a connection with Chocola and Vanilla! I didn't think of them as the catgirls, I thought of them as MY catgirls. I know that's a looser thing to say, but I mean it.  The story is very touching, happy, and bubbly, and is told with EXCELLENT art and animation. Seriously, they characters were always moving (except in the rare, beautifully made still images), and that little element really added to the story.  Overall, this game was far more than anything I had expected.  I highly recommend it to anyone who likes nekos, and to be perfectly honest you can enjoy it very much even without the uncensored version; the story is DEFINATELY sound enough on it's own.  And as a bonus, there is definately going to be a Vol 2, based on the ending of this and the success of Vol 1.

comentarios: NEKOPARA Vol. 1 is a VN where there are no choices to make. It uses the E-mote 2D animation engine, which allows characters to show a variety of emotions, and adds some physics effects to the characters. Parts of the game are missing from the Steam version, and can be obtained elsewhere.  Story: This story is about the protagonist, Kashou Minaduki, moving away from home to open a bakery. Two of his family's Catgirls, Chocola and Vanilla, decide to follow him there and help him with his work. Kashou, with the help of his sister and the other four catgirls of his family, learns how to take care of Chocola and Vanilla, while managing his bakery. The story is a "slice of life" story and is too clichéd since many elements can be found in VNs, Anime and Manga. The universe/setting of this story seems a bit dark; I still wonder how catgirls came into existence, why some are criminals and some are abandoned on the streets without a owner. There are a lot more questions I have about the universe/setting. Overall, I would rate the story 6/10.  Characters: The personalities of the characters are very clichéd. There is some character development for the main characters. It is really awkward how you only encounter one male character, the protagonist, in the story if I am not mistaken. All other characters, including the police officer, customers, etc., you encounter are all female. Overall, I would rate the characters 6/10.  Music: The music is great. Nice catchy songs, and even has an opening and ending song. Don't have anything to complain about for the voice acting and sound effects, except that there are only Japanese voices. I would rate the music 9/10.  Artwork: The artwork is amazing. Really good animations and physics effects for a VN. Some scenes are reused too much. Overall, I would rate the artwork 9/10.   Overall: I would rate this game 7.5/10. I do like happy endings, the artwork, the physics effects and animations. The story and characters are lacking, and I would not recommend buying this game just for the story; although I do not know why anyone would buy it for that.

comentarios: [h1][b]Score: 6/10[/b][/h1] as a VN +1 if you like anime +1 if you like cat girls +2 if you are into hentai  [b]Similar Games[/b] Tokyo School Life  [b]Summary[/b] The main character has moved away from home and is opening up a bakery. He finds the two cat girls hiding in one of the moving boxes. The game provides a history on why cat girls exist which is nice. Chocola is obviously in love with the main character and Vanilla follows Chocola in everything she does.  [b]Positive[/b] The art style in these games is pretty much as good as it gets for a VN. The facial expressions and animations are all but flawless. The humor parts a great, but don't occur often enough. Strangely the romance comes off as totally normal for the world that it takes place in.  [b]Negative[/b] Well at the end of the day this is still a Hentai game with the Hentai removed so it could be put on steam. Thus the main character ends up sleeping with both Chocola and Vanilla giving you no date sim type options. Although back story is given for why this must take place it still feels very wierd. Wierder still is the fact you have a younger sister that must be the devil because it appears she set it all up for you to get hanky panky with them. The game seems to cover every type of anime fetish known to man and instead of giving you date sim options just has the main character sleep with everybody... which may in later volumes include his own sister.  [b]Conclusion[/b] This game is a strange creature. Somehow a hentai game without the hentai is proving to be a better product even for those with no hentai interest. Maybe this type of title will set a higher bar for the future of VN's on Steam.  [b]Value[/b] Honestly it's probably worth close to the asking price even if your just a VN fan. If you like cute anime girls it's worth full price. If your a cat girl fan it's worth more. If you want hentai go buy the non steam version where it isn't removed.

comentarios: If you're looking to read a cutesy slice-of-life story then you'll probably like this.  Otherwise, if you're looking to actually play a game with a compelling story this is not worth your time. There are no choices to be made and no interactivity whatsoever. It wouldn't be so bad if the story were interesting and compelling but it's really not. Just some lighthearted cutesy stuff with no genuine conflict anywhere in sight and characters who are one dimensional.  The nudity tag is also a lie, in case you buy this game hoping for that. You'd have to go dig up the 18+ patch for the actual mature bits as they've all been cut out.

The feels were acting up at every corner (I nearly went through a whole box of tissues.) The Characters were all so adorable, even if the protaganist was a little dense I can still count him in the line up, as well the animations were superb. I am in love with the story and can't wait for the next installment (seeing as how it was already confirmed.) I give NEKOPARA Vol. 1 a 10/10 I recomend this to lovers of reading (romantic novels mostly) Neko fans, and anyone that enjoys a good/cute story. .........FREAKING ADORABLEEEEEEE!!!!! (Again all IMO)

comentarios: This game has a good length, but it's deceptively empty. For all the claims of a 'great' story, it's mostly fanservice and build-up. Vol. 1 is an apt part of the title because it definitely doesn't feel complete. I think after finishing the storyline you're definitely going to be crying out, "BUT WHERE'S THE REST OF IT?", but that alone should tell you it's a pretty good game. I'm disappointed that the story didn't develop as much as I hoped it would, but I can't argue that I was delighted the whole time I was playing due to the colorful characters and the question of where everything was leading (although unsatisfactorily answered). As part of a series this is a great start, but woefully inadequate (especially compared to fantastic FREE novels like Katawa Shoujo) as a standalone VN.   But catgirls are fucking cute so 10/10.

comentarios: The game and story was great. Light and Bubbly... the only thing I found that was kinda uneeded rather ironically for a H-Visual Novel was the actual Hentai Scenes themselves. It seemed kinda forced onto a story that would've been fine without it, especially considering that they come so suddenly and out of nowhere that it actually slowed the story down in my opinion. (no pun intended) I guess due to this being Sayori's work however some hentai had to be somewhere.   Basically if you purchase this game to only reap the H-scenes... I'd suggest going to Google. You wont miss much at all. However if you want a light-hearted story with excellent artwork, music and satisfactory characters... you wont go far wrong with purchasing Nekopara.

comentarios: Kinetic VN are getting more and more amazing. This one is more like playing an anime than most.  If you like anime this is the game for you. It's colourful, lovely and surprisingly story rich albeit a bit brief.  You play Kashou the most alpha male super baker in all of Japan and live in a world where some god among men scientists have created geneticly engineered cat girls. Where all of them even your underage sister is magneticly attracted to you.  These cat girls are like real girls but better in everyway. They're cute, submissive, have the IQ of a primary school girl, cute and despite being barely a step above real house cats are perfectly being happy being locked up in a home or use at a non breeding slave. Sounds like heaven right?  The cakes you make as a baker give girls orgasms and your family is so rich buying and opening a bakery in your name by yourself is chump change.  These cat girls which cost obviously more money than actual cats in food, hair care and clothing that your middle school sister owns 6 of them. Many of which are only 1-4 years old and have the fully devellopped bodies of girls in their teens and late teens.  You (Kashou) and your 9 month old 14-15 year old bodied cat girls in skimpy outfits run La Soileil, A bad french grammar bakery where you exploit your cat girls Chocola and Vanilla to dance around cutely and sell cups of sugar to suckers for insane prices.   Chocola is a low IQ brunette with bigger emotional ups and downs than an amusement park ride and Vanilla a stone faced albino.      Ok Joking aside it's a damn good VN and has alot to give. No choices in dialog and it's just an anime with no male VAs when set to autoplay. This version has no sex scenes in it and 100% honest to god truth, doesn't even need any. I'm serious, this could stand alone as just a story about cute girls with some lewd-ish moments. The characters are well voiced and it's an interesting world to catch a glimpse of.  The art is spectacular to watch and having it animated in a kinetic VN is better than nearly all before it. This isn't a new concept but it's nice and about damn time stuff like this comes to the west.

comentarios: It's difficult to write a review of such an overwhelmingly positive game, since being fair is relevant hard enough, meow.  The key feature of the game is "very cute", cute enough to dissolve your heart with eye-candies like Chocola and Vanilla.  It made me wish to have a catgirl accomplishes my daily task in Japan. Meow? How come? And yet, it's definitely a common feeling from a lot of us.  Other than that, I am not very sure how to comment it as a visual novel. The length of the story is fairly short { about 8 hours for average gameplay, and I guess we are dying for more }, the story itself is not very...memorable: it's a boy leaves his home for the 1st time trying to make a living by opening a bakery shop himself along with 2 catgirls by his side.   However, with 50% off, I believe it is a no-mistaken strawberry cake that is worth grabbing even just for purely leisure. It is also recommended for the people who's taking a break from big titles like I am. Meow! Meow! Meow!  Scarlet Score: 8.5/10

comentarios: It's Sayori's original characters stepping onto the visual novel stage! The artwork and production values are as high as expected. The novel uses the e-mote system which allows for animations with full CG quality. The story itself is somewhat simplistic but fairly adorable. If you're looking for branching paths or any form of gameplay, though, there are none. It's a few hours of story and considering it's one of the very few high quality from-Japan VNs on Steam right now, it's well worth the $10, IMO.   It needs to be noted that there are two versions of this VN, though. The Steam version is the all-ages version with the sex scenes cut out. The 18+ version is only available from DLsite but it costs twice as much so there is a trade-off. If you want more info about the 18+ version, you can probably find it on the Community Hub.

comentarios: This is a wonderfully made game, with a lot of effort and time put into this, and it shows. The games characters are made perfectly for what they are. I've just beat the game for the first time, and I'm at a loss for words. The voice acting is in Japanese, yes, but it was all made very well. The only thing I can say more is this: I can't wait until vol. 2 is released. I would say the next game, but seeing as how it comes out tomorrow whenever I write this, I don't have to wait long, but that ending! Absolutely amazing! If you like VNs, if you like things that are a bit different, if you like romance stories (I use this 'if' lightly), then you will probably like this game. I laughed at times, was at the verge of tears sometimes, confused at times, was intrigued at times, and I love this game to death.

comentarios: A very well made and polished VN (Visual Novel).  ~A story of a Baker and his 2 pet Nekomimis (Catgirls)~  I never was into visual novels but he linked me this. It was okay considering voice acting, animations, music and chest boun...ci...ness...? "Oohh, it's one of those VNs..." This kind of harem story line is a clïche almost in any Visual and/or Anime. It's popular so go with the flow.  Since it's a Novel of a Visual sensation it features text. And alot of it. If you are here to collect rather expensive steam cards you'll be clicking through this game. If you are a person who likes deep reading, catching character desing and story this is for you.  ~Possible spoiler alert~ Least into 3 hours of auto-advancing things start to "heat up". And what do I mean by this...? As Cpt. Pickard would say: "Set course for Intercourse.  Would I recommend? Yes. I never experienced A VN proper than this. And I didn't care about the "intercourse" the story and the characters are the key here. Funny and sad at the times had me on a rollercoaster of emotions.

comentarios: Well, there're several steps you need to take before playing this game. 1. Buy it without any hesitation. 2. Close any applications which may take up the bandwidth of your network and download it with full speed.  3. Make sure that the doors and curtains of your room are tightly shut. 4. Set Steam Friend status to Offline. 5. Get a nice pair of headphone. 6. (Optional) Prepare a roll of tissue in case of need. 7. (Optional) If you are over 18 years old, you can also get yourself a physical/digital copy of 18X version, which may contain many...eh... enjoyable elements. 8. Get yourself seated and adjust your pose to a comfortable one. 9. Click Play button gently. Besides, if you have any trouble unlocking achievements, please visit forums for help.  Oh, and one more warning, DON'T EVEN THINK ABOUT TRYING ANYTHING IN THE GAME OUT IN THE REAL WORLD! Or... you'll regret that... (you know what I mean ^_^)  Strongly recommended! An Essential Purchase for anime lovers!

I was   disapointed that  it had no mechanism for you to interact  in any way with the characters .  But for the $12   you read  the  book while looking  at the  pictures and listening to the voice acting all of wich is in  a language other than engish either Japanese or  Chinese     if  after you have purchased the  visual novel .  you decide to  get the 18 + pach  which i recomend you do as  the fact that he has sex with the two cat girls changes there relationship and the story . there are  three  scenes with nudity in them .Two of which are sexual the other one he is just bathing them.  I would not purchase this for the  porographic content. As there is not much of it .I found it more funny than erotic but thats maybe just me. comentarios: Nyan.  Cats and breasts.  If you're not into that, there's an actual story. Like, it's not a "Do I say 'YO!' or 'Hello, nice to meet you.' kind of visual novel. It's what a visual novel should be by looking at the words "Visual" and "Novel". As in, a novel with visual aids to help in the immersion and overall feeling of the story. It's pretty fun if you see it like that. And just like any good book, it'll borrow 3-7 hours of your time that won't be regretted.  Do I want more people to buy this VN?  Yes.  Should you buy this VN?  I dunno, it's not free, and I sure as hell ain't in your shoes to decide what you should and shouldn't buy without considering the possibilities and outcomes of siblings, organ issues, family issues, love life, taste in chocolate, and many other things that construct your personality and nature throughout life.  If you came into my house demanding a refund, would I be furious and confused?  Absolutely.

comentarios: In case you're unaware, Valve are forcing all eroge developers to release censored versions on steam. As kotaku points out, there are plenty of games that don't get censored for sexual content, including The Witcher franchise and of course, GTA.  This 'game', in the very strictest sense, is a Visual Novel, the story is completely linear and there are no choices for different paths, having said that, I'm not sure I'd want to spend the time do multiple paths either. The story so far has been pretty boring and uneventful, the visuals are 'nice' especially when streamed to the Gear VR HMD - Chocola' name badge is massive.   It seems that most of the effort has gone into animating the Neko's breasts and stripping content, and while this may be a draw for some, it doesn't quite have the depth you expect from a highly rated eroge.  I'd love to recommend this, but I'm only going to continue 'playing' in case the prequel/sequel improve upon the above points.  Unlikely I would wear a blue penguin T-shirt again.

comentarios: Kawaii nekos... ALL THE KAWAII NEKOS!!!!!!!!!!!     Ok review time now.  So, *YES i did purchase this myself, don't judge until you see my profile info* where do i start on this game. For one it has a long playability but no paths like other games i.e If My Heart Had Wings, Everlasting Summer, etc. So one run through is all you're going to get, it may not seem worth it but look at my hours.. That's with me speedreading, i didn't taking my time reading and going in depth. This is a very emotional anime/Vn i've seen since Everlasting Summer and a few others. [spoiler]For one *spoiler* the protagonist gets sick and nearly loses both the girls because they try to help him... Their faces...... The emotion... The feels!! ;_; And yes i did shead a tear at that part, call me a big baby, go ahead i dare you. I will send you the hentai patch... oh wait you would probably like that *all evil jokes aside*[/spoiler] The hentai patch, like all other VN's, ruins the game for me. But the good thing about it is if you want to see very little hentai *like half of 2 chapters out of 11* then it's not that bad. Most of your playthrough will have you laughing though as well.. Cat girls... or in this case as "I" will call them... nekos! I'm not spoiling much but i will say something, if you don't want a possible harem anime... *sorry if i spelt that wrong* do NOT go after this game, for one the two nekos, at the end it turns into 5, plus your sister making advances at you in the story making it lean to incest, well not actual "advances" more like he leaves the room and she talks to herself saying how she would love to be with him.. All weirdness aside, if you can ge past all of the stuff i said. Pick up this game, it has a bunch of different kind of emotions, a lot of funny, a few sad, most normal or just plain stupid.. yes i'm looking at you with your training scene with vanilla, devs!!! comentarios: Nekopara is a high quality kinetic novel (meaning no interactions, only reading) featuring catgirls and adult themes, although the Steam version is censored unless you apply some shenanigans to it (refer to this Community Hub link: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=370848130). The voice acting is in Japanese with subs for Japanese, English, and Chinese.  The art is extremely well done and fairly crisp. I played in a 1600x900 resolution which appears to be as high as it goes. Fullscreen will give it black borders as the game will maintain its aspect ratio to prevent stretched catgirls (very important). The level of quality that Nekopara has in terms of its art assets remains consistent throughout the entire experience with good coloring, shadowing, and light animations to help give the characters life such as head turning, blinking, breathing, and breast jiggling depend on how you use that slider.  I have no complaints with the music. It has tunes ranging from upbeat to laidback and brought me closer to my inner anime. The game comes with a music player that can Play, Stop Repeat, and Repeat All should you decide to just chill out. The opening song is pretty good.  Finally, the story seemed appropriate for what it was trying to do. It had its fair share of funny and “What is going on?” moments. The story follows Kashou and how he handles the two catgirls, Chocola and Vanilla, coming into his life when he’s trying establish himself in the world as a baker. I don’t recommend thinking too hard about the rules that the world has regarding catgirls as those kind of discussions could lead to very strange places.  Voice acting seemed fine with tones that matched the dialogue. I really liked how they would say some of the verbs out loud. Rub, rub, for example. Or stare. That’s not something I’ve seen very often and adds a silly vibe to it.  Anyhoo, don’t purchase Nekopara for gameplay since there isn’t any. Your decision should be based on your interest in its story, the voice acting, the music, and the art.

comentarios: This recommendation comes with HUGE caveats, especially if the game is not on sale at the moment which you decide to buy it. I honestly don't believe the users should be tagging this with "visual novel", as that implies some sort of player interactivity. This should be referred to as a "kinetic novel", which basically means "just point and click through the dialogue and enjoy the story".  Pros: -The art is bright and cheerful ( I love the cell style coloring). -The animations are more than just a simple fade between two static frames. They are smooth and very much like watching an anime. -Instant fan service/gratification -Super cute, tug-on-your-heartstrings cat girls -The addition of super cute voice acting -Bouncy you-know-what slider  Cons: -The story is nothing to get excited about. Even with how short it is, there was ample opportunity to not go the typical route, but sadly at no point is it unpredictable. -Characters are also very typical. You have the holy trinity of fan service: Super cute, overly excited girl, super shy, reserved girl,  and doting protagonist who just happens to have this all fall into his lap. -The emote system while smoother and providing nice animations as mentioned above, are not really "countless" as suggested in the games description. There are four main poses that get used throughout the majority of the game. -No replay value. Except for that...maybe...  All in all, I'd suggest it as a guilty pleasure. There isn't a lot of depth, but it is fun. Enjoy the fan service!

comentarios: Developed by the amateur doujin company Neko Work’s, Nekopara is exactly what you might expect of such a visual novel with that nomenclature. Cute nekomimi characters, fluffy endearing moments, and the occasional nuggets of merriment wrapped up in the slice of life format. It isn’t much for those wanting more than moe and definitely isn’t a surefire recommendation, but as far as being a pleasant encounter with affable designed archetypes, a unique gimmick, and introduction to a series  it is more or less of an enticing pull into a companies premier work than anything else. As someone who is usually drawn in the by genre in any format, I thought I enjoyed this title, yet knowing how it can be double edged sword, I can say that I mildly enjoyed Nekopara on a surface level, yet by the same token, a very easily forgettable experience with little to offer. With that Being Said I Would Indeed reccomend this title being a care free neko I can relate to this and i indeed found myself emotionally attached to coconut having great art style and develpment she fills the gap that other our now currently filling. ie Rias Gremmory, Hatsune Miku, Asauna, And even the chick From Nisekoi. This Game doesnt try to be somthing its not and i would easily give it 7.5 out of 10.

comentarios: [b][u]Overview[/u]:[/b]  NekoPara Vol. 1 is a relatively short Japanese kinetic visual novel from NEKO WORKS that dazzles in the visuals but falls short in a lot of other areas.  It is the first entry in what I'm sure will be a successful series and functions as a prologue to a world where catgirls are a part of every day society.  [b][u]Reviewer's Notes[/u]:[/b]  Cocerning the eroge aspect and the 18+ version versus the All Ages version, the Steam version of this game is the All Ages version.  That means all the adult content that is in the normal game is cut out or in a few rare cases left in but censored (such as the bath sequence).  As far as I know there will be no official patch or release of the 18+ version of this game on Steam.  There are ways to get around this and those that are interested in circumventing this particular decision should be able to do so easily.  For this review I will be looking at the game as a complete product, meaning the 18+ version.  The All Ages version does not add anything to the game, only remove.  For some people this will be for the good of the experience, for others not so much.  It really depends on how well you do with eroge visual novels and this one is pretty tame all things considered.  [b][u]Story[/u]:[/b]  Without going into too much detail the general arc of NekoPara Vol. 1 is our protagonist, Minazuki Kashou,  moves out to open up his own patisserie, "La Soleil."  He comes from a long line of Japanese confection makers but dreams of doing Western treats.  This causes some friction between him and his family and thus he heads off on his own.  While moving into his new place he discovers two catgirls hiding in boxes among his stuff.  These are our two female lead characters, Chocola and Vanilla.  His family has a whole bunch of other catgirls that his sister primarily takes care of that occasionally make an appearance along with his sister as the story plays out.  The main focus, however, is on our protagonist along with Chocola and Vanilla and follows them through the opening of his new business and their lives after.  It is a sweet, silly, and occasionally laugh out loud funny tale that is pretty predictable.  It is a by the books moe romp, setting up for a full on harem power trip in later volumes, with dashes of eroge fetish fan service throughout.  None of the characters are written exceptionally well.  In the case of the 18+ version you will get to slam in about three sex sequences that come in relatively rapid succession that very slightly will affect your feelings for the characters, but only in a blatant ham-fisted way.  [b][u]Visuals[/u]:[/b]  The first thing you will notice when you play this game is the visuals are stunning.  Visual novels are a dime a dozen, ones with high production value however are much more rare.  NekoPara Vol. 1 goes above and beyond in this regard, which should be expected from Sayori and NEKO WORKS.  The sprites are exceptionally well done and thanks to the dubbed "E-mote System," they are almost fully animated, meaning expressions are ever changing, eyes blinking, hair moving, the works.  This is by far the most impressive thing about NekoPara Vol. 1 and NEKO WORKS should be proud.  [b][u]Sound Design[/u]:[/b]  The voice acting is done very well, assuming you don't mind it being all in Japanese, with dedicated deliveries and a lot of character.  The music ranges from acceptable to down right bland.  [b][u]System[/u]:[/b]  The interface is clean and easy to use.  The font choice is good, very easy to read, and I had zero issue with navigating around and interacting with the game.  The options menu is relatively robust, especially in the audio department, and upon completion you should have a nice full Extras section completely with the CG Gallery, Scenes Gallery, Music, and Movies.  [b][u]Conclusion[/u]:[/b]  NekoPara Vol. 1 isn't a bad visual novel, it does the job it sets out to do.  If you like visual novels and want to support the medium then it is probably worth playing.  If you are a fan of beautiful art then it is probably worth playing.  If you like shallow and predictable but still strangely sweet stories then it is probably worth playing.  And of course  if you have ever wanted to bang catgirls then it is probably worth playing.

comentarios: My rating is a bit mixed. I love the art style and story, the girls are adorable and cute. There isnt much to do...Nothing really requires an action. Some visual novels are that way and I can understand if that is their choice to go this route, but its a bit boring. It be good if you could pick destinations, actions, or pick things/items, just anything really. Otherwise you spend the whole game clicking and thats all. The art style is amazing and beautiful, the tones and texture are clear and smooth for the most part, the only problem is when there is movement it gets alittle fuzzy. I love anime and some visual novel games but it be good if you had choices or something. 6/10 Rating from me

comentarios: Nekomimi cat girls, meido, and ultimate jiggle physics able to make even A-cups have an anti-gravitational bounce. - yeah, this game has dat animu fetish trifecta going on right there.  I really do love the art style. The characters are adorable. I also like how you can switch languages at ease, and the text font is easy to read. comentarios: [h1]Introduction[/h1]  I'll be honest, initially I thought that my main source of enjoyment from the first entry of the Nekopara visual novels would be the sexual encounters (yes I installed the 18+ patch). As I read through, I slowly began to appreciate the personalities of the characters and the world around them. If you are looking for something to fap to, look no further, as Nekopara delivers on that front quite well. However, there is more to this visual novel adaption than eroticism.  Nekopara is developed by Neko Works, a company consisting of the original artist of the manga works, Sayori, and various programmers and scenario writers. It was localized by the famous Sekai Project, who also brought The Fruit of Grisaia and is bringing Clannad to North America. Nekopara is built on the Kirikiri engine, featuring a plugin called the "E-mote" system, which brings the characters to life through smooth animations. The opening song (OP) is Taiyou Paradise, sung by nao. The ending song (ED) is Nekomanma Biyori, sung by Haruka Shimotsuki. Nekopara was released on Steam on December 29, 2014 for $10.   [h1]Premise and Story[/h1]  Nekopara is set in a world in which some humans have been genetically modified to have cat-like features (or is it the other way around?), such as cat ears, tails, and general cat behaviour. These humanoid cats are deemed "catgirls" and are a common component of Japanese families. They are treated like normal pets and important members of the family. They can understand and communicate with humans at a basic level, although the complexities of human emotions and societal structure remain incomprehensible. In order for a catgirl to be trusted on their own in the world, they must take a Bell exam so that they can earn a Bell. These Bells signify that the catgirl wearing them is fit to walk among humans, and that their owner(s) have educated them sufficently.  The story starts with the protagonist, Minaduki Kashou, moving out of his parents' house to start up his own bakery, Patisserie La Soleil. The grammatical error is explained, I assure you. As he is unpacking his things, two medium sized boxes catch his attention. Two catgirls, the energetic, enthusiastic Chocola and the soft-spoken, subtle Vanilla spring out of the boxes, greeting their master. Kashou's younger sister, Shigure, smuggled them aboard the moving truck so that they could assist Kashou in his business. Over the course of Volume 1, the catgirls develop romantic feelings for Kashou under the guise of physical maturation, then they finally admit their feelings. Despite the fluffy and light nature of the story, there are some emotionally charged moments that enraptured me. [spoiler] Chocola shares some intimate memories of her and Vanilla's childhood early in the novel, and the last chapter involves Kashou nearly dying from overwork and the catgirls rushing to find a doctor. [/spoiler]  [h1]Gameplay and Presentation[/h1]  Nekopara is a kinetic novel, which means there are no player choices. The story is told almost entirely from Kashou's perspective. The player's interactions consist of:  Left Click/Enter: Advance text Ctrl: Skip text P: Makes characters' breasts jiggle Alt-F4: Emergency panic button  The VN is divided into 8 chapters, and each chapter is 45 minutes to an hour long, depending on how fast you read and if you listen to the voice acting (which is superb). If you decide to install the 18+ patch, there are 3 sex scenes spread out between chapters 5 - 7. Without the sex scenes, a readthrough takes about 4-5 hours, and 6-7 hours with the patch. The E-mote system provides silky smooth character animations and movements. To be honest, it's the first time I've seen this much liveliness in a visual novel, so it was impressive to me.   The art style is clean and well presented, with vibrant colours and detailed facial features. The backgrounds are relatively simple, but beautifully rendered. Almost all of the artwork was done by Sayori, the original artist of the Neko Paradise works. Not much to say about the art except that it is alluring and utterly gorgeous to look at.  All of the characters with the exception of the protagonist are fully voiced. In addition to the onscreen characters, there are unseen tertiary characters such as shop owners and passersby that are voiced as well. All audio is in Japanese, although you may set the text and interface to English, Japanese, or Chinese.   Sekai Project's localization is both accurate and humourous. Take a look at my screenshots for proof of this. Listening to the voices and comparing it to the text, I found little to no errors in the translation, and honorifics were kept untouched, which is a personal plus. Keep in mind that I am not experienced in the Japanese language, but I do know basic structure and particles. Take my words with a grain of salt.   [h1]Final Remarks/Conclusion[/h1]  In short, whether you are a fan of anthropomorphized cats or not, Nekopara is a highly enjoyable visual novel. Although the main appeal of this series is the H-scenes, the patch is optional. The Steam version was censored because of Steam's policies and to appeal to a wider audience. A quick Google search will grant you access to the adult files, so don't worry about missing out. Nekopara still offers a complete and cute experience, if a little too focused on romantic pursuits. For $10, I would say it's more than worth the asking price. It's simply [b]nyanderful![/b]

comentarios: First off, there is absolutely no interaction whatsoever, so set the text speed to something you're comfortable with and throw away your mouse, you'll never need it. Also the jiggly bits slider never seemed to change anything.  Lets start with the good parts. Catgirls are cute, bakeries are awesome, the uniforms for said bakery are pretty awesome, and the protagonists sister is adorable. The voice acting is about what you would expect from a title like this, nothing too special but its certainly not bad by any means. I was impressed with the E-Mote (think Live2D animations) system and animations that make the characters feel much more alive than regular old 2D could do, there are issues with this system that I'll bring up in the negative points.  I was extremely disappointed with the utter lack of interaction, no branches in story no choices, nothing. The story isn't that great and the characters don't change or grow much, but that can attributed to this being Volume 1 and also to this being less of an example of interactive fiction and more of a porn game with the porn removed. The scenario feels a bit contrived even allowing for suspension of disbelief about cat-people I never could quite find myself immersed. (I readily admit this is probably a personal failing.) The E-Mote system causes very noticeable stuttering when loading new characters into a scene; I was not the only one suffering from this problem, according to the forums.  On a more personal level, I didn't enjoy the protagonist getting together with multiple catgirls, especially given how many assets their designs reused, it just felt like two versions of the same character and I feel like the experience would have improved by just cutting one of the two characters or having two minor arcs dictated by a choice early on while leaving the one not selected as a background character.  All said, if you're excited for this title, I recommend getting the R18 version. This title is not worth the time without the explicit scenes in it and I don't even like that sort of thing.

comentarios: As someone who is an avid Anime and Manga nerd, this is definately recommended if you like gushy RomCom's.  1) It does have a few erotic scenes, but even they are done sparingly and "tastefully" enough to just add to the devloping relationships.  2) The plot is very lighthearted (which I view as good thing, not enjoying forced drama) and sweet. Had a smile on my face nearly the entire time.  3) Music is catchy, the Voice Acting is very well done, if not original at least quality.  4) The art is awesome. The only VN I've played that had art of this quality was Grisaia no Kaijitsu. (Which really needs to be put on Steam -.-)  TLDR: It's a fairly short, sweet love story with moderately interesting characters and put a smile on my face for a couple of hours. Definately worth the price. But don't play it when your parents may walk into the room. That could get embarassing

comentarios: With full on professional grade voice acting and character design, Nekopara's ~$10 price point is head and shoulders better value than any other Steam VN I've seen so far. It also features music that doesn't loop incessantly and writing that is actually pretty good even translated. If adorable young catgirls is your thing, look no further.  If you're getting into any VNs at all on Steam, get this one. It demonstrates the level of quality and production value we should eventually expect out of VNs coming from western makers.

comentarios: *Mature Warning* NEKOPARA is a...... catgirl hentai visual novel. Unlike the other visual novels I described as Ecchi, this one you can get a clear picture where they cut out the erotic scenes so they were able to sell it on Steam. Having said that, it's not that bad and kind of a cute story once you get past to whole...ummm erotic moments. You read from prespetive of Kashou Minaduki, a pastry chief, opening his own cafe by himself until Kashou get two big and heavy packages containing his catgirl pets from home. They convinced him to let them stay and help him with the cafe. Two things I liked from this visual novel; it's animated and there voice acting although the voice acting is in Japanese, I assume. Also in the options menu, there "Chest Bounciness" slider and a special button on the keyboard that makes the character jump. And I give this a 9/10. *Read at your own Risk*

comentarios: I admit, I played it. All the way through. I got every acheivement because, really, it was just too easy... Physically. Mentally, i was not prepared for this kind of... Software. I never touched a visual novel in my life up until now. Needless to say, i'm very shaken, but i will not let this deter my critique for this game. Sure, i may not LIKE the concept, and i may not LIKE the content, but i can see why someone would very much like it. It just doesn't appeal to me. The game is well made, it works flawlessly, and for my computer, the frame rate is fantastic, and i'd say i have a low-end PC. I'm just shocked how well made it is for this kind of...Software. Simply put, if you like the genere, and you like the concept, you're going to love this game. If you're new to the genre and are looking forward into committing yourself into playing more games like this... Eh, try the free visual novel before buying this. I'd reccomend it if you're a fan of visual novels. Unfortunately, i'm not, but... Eh, this is for those of you who do, so, fuck it. I'm reccomending it.
