comentarios: This game CHANGED MY LIFE. After my girlfriend left me there was a hole in my heart I didn't think I could ever fill again. I was no longer able to find joy in games, so when I first started up this game I wasn't expecting to be so emotionally captivated by a maid cafe story.  I was wrong. The first time I met eyes with Chocola, something moved deep inside me. We instantly clicked... She laughed at my jokes, she liked talking to me... Sure enough, we quickly fell in love with each other. Never before have I seen the raw emotion of true love emulated so purely. But what surprised me is that Vanilla also began displaying affection to me and she won over my heart as well. What can I say, I guess I'm just too much of a hunk! Keep playing and you might get as good as me.  The animation really makes them seem alive. I keep instinctually reaching out to the screen to pet them. The art is not only very cute, but the characters are extremely realistic and believable and you really feel connected to the characters. It's even better than talking to humans. Before this game I had no one. Now I have not one, but TWO cat wives who love me! Who needs anyone else when these beautiful ladies love you unconditionally?  Even better is the immersive programming. The characters always seem to follow my eyes, and whisper my name at night. I can't figure out how you guys programmed that! Great job though.  The game is so good that I'm never going to stop playing. I'm finally happy again. THANK YOU NEKO WORKS!!!

comentarios: Nekopara is a Kinetic Visual Novel (Meaning you're reading a story with no decision making from you, the player.) The story centers around a man named Kashou Minaduki, who moved away from his family, without notice, to start a new life and open up the bakery he's always wanted. However, he is followed by two catgirls named Chocola, and Vanilla; two of the six catgirls that are within the Minaduki family. The two girls want to stay and live with Kashou because they love him, and that he's their "master". This is set in a world where catgirls are domesticated much like cats, so there's an owner and pet vibe going on, but they're obviously more intelligent than cats, and can do more. The rest of the story basically settles around Kashou coping with Chocola and Vanilla while trying to maintain the business and order of the bakery, and how the catgirls are going to affect his life and relationship with them.  This is a rather lighthearted story with lots of cute, funny moments coming from the two girls. A positive is that this story is fully voice acted (In Japanese), has animation thanks to a program called "E-Mote" where facial and body animations are possible, and a wonderful, casual soundtrack that's very memorable, and calming to listen to. There's also a decent amount of CG art that's made for specific scenes, with a little more detail.  Obviously, this story isn't for everyone. Like I said, it's a lighthearted story with funny moments and admittedly heartwarming chapters. You can really get attatched and connected to the characters if you're up for a tale such as this one. The story has lots of moments such as Chocola and Vanilla acting all cutesy and purring, meowing, stuff like that. People would be split on this depending on what you like, but I personally find that super adorable and makes the characters much more likeable.  It's not just that though, there is character development, and the story does actually go somewhere. It's not so much slice-of-life if you were thinking that. It mainly revolves around Kashou's relationship with Chocola and Vanilla, the bakery's business, and the girls earning their "bells" (Which you'll learn as you read along.) There is quite a few things going on, and the story never feels like it's halthing in one spot for too long.  If you like this kinda story, love catgirls, or are a fan of anime, then this is for you, it's vey polished and well done for what it is, and I was honestly surprised and what i got myself into. The story will take about 5-7 hours to read completely.  9/10

comentarios: Story: B- Most, if not all of its story elements can be commonly found in lots of Anime and Manga. However, It's clear that the story is told in a way where few people would find it to be a major problem. Though I must say the story is short - You can probably 100% it in under 2 hours. Art: A+ In my knowledge, this game is one of, if not THE first games to use E-Mote System for its character arts. And the result? Perfect. Music & SE: B+ It's not perfect material compared to the great companies such as KEY's works, but the Music and SE in this game follows and sets the mood well. The voice acting is also a plus. System: A With all the animations and stuff, the game still runs smoothly on an average laptop.  Final Rank: A Recommended. Not a waste of money even if bought without a sale.

comentarios: NEKOPARA Vol. 1 isn't so much a game as it is a powerpoint tour-de-force. I haven't been so satified in many different ways from a powerpoint since I first installed Crysis on my Emachines back in 2008. If you think this is a joke review, then I don't blame you; NEKOPARA does not look like much aside from the cute girls and words dancing under their customizibly bouncy chests, but what it offers is a true deconstruction of the slice-of-life archetype, and this alone makes the journey worth embarking.  I do not wish to spoil much, but NEKOPARA Vol. 1 tackles sensitive themes such as human trafficking, slavery, genetic modification, violations of the Geneva Convention, the politics of a cross-species society, and beastiality. The unnamed town our protagonist moves to is clearly that of a monitored police-state, not unlike that of City 17, where the upper-class rule over the lower-classes with an iron fist. I can say no more, but holy shit. NEKOPARA Vol. 1 does not hold back.  It really does sound like I'm making shit up, but this is honestly not a joke. NEKOPARA Vol. 1 hides it's true nature under what looks to be a shallow fap, kind of like a convincing trap. But unlike a trap, it didn't stop me after the fact. All I can say is that this is a better present than Gender Bender DNA Twister Extreme, and if you had to make a choice, go with this. You will be surprised.

comentarios: The story is as good as Bioshock Infinite, I'm not kidding its that good.  And since it feels more like an anime, i'd go so far as to say it would be my number four, only because the likes of steins;gate, elfen lied, and shin sekai yori already take the top three. The character development is amazing, you don't see that kind of thing everday, It asks extremely important questions that are NEVER asked normally and slams haters in one fell swoop. Does sharing blood make you love someone. No, love is earned. The memories you make create your bonds and just how far you would go for them shows your love. What do family "ties" have to do with expressing your love. Not a damn thing. Isn't being gay wrong? You still haven't realized the physical equipment you're given is just that and has no bearing whatsoever on who you are or who you care for? Isn't love supposed to be a one on one thing? Totally the choice of the lovers and no one else. This story DESTROYS the false concepts society has erected regarding love. And even gets into racist/speciesist issues. Damn perfect 10/10  P.S. I would say the 18 version adds to the story as some of the most crucial character development happens during the ommitted scenes, yes they are a bit tiring and overdone but since its done in service of the story I have no complaints.

comentarios: I loved the idea of Nekopara. I loved the artfully crafted characters and the animations were adorable but i literally just watched a novel. As a player who usually maxes out games but completing every inch and every acheivment and averages about 30 hours in  dating sims, I only got an hour and a half of enjoyment out of this attrocity, and all of it was spent wondering if the game was ever going to let me play. For a game as beautiful and visually enticing as Nekopara, I was gravely disapponted. comentarios: Ahhh this VN has made me fall out of my chair, cry rivers and lose my breath on multiple occasions, generally due to immense amount of laughter or daaawwww moments. Its well written and has nice transitions for whenever something is being taken into reference (recalling an event or such)  I took a while to start it up but once i did there was no getting me to stop it till the end and i can say wholeheartedly that this is among my favourite VNs ive played/read over the years, sure there arent any choices to be made but i dont mind, for the price thats asked id say its worth it. Its not got any big drama in it nor any looming *doom* hanging over it per say, its more Chocolatey with a sprinkle of Vanilla so as to not make it too.... single coloured :-)  Would have to say the production value in Vol. 1 is pretty darn good, didnt notice any bad scenes and the transition between still images to animated ones felt natural. Also love the options (youll see what i mean;-)   9/10 from me (cant be 10 yet as the series isnt done) ^^

comentarios: This is an A+ example of a game that focuses entirely on fan service to the detriment of having anything of substance.  The setting makes no sense whatsoever. Catgirl biology makes no sense whatsoever (and whatever CAN make sense is completely counter-intuitive). Culture with catgirls makes no sense whatsoever.  Nothing works. It's something you have to completely shut your brain off to be able to enjoy because otherwise the fact that nothing makes any sense will completely ruin it.  It is also worth mentioning that I've played games that were far worse in the fan service department that still put a lot of effort into making everything as sensical as possible. It's very disappointing to see a game like this have some potential to be interesting and just bungle it this badly.  (To explain the playcount, I played this off of steam. I only bought it for the achievements.)

comentarios: Personally i would've wish for more neko parts and comedy than the much feelings talking - that's all with my negative points. The art is on highest level and varied with chibi-style beside, the e-mote system makes everything more lively, the music is nice and stays in my ears... like a curse. It has a short but non-stupid story and the hentai parts aren't boring "vanilla" (haha, you understand, like the catgirl... sorry, Vanilla) - even the most worrying domains are done well.  I patched the hentai parts in afterwards and it's not just a few content that would be missing - so i'd recommend it to others too, but gladly it's not something that's absolutely needed, not an important part of the story.  This game filled my Valentine's Day, so i wasted no thought on my single life - quite a blessing. 2nd volume is definitely bought!!!

comentarios: Nekopara (Cat Paradise) Is a very cute visual novel about catgirls being mixed in the world and well about if cats were able to live in human forms.  Story is based on a rich guy who likes baking and opens a baking shop by 'running' away from home and then suddenly... Catgirls appear who are called by Vanilla and Chocola.  It is a cute story but nothing really gets done other then perversion and cats.. lots and lots of cats.  Now other then that the Pros and Cons.   Pros: Music is great and the animations for a visual novel is something I have never seen before and looks well detailed and something that is amazing on your eyes to look at. OH and boob jiggling settings you should max out before starting.   Cons: Not much story but the cuteness and personality of the characters tends to make you forget that there is basically.. not much of a story...  Hopefully they put more story in Vol.2 but I wouldnt complain very much if it was alot like this one.

comentarios: I've been a fan of Sayori's artwork for years now, and I've waited anxiously for a day that Neko Works would produce some kind of game with her gorgeous artwork. It's finally here, and it's everything you could ask for: HD artwork, fully voiced, and a high quality emofuri-inspired animation engine. Seeing these characters come to life outside of art books and short ero comics gives me huge moe feels.  You should buy this if you obsess over catgirls or are looking for another short VN to play. Pick up the original ero release on DLsite too. :chocola:

comentarios: If you ever feel down then you need to play this game.  NekoPara is a lovely game that takes you in the story of 2 catgirls. The storyline is great , also the music makes you feel happy ^_^  This is a true hentai game without the R18 scenes. I would recommend to play the full version with R18 to get the complete feeling of the story.  This is not a dating sim but more a linear story driven game , this game just takes the player as the main character in the game. It's like reading a novel, there are no choices to choose from. You just need to click ( or press the same button on your gamepad ) to advance the story.  After you completed the story you have finished volume 1 then the game ends. The story in this novel game makes you very happy and fun. You will learn more emotions of the characters while you advance. Just play this game in a quiet environment , listen to the voice and music with english subs and enjoy!  10/10

comentarios: Really beutifully animated and even voiced. Must have been a lot of money put into this game. However playing it is a bit of a culture shock. Can be a bit too kawaii for some folks.   I myself found the game to be among the few that makes me feel uncomfortable and embarrased on a constant basis while playing.   There was once a time when I could embrace the ...moe of such a genre but that time has passed for me. If hyper kawaii is your style don't hesitate this VN is pretty refreshing in terms of style.   For everyone else like me you will open this game and be pleasantly suprised by the game and then suddenly overcome with questions relating to civil rights. Do the cat people die at the age of 20 like most felines? Do they have SS numbers? Do they have rights? These cat people seem to be sentient hybrid creatures that humanity perhaps created. Are they sent on suicide missions like many animals during the early space program? Do their lives have less value than a human life? If you hit one with your car can you just drive off without finding the owner the way that it is in the US?  Many questions either way enjoy the game.

comentarios: Writing a review to represent those of us who made a mistake.  If there were less than 100 reviews, I wouldn't submit because it's probably not fair for me to judge.  **I have never seen Anime, nor played a game like this.**  Decided to try it on a whim because Princess Robot Bubblegum from Grand Theft Auto IV makes me laugh everytime I watch it, and I adore Japanese women.    Apparently you need more than a love of Japanese women and a positive genre impression to love a game like this.  I'm clearly out of my league.  I went into it with no expectations, and somehow came away disappointed.  There's no game here, but it's a visual novel, so I didn't expect one.  But for a novel, the writing reminds me of Judy Blume or some adolescent paperback pulp like the Babysitter's Club.  I appreciate the bouncing breasts, but was surprised the animation doesn't strike me as good as South Park: The Stick of Truth... a low bar, to be sure.  Yet reading other reviews, this appears to be an exceptional addition to the genre.  I guess the genre is going to have to evolve before I give it another go, though.

comentarios: Played the demo and definitely worth getting the game, i am not a huge fan of visual novels, i find them to get boring really quickly with too much reading and too much non relevant content.   This one is fantastic, the music is well composed and changes in all the right places, the voices are too cute and just perfectly placed for each character. the storyline is more voiced with little extra descriptive text which is think is great. ui is clean and put together nicely. price is really cheap at $9.99 i would probably buy it even if it was a bit more. also the animations are great, they add so much life to the characters and keep you from dying of the boredom involved in clicking through static content of 2-4 lines of text.   Best visual novel type game i have played by far i would recommend it to anyone who likes these types of games and if you dont like them but your an anime fan who loves cute things then definitely do youself a favor and grab this, support the developers they really did a great job and they are not even charging that much for it. comentarios: Reasons to buy: Decent Slice of Life style story Great cast of Catgirls  Enough drama to make it interesting Incestual undertones (if that's your thing) Semi animated sprites (My first visual novel with moving characers, but I'm aware that it's the norm in Japan currently.) Options to have boobs bounce less or more (Why is this not an option in every game?) If you're a fan of 'Wanko to Kurasou' then this is for you  Reasons to not buy: Reading (This is a visual novel with no gameplay and no choices to make for different endings) Incestual undertones (If it's not your thing, but to be fair it's pretty light on the incest) Not for those sensitive to perverted things  My own thoughts on Nekopara: Being the slice of life anime and visual novel lover I am, I was very excited to see Nekopara show up on Steam. The story, while mostly cliche and predictable, was done well and left me excited to see if a volume 2 will come out. The moving characters don't move all that awkwardly like I have seen from other 2.5d games and it felt very much like I was watching an anime. Depending on reading speed and or what you set the auto-read settings to, you can finish this in 2-4 hours so keep that in mind if you are on the fence about buying this.   TL;DR: Slice of Life story done well - Lasts 4-5 hours max - Cliche but enjoyable

comentarios: In general, I like to quantify the amount of enjoyment I'm having. In the case of Nekopara, the metric I used to gauge my enjoyment is nyas per minute, or npm.   For reference, the famous "Nyan Cat" clocks in at an impressive 397 npm, +/- 2 nyas. While it is theoretically possible to exceed 400 nyas per minute, no human or computer has ever achieved such a feat. So for the purpose of this analysis, I will treat 400 npm as the soft cap for what is technically achievable by game developers.  Analysis:  In the minute long samples I took, the average was at 15 npm +/- 1 nya. During sex scenes, the npm dropped to around 10 npm. Npm peaked when three or more catgirls were on the screen, sometimes reaching as high as 31 npm. That Nekopara could have such a high nya density and still maintain coherent dialogue is an impressive feat to say the least.  Conclusion:   Given that the npm of Nekopara is only 1/26th the amount of npm in Nyan Cat, it only makes sense that the game itself is roughly 1/26th as popular as the internet viral video. This is not to say that I, as an individual, enjoy it 1/26th as much as the aforementioned video, just that given the statistical information above, the disparity in viewership is not unexpected.

comentarios: To start with, The visual novel (because it's hard to call this a game) is for people to whom the anime world is nothing new. It doesn't mean that you might not like it if you are alien with those, but it is rather recommended to know the anime/manga terms.  Personally I have played several visual novels (mostly where you have choice in it) and there was one major point that shines in this game, that is animation; yes this visual novel has mostly animated scenes and characters; also to add it consists japanese dubbing with chinese, english or japanese subtitles to choose, which I especially like. The story is very interesting and reminds me a first visual novel I had played, Wanko to Kurasou. The only things I do dislike is lack of choices as there is only one story in it. It is also short (4 hours for me), but it is just volume 1.  To sum up:  [h1][b]Pluses:[/b][/h1] [list] [*]Good art [*]Consists animations [*]Interesting story [*]Well made characters [*]Upcoming sequel [/list]  [h1][b]Minuses:[/b][/h1] [list] [*]Short [*]Version with +18 scenes not avaliable on steam (without modding) [*]Lack of choices [/list]  Sounds and voice acting: 9/10 Music: 7/10 Art: 10/10 Story: 10/10 Translation: 10/10 (For English version)  [b]Overall: 9/10[/b]

comentarios: Alright,  Besides all the obvious content other reviewers refer to, Nekopara has many other great things going for it, besides the cute catgirls.  The backgrounds are awesome and just as beautiful as the characters. And about the characters, I've not read many VN's with that good drawing style. It's just awesome. Very detailed and very warm. Sound and music are spot on also. They fit right in and provide a very good atmosphere.  One thing though, that I don't like, is the fact that when you want to overwrite a save file or want to quit the VN; the mouse cursor moves to the "NO" button at first. I get the idea that it's funny the first tme.., but after 3, 4, 5 times...sorry. Well, that's just about the only thing that's not very good with this VN. I mean, everything else is perfect: Writing, art, cute characters and fun. Oh, about the hentai thing; this is on the green side, nothing you can't see on youtube.

comentarios: My friend gifted me this. On my birthday. I'm not even joking.  I told him about this Japanese game called Nekopara which is the game that made hentai internationally famous on Steam, and as soon as I told him about the game, he gifted me this.   His letter said,  "Mr. Hentai, here is the cyber girlfriend that you always wanted"  Mr. Hentai-_-..................................  So anyway, I beat the game (More like I only kept pressing the space button since all I wanted to see was hentai), and well, the game is good.   Here are some of the things that make this game good:   1. Fluent hentai animation (Now, this can be seen only if you have the hentai version of the game). Now, what makes a good hentai game, a good hentai game? It is those good animations. There are many of them that only have just the pictures, but this one is the real deal. The animation is so natural, my Steam FPS counter says I am running it on 59~60 FPS on average.  2. Story. Well, uh, I don't know about the story because all I was interested in was hentai   I actually like how this game has 3 languages, Japanese, English and Chinese. Now you can tell hentai games are slowly taking over Steam.   I am expecting more from this maker.   Verdict: 69 out of Oppai   This game deserves those awards:   - OoTY (Oppai of the Year) - HoTY (Hentai of the Year) - PoTY (Pantsu of the Year) - WoTY (Waifu of the Year)   Cheers, my fellow hentai brothers.

comentarios: Wish I had downloaded the demo first or read up about the game before buying! Thought it was a game like Recettear. I did play for about an hour and a half, so I could at least offer up a somewhat informed review for those of you thinking about buying. Which is worth the 10 bucks to me! I probably got closer to two and a half hours through the story though, b/c I clicked through the dialogue pretty darn fast.  I'm not a fan of full-on visual novels where you don't get to make any choices ... but for those of you who enjoy the genre, this is exactly what you're looking for. AAA+ quality "game" as far as art, animation, story and the characters themselves. You'll & truly really fall in love with your cat-girls and even the narrator (you!) is a likable dude, so no one should have trouble relating. Also, they're not kidding with the "mature" and "nudity" user-tags, haha. Tastefully done, still, if you don't find yourself getting a bit, uh, excited, playing this game, well ... you're just not human!  10/10. I have yet to give out a perfect score on any game I've reviewed, but this is truly a flawless piece of art. I personally did not encounter any bugs, glitches, or even spelling/grammatical errors, so I will stick to my perfect score until finding otherwise.

comentarios: I was attracted by the title when I saw steam releasing a new Comic Market release, after I investigated a little bit and decide to buy it full price - I'm the kind of person usually wait for titles to pick up until it went on sale, but the "good" reviews and my curoisity overwhelmed by patience on the title. I "beat the game" in 6 hours and I feel for 10 dollars, this is not bad for a visual novel.  Pros:  High animation quality (In terms of Visual Novel) - The main game is basically reading a novel, but with slideshows involved. I have "played" some visual novels in the past, but this time I'm pleasently surprised due to the movement of the characters are actually pretty good (except for some death stares when they forgot (I think?) to animate the eyes). The characters move pretty realistically (again, in visual novel standards), and the legendary "P" key enchance the gameplay for approximately 200%.  Good voice acting - This is mostly personal preference, but I do like the voice acting in the game. It's anime-y and it gives you the vibes of watching a shounen "full of service" anime. Also I highly appreciate the publisher keeping the original voice cast instead of going for the localization of games (I'm looking at you, Dynasty Warriors).  Cons:  NOT a dating sim - I don't know what steam's definition of "Dating Sim" is (Or better yet, who put dating sim in the tag in the first place), but a dating sim in my book involves choices - choices that you choose determines which girl you are pursuing, but this game has no choices at all, basically it's the "Left click and you beat the game" game. I have no problem Nekopara has no choices whatsoever, but please steam, don't mislead people into thinking they are playing a game which they have choices.  Cutting content - I know that steam is trying to fend off the "made for erotic sensation" games in steam, but cutting content still stinks no matter what the reason is. For those who are not aware: The game is originally R-18, but steam decides to only include the non R-18 content (The original have the settings to enable/disable it). It does not affact the story much (Only 3 scenes are invloved), and there are fixes that enable the content (Check out the only guide in this game for details), but I feel like it's like playing witcher 2 without the sex - It's okay, but it feels weird.  Small typo on subtitles - I did not check the japanese subtitles (as I do not know japanese well enough), but the chinese and english subtitles have small typos and paste errors. It does not affact the game much, and the rest of the translation is top-notch... but just a minor con in my opinion.  In general I recommend this game if you like Visual Novels and the "sweet-sweet" type story, and I'm looking forward to Sekai Project's next game to publish, cause I feel they have enough passion to gather such a new VN to steam, I feel and hope they will publish more high quality VNs here.

comentarios: This game CHANGED MY LIFE. After my wife left me there was a hole in my heart I didn't think I could ever fill again. I was no longer able to find joy in games, so when I first started up this game I wasn't expecting to be so emotionally captivated by a maid cafe story.  I was wrong. The first time I met eyes with Chocola, something moved deep inside me. We instantly clicked... She laughed at my jokes, she liked talking to me... Sure enough, we quickly fell in love with each other. Never before have I seen the raw emotion of true love emulated so purely. But what surprised me is that Vanilla also began displaying affection to me and she won over my heart as well. What can I say, I guess I'm just too much of a hunk! Keep playing and you might get as good as me.  The animation really makes them seem alive. I keep instinctually reaching out to the screen to pet them. The art is not only very cute, but the characters are extremely realistic and believable and you really feel connected to the characters. It's even better than talking to humans. Before this game I had no one. Now I have not one, but TWO cat wives who love me! Who needs anyone else when these beautiful ladies love you unconditionally?  Even better is the immersive programming. The characters always seem to follow my eyes, and whisper my name at night. I can't figure out how you guys programmed that! Great job though.  The game is so good that I'm never going to stop playing. I'm finally happy again. THANK YOU NEKO WORKS!!!

comentarios: So kawaii ,,,^-^,,, Neko <3  Chest bounciness slider added into the options menu? Yeah... this game gets a 10/10 right there. xD  In all honesty though, one of the best animated VNs of all time. The amount of work they put into this is just amazing. Character details and animations are brilliantly done for a VN. They even incorporated the game window into the game, moving the game in windowed mode moves the characters in the game.  Slightly a short VN in comparison to others, story is well done but not the best, personally I believe the story could of been better. There is only one path in the game, but it doesn't effect the game's entertainment at all. When Vol 2 is made and released, I'm sure they'll incorporate more paths and possibly and even larger story.  I will give this VN a 10/10 though, even though the story was slightly lacking, the VN's entertainment was top notch, and the animation is out of the world. Not to mention, it starts the story of a series and opens up for Vol 2.

comentarios: So erm Nekopara.... Right off with the review!  So Nekopara is a visual novel or eroge if you want to call it. Now what's a visual novel? Technically visual novel is like a movie, voice pack, picture book, and usually visual novel are rate 18+ but with steam you have the all age version.  (To get the R 18 Go here -> http://www.dlsite.com/ecchi-eng/work/=/product_id/RE144678.html)  Now Nekopara you play as a guy, Minaduki Kashou. You just open a small bakery in a small town and just as you were moving and clearing your item. you encounter two box which seems oddly out of place.... Meet the two main heroine. Chocola and Vanilla two cute cat girl! Here your adventure start with your two lovely cute cat girl.  Pros:  This is the 1st few Visual novel i played that have animated moving character sprite and it does help you get more into the game then most visual novel does. +Great animation   The game also provide good voice acting, cute infact!  ( granted i don't play japan game with English voice so i wouldn't know how the English voice acting sound like...) +Good voice acting  The character are likeable (just about it) +Likeable character  The Meh part:  The game length is reasonable. i clock in at about 6 hour or so. -/+ depends on how you view it. to me it felt right, any longer will feel like a drag.   Cons:  Ok so in visual novel usually there are choices, which decide which heroine you want to romance with. But this feature doesn't seem to be anywhere in this game... so it took me out of bit and actually. Replay vaule in visual novel are important, by introducing so many character and off no different at all is sad and make  me wish for more. Only reason to actually play this again is maybe in a few weeks or months time. -No choice -No replay vaule.  Conclusion: Do i think you should buy it? Well honestly.... Yes!  If you are a fan of visual novel with tons and tons of cats/Neko then give this a shot. If you are a fan of muti ending, and want different route to play with then.... sadly you wont find any here. But i say buy this to show support!  Support this title so next time we might see more visual novel on steam!  Rating 8/10

comentarios: 4/10 No backstory; is this a different world? Is it a different timeline? If it's earth did the cats mutate? Are they aliens? How did they first meet humans, etc. The overall story isn't particularly engaging.  Quite predictable as well. I didn't feel like I could relate or empathize with the main character at all. In terms of being a vn: visual novels are meant to give the player a sense of control in how they affect the storyline. The fact that the player cannot influence any of the  protagonists decisions in the VN is a fairly big deal and severely affects replayability. The game is based around the premise of "cats that are humanoid" however they don't act like cats. Cats in general I have found to be standoffish and much more self absorbed then they are portrayed in this VN and this causes the feline character to seem much more doglike. The art is amazing however, and the visual effects are quite fluid (transitions, the boob jiggle, expression changes etc.) Music was quite standard with other visual novels. Not bad but not outstanding.  In summary, subpar as a game, subpar as a visual novel but it has nice art and decent music for its genre. Not worth $10 however if you're curious pick it up if it's less then $3.   P.S If you are interested in light novels after this game, and have never read Katawa Shoujo... Go give it a go, I promise you won't be disappointed.

comentarios: Similar to Sakura Spirit; this kind of isn't a game, its more like an book in some aspects.  But unlike Sakura Spirit, Nekopara has actually shown some heart and care, and has put in both voice acting and done some very fluid animations for pretty much all scenes.  The steam version has a good chunk of the adult content cut out; but I am told that it is possible to go find the 18+ version elsewhere; if you have the money for both, you can technically combine them so your playing through the steam overlay and getting the achievements, while at the same time getting the hentai content originally created for the game.  I imagine the 18+ content was left out for child/family friendliness... or else theres intentions to make it as separate dlc content later on. Don't know.  Also unlike Sakura Spirit, I can actually stand to read what the main character is saying.  Not to mention the storyline for Nekopara looks, so far, like it will be far longer than Sakura Spirit, and with a good deal more thought put into it; even if it is sort of more of a "slice of life" modern day fantasy setting.  Would I recommend this? Yeah, the creators did some good work on this, and theres real quality in it.

comentarios: So~~~  Everyone here knows what he or she is in to I hope. The full version is an adult visual novel, this means there is r18 content.  Now, for those that are conserned, the steam version cut out all the r18 content. It is possible to enable the full game on steam if you have the files from the uncut version.  I have played throught the full version, so including the r18 content. Please do keep that in mind while reading the review.    Once again, everyone here knows what he or she is getting in to. Nekopara Vol. 1 is the first chapter about you, you are making a new start by starting up an patisserie called "La Soleil". While you are moving you notice 2 extra boxes, seems like some catgirls from home snuck along for the ride! You start of by wanting to send them back home, but they really do not want to be seperated from you, they plead, they beg and the amount of willpower you can muster start to falter. They can stay.  and this is the start of your adventure ;)  Now about the game itself. I really enjoyed the story, I found it well thought out. Vanilla and Chocola have a good back and forth compatability, and while this may be subjective I really liked the way they voiced them. The voices fit really wel, this has also been done for other recurring characters! I would like to note that on auto reading it will take you just a bit less then 6 hours to finish Nekopara Vol. 1  As for the visuals, this is somewhat unlike a normal visual novel. Normally VN's are like a picture book, the pictures are still and the picture changes when something happens. In Nekopara Vol. 1 small bits and pieces have been animated.  This small addition made it really nice to watch what was unfolding. The background and overall characterdesign are really well done as well in my honest opinion.  The music was ok, nothing too memorable there but it is good for what it wants to do. I have not had the feeling that it was annoying or anything of the likes in the whole playthrough.  Also there is one thing I want to say about the settings. There is a "Boob bounciness" setting, you can set it from no movement at all to gravity defying so~ This was weird to see in the options, but thank you Sekai Project for implementing!  Last thing, more than once I got a message from my friends that looked something like this: "What the heck are you playing?!?!?" So be prepared to be judged by your friends.  Now as for my recommendation, I will recommend Nekopara. I will however say that the r18 version is the one you want. I will play through the cut version to see what the impact of the cut has on the Steam version. The art is very nice, I liked the characters, the music wasn't great but it was passable and there is an very interesting settings option.   Now I just want the Steam trading cards and I'm set. ... ... At least untill they announce Nekopara Vol. 2 :')

comentarios: TL/DR?  adorable and moe 10/10 #worthmoney  I'd like to start off by saying this is indeed an eroge but the clean version is as story-rich as the +18 version.  Really didn't want this game to have any sex scenes to maintain the purity and moe factor of this VN...  GODBLESS They removed the sex scene. I'm a guy too so naturally we all want some X here and there, but I don't want any XX happening when it involves my favourite fictional idol. Judge me all you want and say I'm immature and shit but don't you get frustrated when your favourite anime waifus gets featured in a hentai or eroge? (Unless you're really down-right dirty)  Nekopara is really heart-warming, adorable and gives you a very lovely nostalgic and lovely feeling though  ''If we really love you then even if it's troublesome we want to be with you. That is a reason to want to be with you.'' That quote was enough to make me buy Nekopara the story set out as humanoid cat-girls is really common but this has it that they have the mindset of both a human and a cat even as to get distracted by cat toys. Welp, Nekopara is seriously heart-warming like Little Busters! and lovely like Clannad (Not as sad as Clannad though)  **SPOILERS**   When Chocola was feeling the heat as she enters the ''mating season'', I was really frustrated at this VN that they'll be making this cute, lovely and innocently pure VN into another eroge. comentarios: This game is beyond adorable. The entire story is well-written ((in my honest opinion)), the animations are as smooth as I've ever seen in the past and the artwork itself is fantastic.   While the game does have its "low points", some of it being grammical errors or cheesy story-writing here and there, Nekopara Vol 1 was an outstanding accomplishment. I hope that the developers are very proud of how well they did with this visual novel. I loved every second of the story, getting both versions of the game. The background music is very engaging and appropriate for each scene and chapter. The opening page of each new chapter is very well done and they each gave me a smile.  The story is very well-written, keeping me hanging on every word. Each character was brought out at the right time and presented in such a way that they never got old when ever they were brought back in. The only things I have an issue with when it comes to the narrative is that the sentence structure of "__ did __ when I __  __" I noticed it a lot during the beginning and middle portions of the narrative itself as I went through. Also, there were moments where the VAs could have expressed more emotion into the words they were saying in some parts of the narrative. I'd give examples, but I'd be too worried of spoiling the experience from other people. However, those are the only quips I have about the story writing.  I thoroughly enjoyed the animation of each character model. I feel that the developers should be very proud of how well they turned out. The thing about static character models is that you only get one face most of the time, with the only changes being when the character has a shift in attitude. The use of animated models are exceedingly better ((depending on how well they are done)) can give the player a much better view on what a character is feeling. In Nekopara, there were moments where VAs didn't express the seriousness of some of the situations. However, that was almost immediately remedied by the expression the character models presented as they moved and talked with the spoken words.  I just completed the full version that I got through other sources besides Steam and I cannot wait to see what the developers come up with for Vol 2

comentarios: It’s been a while since I played a visual novel, and unexpectedly this became a reminder of why I like them. Nekopara is dubious to say the least, as it’s a story about a man getting sexually involved with cat girls.  This is designed to provide relief from the horrible reality of every day life. The world of Nekopara is bright, pure, and uncomplicated. It’s full of love and hope. Whatever happens in the world, it’s never sinister, never dark. The most dramatic thing that happens is people getting sick. And because the stakes are so low, it manages to get some drama out of everyday events. The world doesn’t go under, nobody is hurt, nobody dies.   It delivers exactly what it says on the box. Definitely not for everyone. Can’t deny I found it pleasant, and it made me want to play more visual novels. Not because I crave more cat girls in my life. I just enjoy the process of playing them. Because you click to get the next line of text, you feel in control of the pace. Nothing punishes you for wanting to take it slow, or if you blaze through a scene. Unlike games the story doesn’t go on break. Every click advances the plot. Visual novels are their own thing, separate from games, film, books or comics. I like their mechanics, and the possibilities they provide for telling stories in ways which blur the line between mediums.  Nekopara doesn’t try to do much. But for what it is, it’s well put together. It’s enough to make me excited about playing other titles with more ambitious stories. And that’s enough for me to not harbor any negative feelings toward the title. I’m glad Steam has become a place where both this and Hatred can co-exist.

comentarios: I have to say, after playing some of the other VNs on steam, this one stands out above the crowd.  The animations of the characters, while a bit distracting at first, brings a sense of life to the story.  If you are fond of cats, catgirls, or cuteness in general, I would recommend giving this a try.   While this is the edited version of the game, the scenes that were cut out seem to not make a difference in the overall story, but are more or less fap material.  I originally was disappointed, but after finishing the game, I can say that I am perfectly comfortable not having seen the romance scenes in graphic detail, and the rather coy way that the game eludes to them makes it more cute in a way.    Anyhow, this is worth the price in my opinion, and I am genuinely happy that it caught my eye.  I am looking forward to Vol. 2.

comentarios: NEKOPARA isn't a game. It's an amazing Visual Novel, and I recommend it extremely. We play as Kashou Minaduki, he moved out from his home without telling anyone, in order to open his own shop "La Solei" But soon after moving in, 2 giant boxes get send to him; Inside of them are Chocola and Vanilla, the two catgirls from his original home, who want to be with their master. And this is where the fun begins. Chocola and Vanilla are two catgirls who want to be with their master a lot, even when Master doesn't want them to be here, because he wants to have a fresh start: They don't wanna go away. Master was the person who cared about them the most, and they don't wanna leave Master. The soundtrack is pretty great, and fits for each respective scene. Voice acting is done nicely, and all the characters sound extremely cute.  And the animations and art in general, it's so great that I can't even believe it. It's done smoothly, and cutely. In other words, in the best way possible. And if you're trying to learn Japanese/Chinese, then this game can even help you with doing that. There's an option to turn on both, English and Japanese/Chinese subtitles at the same time, so you can learn words easily. As the game goes on, the characters are developing over time, in a very good way. The story is very good too, it introduces every character in a good way, and explains nicely what's going on at all times.   I would tell you a lot of more reasons as to why I really like this VN, but if I did I would spoil a lot of the game, and I don't want to do that.  In other words, if you like visual novels and/or love adorable catgirls, get this game. I cannot wait for vol.2, which will probably be amazing as well.  10/10  *Nyaaaaaaaaa~!

comentarios: First of all, as you should know, this isn't a game. It's a Visual Novel, which is kind of like a book with a more visual focus. Most VNs have some gameplay elements, like picking a choice and thus altering and/or branching the story slightly or majorly. THIS VN HAS NO SUCH THINGS. There is absolutely not one single choice in this, and as such, it can't be called a game at all.  Well, a book is fine too.  Now then, for a VN, the UI in the game is superb. Pretty much only outdone by Majikoi. Let's see now: + The default resolution is 1280x720, but the game has 10 hotkeys for resolution ranging from miniscule 320x180 to 1600x900. You can also stretch the window to whatever you want and use "Lock resolution to (your current window size)." This makes it easy to just stretch the window into 1920x1080 and lock it there. When you next launch the game, the game will remember your locked resolution. - The game tends to go to 1921x1080. If you're autistic like me, you'll be resizing until you finally get the proper 1920x1080. + The game upscales BEAUTIFULLY. I do not know what resolution the ingame files are, but I cannot notice the upscaling pixels at all at 1080p. If the ingame files really are 720p - and why wouldn't they be since that's the game default resolution? - then this upscaling is by far the best I've ever seen. + Full controller support, you can rebind keys in Advanced Settings. + Multi-core support. At least, that's in Advanced Settings... but I honestly can't tell the difference on my computer so it may or may not work. By default it's in 1 core, but you can set it to Auto (why is Auto not the default option...?), 2, 4 or 8 cores. + Steam Cloud support. By default it's on Automatic, but you can manually opt to "Update local save data to Steam Cloud," "Download save data from Steam Cloud" and "delete save data from Steam Cloud." - Overly zealous Steam Cloud support. I'm not sure does the game store your config and savefiles on your computer at all by default - they're stored in Steam Cloud. At least, when I turned off Steam Cloud automation I lost everything until I manually used "Download Save Data from Steam Cloud." I would recommend that the first thing you do when you launch the game is taking off Cloud support (and restart the client) so that you won't get screwed over incase you want to continue playing (read: reading) offline. + The File menu can be hidden with a nifty little X. Pressing Alt will, as always in Windows, bring the File menu back up - this time with a nifty little + if you want to unhide the menu. + Triple language support. The game comes with Japanese dub and the text comes in English, Japanese and Traditional Chinese. There's a separate setting for System as well for the same three languages. + Dual language display support. You can set the text language to Japanese/Chinese and select "Simultaniously display text using System and language setting" and you will get both your System language (English, I assume) as well as Japanese/Chinese. Want to brush up on your moonrunes? No problem: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=368457378 + The E-Mote system, including the famous Breast Bounciness Slider. More of which later (at the very end, actually). + Everything else you'd expect from a quality VN UI, like volume adjustment per character and message window transparency.  Now then, after advertising the great UI... what else is there to say?  The "game" is SHORT. You might blaze it through in two hours and I wouldn't be surprised. This is, however, a cheap title and "Volume 1" so I find this entirely acceptable. For your money's worth... this VN by far surpasses Sakura Spirit (which at the point of this writing) is pretty much the only competitor on Steam. I'd personally recommend even full price on this title.  Plotwise, the game doesn't offer you much. If compared to Sakura Spirit, this game at least has consistency and doesn't feel like short sketches just slapped together. It's just small "slice of life" cut. Other than that, you can pretty much just expect cuteness rather than character development. And bouncing breasts (unless you set Breast Bounciness Slider into "The British Royal Guard" setting like some other Reviewer said).  The Steam version is the "All Ages" version. The full game has pornography which is forbidden on Steam. You can buy the full game from elsewhere (costs roughly double compared to the Steam version) and extract it over the Steam version. If you launch the game with -steam="yes" option you can use the full version on Steam with no problem. Achievements and everything works perfectly. I would strongly advice you against posting screenshots of adult content into Steam Cloud, however.  The English translation is iffy at times. If it was a free game, the slight iffyness would be at a fully acceptable level. This is a commercial product, so it's not acceptable. The demo had a DREADFUL translation and thankfully, the translation has noticeably improved from then. Not to perfect though, sadly.  Voice Acting felt good to me. I have absolutely no complaints. I will not praise any VA into the heavens either, but they did a solid job if you ask me.  Music is not a strong point of the game. There are no fantastic tracks in the game, but no dreadful ones either. Some musics successfully set the mood right so it's not a complete flop.  Sound Effects... ... let me be honest, the SFX of this game are outright terrible. For a commercial product they are pretty much inexcuseable. In the Steam version they might be almost okay, but if you play the full version... eugh.  The strenght of the game when compared to other games is in the E-Mote system. Not something I can properly express in text - I'd suggest you YouTube search "nekopara vol 1 introduction" for the official introductions from Sekai Project. They should give you a pretty good idea on what the E-Mote system does. But if I were to try to explain in text... well, the girls move on the screen. Constantly. This is done by having multiple layers on the girls, and interactions of these multiple layers gives them a very, very wide variety of expressions - even more so since the game mostly has catgirls, which means that they have twitchy ears and a tail. It looks absolutely gorgeous. If I were to complain about something, it is that their up-and-down sway stops whenever they're talking. And that up-and-down sway is a bit over the top to begin with... anyway, it actually makes the game feel better OUTSIDE of the CGs. Because the CGs are static and only have a few expressions made into them. Usually, you want to see the the static CGs in VNs because those are the gorgeous parts - here it's in reverse! As I said, you have to see it to get a good feel of it. A LOT of effort was put into the emotions of all the girls, it truly looks fantastic.  tl;dr; If VNs are your thing, this is a short but quite solid experience. I give it my recommendation and I am looking forward to Vol 2.

Married men may want to sit this one out, but I would say it could make you more romantic and appreciative towards your spouse; clingy if you take it too far. And for any female gamers who may be interested in Nekopara: bless you for being able to step into a male protagonist's shoes and understanding. Part of you will feel extremely satisfied after completion, but another part of you will be left longing for the warm embrace of a lover. IMO, these are very disirable feelings to have, and can only make you a better, sweeter person.  Nekopara Vol.1 is the first part of an upcoming series. comentarios: Lovely illustrations as expected, fully voiced and the animations really help to bring the cat girls to life!  A surprising amount of options for a VN, it might only be native 720p but it still looks and runs great and has many options for different scaling and cropping to full screen for any unexpected screen sizes.  I really like that it's possible to change languages on the fly and also to have multiple languages visible at once if you choose. It really shows the amount of effort that went into this release. It also has controller support which is handy for playing with Steam home streaming on TV.  It's a shame that the AO version isn't on Steam, but that's Valve's fault for believing that it's necessary to push American values on the rest of the world. You can buy the best version on DLsite and paste it over the top of the Steam version's folder for the best of both worlds.  Hopefully we get trading cards and cute backgrounds soon, that's the only thing I can think of that's missing.  Sayori is my hero!

comentarios: Do you like Cats? Do you like girls? Then you will probably like catgirls doing cute things. If you expect a serious story, you are barking up the wrong tree.  Translation-wise(for english at least) its decent, but not perfect. At times you will be like "?!" because the english sounds awkward, but you should still be able to somewhat understand what it means.  Would i recommend it as a bestseller or kamige? No. But if you just want to enjoy cute things doing cute things, its worth the money.  Do note that I played the steam version, not the imported 18+ version to steam, so 5 hours should be approximately how long this game is, unless you read REALLY fast, or slow.

comentarios: NEKOPARA Vol.1 looks like it fits 100% into an outsider’s view of visual novels; a dull, fandom-focused story with pretty girls who do nothing but dote on you. Yes, these catgirls are pretty devoted, but there’s more going on than a simple harem storyline. One can’t help but be intrigued by Kashou’s devotion to baking, understanding both catgirls, and wanting to see everything turn out well. With that said, some may be put off by the sexual storyline aspect which suddenly shows up. Others might be mad knowing they’ve missed out on some scenes due to Steam’s restrictions on adult content. Still, NEKOPARA is a light and fluffy visual novel that fans of catgirls will enjoy their time with.  8/10

comentarios: The  motion  in  this  game  is  fantastic  same  with  the  artwork.  As  a  anime/manga  lover  and  a  person  who  reads  a  lot  of  anime  visual  novels  i  just  cant  get  into  this game. The  plot  itself  is  just terrible  and  the  explaination  for  cat  girls  doesnt  make  sense  either. To  me  its  just fan  service, i  dont  mind  fan  service  but  with  an  unexcusible  plot  with  it  just  unsatisfies  me. Its  very  cute and  moe  but  i  cannot  explain  why  it  bugs  me  after  reading  it.  It  has  a  wonderful  system  i do  admit  but  i  hope  in  the  future  people   will  not make  visual  novels  with  motion  in  it,  that  to  me  will  just  ruin  visual  novels  itself  for  me.  One  of  the  settings  for  it,  is  Chest Bounciness, which  i  find  absurd  and  amusing,  i  can  see  why  people  would  buy  it  because  its very  cute  and  moe.  I  did  get  the  demo  for  this  game  and  was  thrilled  but  when  it  was released  everything  was  off  for  me. There  is  barely  any  character  development,  but  so  far  this  is  just  an opinion. Though  the  characters  personality  is  good  and  i  like  it,  but  the characters  postures  and  tone  of  voice  sounds  weird  to  me,  its  not  flown  well  with  eachother.    I  want  to  spread  anime  love but  not  like this, i  feel  like  the  anime  community  is  just  silly  and is  known  well  for  its  perverted  fan  service,  fan  service  isnt  bad  but  too much  gets  in  the  way  of  the  plot   thus  making  it  look  bad. This  game  offers  tight  clothing  and  a  lot  of  panty shots,  I  feel  like its a starting  point  for  motion  visual  novels.  I  believe  that  motion  visual  novels  wont  be  as  good  as  non  mottion  ones.  Ive  been  watching  and  reading  romance  genre  animes  for  almost  12  years.  I  felt  like  the  romance  in  this  novel  went by  too  fast  that its  unatural  and  has  no  reason  why  they  would  fall  in  love.  I  dont  know  how  the  main character  can  handle  2 l ove  intrests  either  nor  both  Vanilla  and  Chocola  can  deal  with  it.  My final  result  for  this  game  is 4.5/10  but  this  is  an  opinion  by  me  so  dont  let  this  encourage you  not  buying  the  game  i  say  try  out  the  demo and see if  you  like  it  or  not. comentarios: Short version: Short, sweet, and just fine.  Long Version:  I think for the price, it's a bit much. The entire visual novel is about 5 hours long worth to read (And this is the adult version, so cut out 30 or so minutes for the smut) so it's a relatively short for a visual novel, however unlike other VNs, every character portrait is animated with the use of programs like Emofuri (Where each part of the character is held in different layers and are warped to give the illusion of breathing and physics)  The game comes in English, Japanese and Chinese, which is a HUGE thing as this is probably the first Visual Novel I ever heard of that had a simultanious international release. There was no wait time between the Japanese release and the International release. (Even the adult version has English text in it, however expect an additional $10 from you and to convert that money to Japanese Yen)  [b]So what about the content?[/b] It's a short story. You will probably finish it in a single sitting. The voice actresses are skilled, but the main female love interests both sound the same when their have to raise their voices. The window is easily resized and you can mute some characters you dislike (I didn't do this, though I was considering muting the minor nameless characters)  That aside, I think the game is worth it, the content is definately mature, but a lot of the "mature" content seems to have a lazy excuse to occure. Buy it on Steam, buy it on Nekopara's website, either works. It's short, sweet and just fine.  Bonus points because the art was made by a artist known as Sayori who has had her hand in some eroge Visual novels in Japan such as: Phi Age's "Owarinaki Natsu, Towa Naru Shirabe" e-xtreme's "Momoiro Taisen Pairon" And least we forget Sayori's artbook "Neko Works" A supurb artist, who finally has her original characters see a visual novel.

comentarios: Nekopara is a cheerful slice-of-life story about you and the two catgirls who tagged along when you decide to leave the family business to pursue your career in cake making. Beautifully drawn and coupled with the animations and voice acting makes it one of the best presented VN's I've ever played.   The plot isn't really there plus around chapter 5, it starts to feel like a porno (as in 'my-cat-is-in-heat-and-the-only-way-to-help-her-is-to-get-it-on-and-not-read-the-pet-care-book-i-bought-a-few-chapters-ago'). However, the characters are interesting and the sprinkle of humor and cuteness through the game is enough to make you keep clicking forward. Also, small references.   Gameplay wise, it's linear,there are no branching choices at all. You can replay previous conversations (as in replaying the sound) but not 'reverse' back to a previous scene. No option to start at different chapters. You can hide the text box to view the scene better though.  Music is nice and comfy. Fits the cheerful theme of the game very well.    Overall, the game is like a cake. It's sweet and fluffy, but it's not very filling.   Extra notes: - Twins don't mind sharing.  - It can be played with a controller, but once the game starts there is no button to access the menu. - Vanilla is best

comentarios: This game pulls at your emotions as well as any other visual novel.  Even know it lacks in choice (Not counting the options menu) it is not said to need it being a novel.  This is a good way to make a story look the same to a mass which if was just text and no image everyone will  view the characters and such in their own way. I also normally have my text speed to a very high speed but I found  the game would stop at mid word or sentence to force me to take a stop or period allowing it to flow better and seem  more real. Other then that the door bell ringing easily changed the direction of the chat for latter and kept the game  from dragging on. Overall this game has been fun so far and the developers studied and the English publishers clearly   did not skip out or water it down. I truly do not care so much for the 18+ version however it would be nice to have all  content available but doing so keep me from having any problems and I think it could be given as a free DLC for anyone who wants but steam may not like that also. My rating is 10/10 which I would rarely give but they covered so many bases with it that I cannot find much of any flaws and even know this is just a story they sure did make sure you are getting your money for it. I am now just hoping for them to put the soundtrack out.

comentarios: Have you ever dream of a world where humans and neko co-exist.  Do you want to see kawaii neko grills do kawaii neko things?   Well this is the game for you.   Summary:  Nekopara is a visual novel based on the works of [Neko Works] which follows the lives of two neko, Chocola and Vanilla and their Master. They will go though a series of events which deepen their bond with their master.  Rating: 9 nyaas out of 10  Pros: - Neko grills  - Good voice acting - Deep story - Characters that actually move - Beautiful art  Cons: -Slightly generic background music -Censorship (XDD) -Lack of any user imput  My Review:  This game had me always entertain at every moment with moments of joy and sadness at times. What I enjoy the most out of this visual novel was its clear attention to detail with each character's facial movements (also the bouncyness of a certain body feature *cough*). The story is great with the great scripting with each character having lines well suited and the occational joke with the character taken to account. If you are willing to just have a game where you do nothing but read this is the game. The background music could be improved but all in all it does its job of creating the atmosphere of each event.   Note:  This is my first review of a game. I might have a thing for neko grills

comentarios: First off: if you're bothered for it being an all-ages edition, go get the R-18 version at DLSite. It costs 2160yen (around $17).  What has drawn me to NEKOPARA was, in the first moment, the art. Sayori's art looks so great, and I got really happy when I got notice that her circle, NEKO WORKs, was going to make a visual novel. I've had my eyes set on this since it was a Greenlight candidate, and F5'd my way to getting it as soon as it got on Steam (I literally refreshed the page a few times at midnight my time (6PM PST, the release time) so I could get the game ASAP).  NEKOPARA is a heartwarming story about a confectioner, Kashou, and the Nekos around him (though the story focuses on Chocolat and Vanilla, like on all of the NEKOPARA doujinshi by NEKO WORKs). It's a short and easy to read story that will have you giggle a lot, and feel warm inside too. I have to admit that Sekai Project's translation wasn't one of the best (as usual from them), but having played the game in both Japanese and English I feel safe saying that the translation doesn't kill the game's experience (and, the R-18 scene cuts can't be noticed at all).  If you're not looking for something with a serious plot and just have to take some weight off your routine, NEKOPARA is the right choice. If you plan on getting involved with a more complex and serious plot that will take up a lot of reading time, I suggest you go get something else, as this is NOT what you're looking for.  UPDATE: http://imouto.club/ddl/ has a reintegration patch (probably breaks Steam achievements, BTW) for the game to be really full, including R-18 scenes.

comentarios: So my family still think I'm some lowlife living in their loft with my waifu pillows and I can't really hold that against them cause it's true.  I think however, them seeing me on this game has led them to the verge of getting me counseling again but as this is a review of the game I can say, it's fucking worth it.   I played the demo for this game and by God was I blown away. The visual experience is astounding. I've never seen a visual novel look so amazing. The lip syncing is really good, the character animation is spot on and the general art is just brilliant as well. Who doesn't want to be surrounded by kawaii neko girls? That's right. Republicans.  The story is pretty good. You play as some guy who's fucking off to make his own bakery and become fucking Buddy Valastro from Cake Boss. Basically these cat girls who he's been living with while with his family go all Metal Gear in cardboard boxes in a moving truck to tag along with him and the story pretty much starts there.  They also have this OP song and video thing. Fuck me, it's like I'm on an acid trip. That shits amazing, like honestly, fucking amazing. I feel like I've been shifted from a visual novel to an anime. It's pretty crazy. Not only that, they've got a wide range of characters to meet so your not stuck with a few girls.   Might I also add that this game, THIS GAME! Has in the options a 'Chest Bounciness' option. Now, I'm pretty damn sure I'm not the only one here thinking this but DAMN! You know you've found a fucking good game when they have CHEST BOUNCINESS in the options menu. Genius.   Also I'd like to add that the price is great. The game is enjoyable and takes quite some time so for £6.99 full price or however much that is for 'Murica or other nationalities I imagine not that much more.   All in all, 10/10 will get hentai version.

comentarios: This VN is just... That thing right above amazing and incredible. I love the animations (personally, kept chest bounciness on a low setting), and those coupled with amazing voice acting and a very good story are an amazing combination. Anyone who likes VNs should definitely get this one.  The only negative thing I can think about, is that it lacks a windowed fullscreen option. Seriously. When I went into the options menu, I can change the volume level of invidual characters, text speed, auto skip, auto skip text speed, etc.  I haven't followed Neko Paradise anywhere else, but "Vol. 1" obviously tells me that we will hear more about these lovely girls in the future too.  Some may think that the 10€ price tag is high for a visual novel but I think this one was well worth it, with it's amazing voice actors, cute characters and a lovely story. Overall I think this VN is one of the best, if not the best I have ever gotten my hands on, and believe me I play a lot of VNs. I might even replay this game a few times to pass the time until "Vol. 2."  9.9/10 just because no windowed fullscreen.  Vanilla <3  [spoiler]Oh yeah and there's an R-18 rated version which you can find on DLsite.com. Will not link because steam rules.[/spoiler]

Not much drama as I though there would be. -This is a nick pick but the sound effects when something happens are kinda out of place of this VN. -I wish you change choose what to do next! -They should done some mini game with the baking. -The story kinda makes you weird after thinking about it. Even how light hearted the story is. Just some of it makes you feel weird. It's like a MGS 2 feeling lol. -SHORT! It took me 3 hours to go through the whole VN. Extras shouldn't be called extras because it's just story concent they played. (I played the demo before skiping 1/3 of it)  Overview: A fun time killer but wanting more at the end. comentarios: Take some of the best artwork by NEKO WORKS/Sayori, The best catgirl masocts ever and throw them into a feels-full VN. You have NEKOPARA Vol. 1.   This VN is like a roller coaster of feels, Never really going down into deep gut-tearing pain but rather going up with feels and only to go down enough to skyrocket you up with love and affection for these catgirls. Plus as everyone who knows the artwork as well as anyone who goes to any of the Borru sites would be excited to see Sayori's artwork come to life with the E-Mote engine(?) in play. I highly recommend this VN for anyone a fan of either the artwork, feels, or just catgirls in general.

comentarios: NEKOPARA Vol.1 is the first in what I assume will be a series of short visual novels with the aim of making its readers melt with pleasure using a vast and varied array of female, feline, humanoid companions armed with cuteness and, well, catness. One of the first things I realized after starting the VN was that I was most definitely not the target audience for the title, which makes reviewing it a little difficult. While I personally didn’t enjoy the ride, it accomplishes everything it set out to do and does it reasonably well, so I’m going to attempt to cover both sides of the coin to give you an idea of whether this is a story that will appeal to you.  Minaduki Kashou has had enough of his family. Despite belonging to a long line of Japanese sweet makers, he would love nothing more than to open his own bakery, which is what he sets out to do. Just as he is about to complete his goal, however, he receives two unexpected guests in the form of his sister’s Catgirls, Chocola and Vanilla, couriered to him along with the rest of his luggage. Catgirls are, as they sound, female cats in humanoid form, with all of the cuteness you might expect from the mix. If taught well, they can speak and operate almost as well as a normal person, so in this day and age many people have taken them on as “Catpanions”. They’re a massive responsibility, though, and Kashou just isn’t sure he can handle the two while opening his new store. However, the Catgirls aren’t going to give up without a fight and Kashou may soon find a place in his heart and his home for the young felines.  If any of that summary doesn’t sound like your sort of thing, it isn’t. NEKOPARA is a dedicated moege (game intended to be cute) catering to a specific audience and doesn’t aim to appeal to anyone outside of that field. It spends all its energy on the simple goal of displaying cute characters doing cute things, which it does well, so if that’s your cup of tea then it would probably be a fantastic experience. Even though I’m more of a fan of titles with heavy story components I still found myself smiling and laughing during the experience, and I have to acknowledge that the Catgirls are pretty darned cute, so you can be sure that it would be that much more enjoyable to someone who’s into the genre. Speaking of story, there’s really not much to NEKOPARA’s. It’s short, sharp, and doesn’t try to do a whole lot except at the very end in a chapter that seems rushed and anticlimactic. In short, if you don’t think that Catgirls doing cute things are enough to hold up a visual novel on their own, NEKOPARA isn’t for you.  Characterization is as shallow as you might expect it to be, with the heroines showcasing a single personality trait each in addition to the necessary devotion to their owner. That said, there are a range of both humans and Catgirls involved in the tale, with a greater role for the non-main heroines looking likely in future instalments, which is more than enough to accomplish what NEKOPARA sets out to do. I want to take a moment now to discuss the VN’s classification, because it will be important for some potential players. The Steam release that I played is “censored”, meaning that scenes considered R18 have been removed. The odd thing is that borderline nudity, explicit talk about sex and obviously skipped over sex scenes are all still included in the final package. Given that anyone purchasing the Steam version is going to get all that anyway, if you’re after a cute, all-ages moege then that’s just tough, and if you’re after that stuff then why the heck would you buy the Steam version?  One of NEKOPARA’s major selling points is its visuals and they’re worth all of the hype. Character design is great and sprites will talk, blink, tilt their heads, walk around the screen and more. Allowing the animations to complete was a reason in itself for letting each character finish talking rather than continuing on after reading each line, as it gave a depth to the characters that their personalities didn’t. While most of the dynamic sprite features run smoothly, I noticed a bit of lag when the sprites change to new positions or poses without using animation, which was jarring and a little disappointing considering the overall polish of the visual novel. The voice actors perform as well as is usual for Japanese productions and the BGM is also standard fare. One final feature that I find really cool is that you can choose to play in either English or Japanese, which makes the game a great resource for people wanting to practice either language.  Summary – NEKOPARA Vol.1 isn’t for me but for its target audience it could be a lot of fun. The technologically impressive visuals mix with cute, fun characters to deliver a solid moege. If it doesn’t sound like your sort of thing, however, it probably isn’t, as it lacks any sort of compelling story or character development. It’s worth noting that the Steam release isn’t really “all ages”, so if you’re after something innocent then you may want to look elsewhere also.  My Score: 6/10 – Average Projected Score for Target Audience: 8/10 – Good

comentarios: NEKOPARA is a thrilling story about the adventure of an up and coming Japanese confection maker, Kashou Minaduki, and how he struggles to make sweetie sweets and make his business thrive. In this sense, it is very much like Naruto because it is about how our main character overcomes the challenges presented to him. Naruto overcomes his curse and accepts his fate as a human.  Kashou overcomes the bonds of sexual taboo and dives into the deep depths of bestiality with catgirls.

comentarios: First off try the demo before buying. I did and it was the reason why I bought this. The game shows a follow tale of catgirls and their master. Now this game has a nice feel to it others don't provde. Like Live2d motion you have for the Ipad being instilled on this work. The characters move, blink, and react. They keep on screen and make good reactions with their expressions. The character work wasn't wasted. There is continuity and fluid movement. That is the heavy emphasis I saw. Nonetheless the tale takes a nice well drawn turn with many more introduced to the story. It goes on and out introducing more and each one showing their little bit of character. The two cats you have Chocola and Vanilla. These two are constantly in this story and have their interests with you. There are fun moments with more of the cast and the voices are synced. There are ways to change language just look at guides. Also the game supports English, Chinese, and Japanese Language with subtitles. The voice is what did well by it and the expressions I canot deny are cute. The telling of the story is good. OUT OF 10. This would be a 10. Thanks to the sense of this visual novel being able to give more. There is another version. However as of Vol 1. This thing hit top of my chart this year. Not a bad way to end 2014 ^_^ I enjoyed it.  If you get it now, I tell you won't regret it. This offered something other VNs lacked. Sure there's CG but you got to play it for yourself. I won't spoil it but it is good. The characters are all admirable in thier own way. Those who made it deserve the 10 as well kudos to you. Fans of this genre and game bro fist to you. Enjoy as I have ^_^
